revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 14:57:10.000000000', 'message': "Unable to get stdout/stderr from tests

The following change fixes the incorrect if statements in
novaclient/tests/utils.py to allow setting OS_STDOUT_NOCAPTURE
and OS_STDERR_NOCAPTURE (to 'True'/1) to work.

Change-Id: I22efdec84bef78e99d1d95303cadade6011d76a2
Fixes: bug #1192997
"}, {'created': '2013-06-28 09:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'Bring stdout/stderr capturing in line w/ nova

In .testr.conf, we reference OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE / OS_STDERR_CAPTURE
while in novaclient/tests/utils.py we reference OS_STDOUT_NOCAPTURE
and OS_STDERR_NOCAPTURE.  This change brings things more in line
with nova project by referencing OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE / OS_STDERR_CAPTURE
in both locations.

Change-Id: I22efdec84bef78e99d1d95303cadade6011d76a2
Fixes: bug #1192997
'}]
commit_message:
Bring stdout/stderr capturing in line w/ nova

In .testr.conf, we reference OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE / OS_STDERR_CAPTURE
while in novaclient/tests/utils.py we reference OS_STDOUT_NOCAPTURE
and OS_STDERR_NOCAPTURE.  This change brings things more in line
with nova project by referencing OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE / OS_STDERR_CAPTURE
in both locations.

Change-Id: I22efdec84bef78e99d1d95303cadade6011d76a2
Fixes: bug #1192997

commit_message:
Role 'grant' -> 'assignment'

At the Havana design summit, we agreed to replace use of the term 'role
grant' with 'role assignment' moving forward.

Change-Id: I7d31a716a4b754169909c532c2b86e3f03f7a808

git review
Review lines generating log entries.

Removed sensitive data from any logged entry, typically: authentication token or user password.

Change-Id: Ia22fe69b50e332218d6d6d9380679f2d784e03e2

database-has-gone-away errors.

This patch adds a parameter that can configure

commit_message:
Add support for SQL idle timeout.

Previously, nova logged frequent
database-has-gone-away errors.

This patch adds a parameter that can configure
the sql_idle_timeout which can be decreased
to reduce these errors.

More information on this issue can be found here:
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1007027 for more details.

Change-Id: I1b0e2c763b3e5c9d3310bfd36ec0f54189e4996d

[{'created': '2013-07-01 02:10:33.000000000', 'message': "Replace deprecated :rubygems source

Fix deprecation warnings thrown by bundler:

  The source :rubygems is deprecated because HTTP requests are insecure.
  Please change your source to 'https://rubygems.org' if possible,
  or 'http://rubygems.org' if not.

Change-Id: Ifaba2b94d7b47cd32b9bb6eec04cf7f4b89d0411
"}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated :rubygems source

Fix deprecation warnings thrown by bundler:

  The source :rubygems is deprecated because HTTP requests are insecure.
  Please change your source to 'https://rubygems.org' if possible,
  or 'http://rubygems.org' if not.

Change-Id: Ifaba2b94d7b47cd32b9bb6eec04cf7f4b89d0411

commit_message:
Add os-availability-zone extension

* Query /os-availability-zone to get an object representing the configured
  availability zones and their state
* This implements a subset of Nova's os-availability-zone extension

Fixes bug 1195461

Change-Id: Ic0a8eb5a82ca0a4eed3b1e1cd6cf3a4665589307

"}]
commit_message:
engine : simplify resource state check

Simplify the test to check the resource is in a COMPLETE state
(other than DELETE_COMPLETE), so we don't have to update this for
every new action state which gets added

Change-Id: I91286d3d0464b1a71dafd01ac209ea7ded259875

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-28 16:28:37.000000000', 'message': 'engine : remove unnecessary default check_*_complete functions

The default behavior in _do_action is to declare COMPLETE if the
check_$action_complete is not implemented, so these default
functions returning True are not needed.

Change-Id: I2fd1b7da1d39d23abc81e1b9171b053e547b2ec6
'}]
commit_message:
engine : remove unnecessary default check_*_complete functions

The default behavior in _do_action is to declare COMPLETE if the
check_$action_complete is not implemented, so these default
functions returning True are not needed.

Change-Id: I2fd1b7da1d39d23abc81e1b9171b053e547b2ec6

Previously, Quantum logged frequent database-has-gone-away
errors with certain database configurations.

This patch adds a parameter that can configure
the sql_idle_timeout which can be decreased
to reduce these errors.

Defaults to '3600' to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: I4ec0298c76bbf06aef79fe63fb5214afd4a2a703
"}]
commit_message:
Adds support for tuning SQL Idle Timeout

Previously, Quantum logged frequent database-has-gone-away
errors with certain database configurations.

This patch adds a parameter that can configure
the sql_idle_timeout which can be decreased
to reduce these errors.

Defaults to '3600' to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: I4ec0298c76bbf06aef79fe63fb5214afd4a2a703

messages:
[{'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-30 19:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

mmm... 

I did not expect to create a new patch but to add a review to the end of the original patch. 

I would abandon unplanned baby patch and allow the original team working on the patch to consider its content and make the necessary adjustments using a separate patch.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-30 19:18:30.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "docfix apache2 now supports client chunked encodin"

This reverts commit 68cb91097b75a92237bd90caffcd405c3e83cb53

This was a blitz change... and did not give ATCs using swift/apache a chance to evaluate. 

The currently skipped chunked functional tests have not been reinstated.  

Have any tests been made to support that change?

It may have been simpler to touch base with whoever added that remark ;) 

Note that since we are using daemon mode and since chunked is not supported in this mode (at least it wasn't supported several months back) the original remark was needed. 

If this was fixed by some new version of mod_wsgi, please document from which version can this configuration be made.'}]
commit_message:
Revert "docfix apache2 now supports client chunked encodin"

This reverts commit 68cb91097b75a92237bd90caffcd405c3e83cb53

This was a blitz change... and did not give ATCs using swift/apache a chance to evaluate. 

The currently skipped chunked functional tests have not been reinstated.  

Have any tests been made to support that change?

It may have been simpler to touch base with whoever added that remark ;) 

Note that since we are using daemon mode and since chunked is not supported in this mode (at least it wasn't supported several months back) the original remark was needed. 

If this was fixed by some new version of mod_wsgi, please document from which version can this configuration be made.

active/active, the original active/passive page files

blueprint improve-high-availability-support

commit_message:
Refactored active/passive section of HA guide

As part of the restructuring of the HA guide to include
active/active, the original active/passive page files
are now renamed to be prefaced with "ap-" to distinguish
them from the active/active pages, prefaced with "aa-".
The main ha-guide.txt file has also been edited to
reflect this change.

bug 1196096
blueprint improve-high-availability-support

Change-Id: I303f502a641278d1cdc9663381afd4c2be7cc67c

commit_message:
Add requirement on pip.

pbr depends on pip, as does much of the OpenStack development
infrastructure. Be explicit about it.

Change-Id: I23119c1856dc05a78940f8ea75cc4d6be07e29f6

commit_message:
Restructure HA Docs to add Active/Active.

The High Availability documentation is being restructured
to allow for both Active/Passive and Active/Active.  This
commit merely reconstructs the structure; no content has
been added or removed.  That will happen on future commits.
There have, however, been additional files added and linked
in the appropriate places, with "Coming Soon" added for the
currently empty chapters.

bug #1196096
blueprint improve-high-availability-support

Change-Id: Iaea7fb0e41801d25ce293bb22843e116b2e23ef5

commit_message:
Fixup trivial License Header mismatch.

The currently proposed Hacking check H103
compares the license boilerplate header in
source files with a known good version.
Fix up the syntactical-only mismatches with
that check.

Change-Id: Ie8861b9ded858aabb4cebbe9db656e8cccc9efed

commit_message:
Fix references to old swift use of headers

fixes bug 1071085

As noted in the bug, two sections were incorrect in the information
they gave about the use of headers and metadata. This patch fixes :)

Change-Id: I01e26ff1da14f68b79f1201fb1c828d7426abda9

[{'created': '2013-06-06 07:17:18.000000000', 'message': "Port service API to v3 Part 2 and fix xml/json inconsistance issue

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the service
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework

This also fix the xml/json inconsistance issue in update:
1:add root element 'service' for json format.
2:change the child element 'service' to 'binary'.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning
Partially implements: bp v3-api-inconsistencies

Change-Id: I155b100342f26f4ad1d49b6ee1bcca4608ca5549
"}, {'created': '2013-06-08 09:30:41.000000000', 'message': "Port service API to v3 Part 2 and fix xml/json inconsistance issue

extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework

This also fix the xml/json inconsistance issue in update:
1:add root element 'service' for json format.
2:change the child element 'service' to 'binary'.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning
Partially implements: bp v3-api-inconsistencies

Change-Id: I155b100342f26f4ad1d49b6ee1bcca4608ca5549
"}]
commit_message:
Port service API to v3 Part 2 and fix xml/json inconsistance issue

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the service
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework

This also fix the xml/json inconsistance issue in update:
1:add root element 'service' for json format.
2:change the child element 'service' to 'binary'.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning
Partially implements: bp v3-api-inconsistencies

commit_message:
port Service API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Idbf6047378ae00639be29b7102bb8a6b12c84ebb

commit_message:
Port images functionality to v3 API Part 2

The images functionality is moved for the V3 API from core to an
extension and is now accessed via /os-images instead of /images.

Consensus appears to be that we continue to need this
functionality for v3 because some deployers disable the public
image endpoint due security concerns and whether this will be
fixed in glance for Havana. Deployers can disable
this extension if they do not want it.

A further changeset will follow which changes the view builder
to correctly handle the lack of project id in the path with the
v3 API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I1237ad1ab5c58bb2d7cd9460b14666b4b97ef7fc

commit_message:
Port server_diagnostics extension to v3 API Part2

Ports the server_diagnostics extensions and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I2ddf626a539d47884e845d73ec67e9f9169dcb2b

commit_message:
Port cells extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the cells extensions and the corresponding unittests to the
v3 framework.

Merges in functionality of the os-cells-capacities extension to
be the default behavior. Does not yet address v3 TODO of returning
capacity information in the cell detail method

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I24df708b9d6504a355fca0eacd0ffaeb6586610d

commit_message:
Improve Nicira plugin test coverage

Blueprint nvp-test-coverage

This patch improves the Nicira plugin test coverage by:
- adding a suite of test cases for nvplib
- removing unused exception handling code
- removing 'vestigial' code in nvp plugin modules

This patches also fixes a few minor glitches with the plugin
and the fake api client.

Change-Id: Ia319f556a815e5061b867a97d834123786218fec

commit_message:
mysql-server recipe missing openstack include

The address_for library routine is from openstack-common
and to use it, you need to include the OpenStack namespace

Change-Id: Ia295d7b323c094bc26875b03dfa05b0c4dccec2b

commit_message:
Fix logic for handling SNAT rules

Bug 1192610

Fixes and simplifies the logic for managing SNAT rules, based
on the assumption that a chain contains SNAT rules for a single
router.
It also fixes another small glitch with SNAT rules not being
removed when a gateway port is destroyed (the glitch did not
affect operations)

Change-Id: Ia95e375459a1f32e93bbe912a268a8ed13859c69

For the dhcp and l3 agents the first state report will be done
via a call. If this succeeds then subsequent calls will be done via
the cast method.

Change-Id: I82a1d92fc84983b7bb46758db0aee3e3eca1d3be

commit_message:
Ensure that the report state is not a blocking call

Fixes bug 1191768

For the dhcp and l3 agents the first state report will be done
via a call. If this succeeds then subsequent calls will be done via
the cast method.

Change-Id: I82a1d92fc84983b7bb46758db0aee3e3eca1d3be
(cherry picked from commit 0407b59c259b2861b4541e31379e994ea8350b83)

commit_message:
Remove duplicate _check_provider_update from plugins

This patch removes the duplicated method _check_provider_update
and adds a check for it in the NVP plugin that was missing so that an error
is raised if someone tries to update a provider network.

Fixes bug: 1192702

Change-Id: I84e6767f351122f9e5af0cd4ef24d8eaaeb4ccd5

commit_message:
Update code to properly use dict returned from get_gateway.

Calling get_gateway was a late addition to my code to add a default
route in the DHCP namespace.  The code did not properly handle the
dict returned from that method.  This changes it to properly extract
the 'gateway' attribute from the dict.

Change-Id: I9823a31feee7ab333c277fc6e78f366408393155
Fixes: Bug #1195543

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-29 16:16:51.000000000', 'message': "Nicira plugin: Do not expect a minimum number of SNAT rules

Bug 1192392

The code was assuming a SNAT rule for each subnet was always present
when clearing a gateway. If the SNAT rule was removed for some other
reason from the NVP backend, this would have led to the failure of
the whole operation; however, a failure won't have been necessary
in this case, as the final effect of the operation is to remove
the rules anyway.

Also, this patch ensures a quantum router is put in ERROR state if
it is not found on the NVP backend.

Change-Id: Iac1a61342b490d0d971b884e1aa8d9567b15cac0
"}]
commit_message:
Nicira plugin: Do not expect a minimum number of SNAT rules

Bug 1192392

The code was assuming a SNAT rule for each subnet was always present
when clearing a gateway. If the SNAT rule was removed for some other
reason from the NVP backend, this would have led to the failure of
the whole operation; however, a failure won't have been necessary
in this case, as the final effect of the operation is to remove
the rules anyway.

Also, this patch ensures a quantum router is put in ERROR state if
it is not found on the NVP backend.

Change-Id: Iac1a61342b490d0d971b884e1aa8d9567b15cac0

fixes bug 1194917

commit_message:
Fix case with no host_id in BigSwitch plugin

This correctly checks for the case where nova does not
provide the host_id in port creation/updates.

Fixes: bug #1195903
Change-Id: Ic0d714a3977810c6b1144c1e25488f75cc95d0f0

'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-06-29 07:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

IMHO, I would avoid adding commands if it's not absolutely necessary. When you give more than one option to a user to do 'the same thing', that's when the confusion starts.

That said, how do we stand if did something like 'nova boot' does with the --nic optional param, i.e. we could do:

quantum router-interface-add [-h] [--request-format {json,xml}] router-id <subnet-id=uuid | port-id=uuid>

When the tag "*-id" is omitted, subnet-id is assumed. This approach has the following benefits:

- backward compatibility is preserved
- there is no need to add (maintain and test) redundant commands
- backward compatibility can be withdrawn at any point with minimum disruption to the command interface.

My 2c
Armando'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-06-29 07:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-29 07:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Looks good. Not directly related to the patch, it is unfortunate that there is so much duplication between get_vif_port_set() and get_vif_ports(). Eventually, it might be preferable to factor out the collection of key information and implement get_vif_ports() in terms of it. e.g. an internal method along the lines _get_vif_port_keys(keyname) where keyname is either 'external-id' or 'name'. Then get_vif_port_set then is pretty much return the data as a set and get_vif_ports is a for loop over the results that queries for the vif ofport details. I *don't* think it would be a good idea to do this for this patch as it is too far afield, but it might be worth considering as part of a cleanup task."}, {'account_id': 7500, 'date': '2013-06-29 06:08:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Instead of spawning ovs-vsctl for every port on br-int, we just dump the
required columns from the Interfaces table and grab the rows that we need. This
is a big win because the time it takes for ovs-vsctl to connect to the
openvswitch controller is orders of magnitude greater than the time it takes to
parse the rows. In practice, instead of taking roughly 1s per interface, the
agent's periodic task only takes 1s in total.

commit_message:
faster quantum-openvswitch-agent periodic reports

One of two patches that fixes bug #1194438.

Instead of spawning ovs-vsctl for every port on br-int, we just dump the
required columns from the Interfaces table and grab the rows that we need. This
is a big win because the time it takes for ovs-vsctl to connect to the
openvswitch controller is orders of magnitude greater than the time it takes to
parse the rows. In practice, instead of taking roughly 1s per interface, the
agent's periodic task only takes 1s in total.

Change-Id: Idbf32c38e0c4a9c9634c1e4f0e79bd556b720493

commit_message:
dom0 rootwrap - case insensitive xenapi section

As per change https://review.openstack.org/33429 the config sections
became lowercase. This patch makes the quantum-rootwrap-xen-dom0
rootwrap to be case insensitive for the xenapi section.

This patch also changes the default config file to use a lowercase
xenapi section.

Fixes bug 1195781

Change-Id: Ic24feb1a9ad6f8823745b1febd4a0edd54e73498

commit_message:
Support a timeout argument when instantiating a bigswitch plugin

The timeout argument overwrites the timeout value set in the config file.
The change permits any standalone script to interact with the bigswitch controller
through the quantum plugin with customized timeout value without changing the plugin
behavior.

Fixes: bug #1195923
Change-Id: I17954e70d661e7e7d5156c34c08b7c96bb3203ce

commit_message:
Refactored parsing and detection of help arguments.

Simplified the code that detects help arguments (-h, --help, help)
and displays a help message for the client or for a specified command.

Made help arguments position insensitive.

Fixes: bug #1116866
Fixes: bug #1158209

Change-Id: I7f1d746bbe640f225cf480b0a41fa9a59e382984

Only a CIDR is supported as a source when defining an ingress security group,
add support for referencing a security group id.

Change-Id: Ib803e562244aa78ec313011f73eea0749e5350a8
Fixes: bug #1193415

commit_message:
Adds group id reference support to ingress security groups

Only a CIDR is supported as a source when defining an ingress security group,
add support for referencing a security group id.

Change-Id: Ib803e562244aa78ec313011f73eea0749e5350a8
Fixes: bug #1193415

This is just some mapping functions - no scheduling and nothing in the actual virtualisation driver, I believe.  Is that correct?

Please keep an eye on the general purpose PCI passthrough patch, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27130/ .  I know you're not doing PCI passthrough but I would suggest that the scheduling will be related (not that similar, but in the same vein) and the way of requesting a GPU (via flavor extra_specs) should also be similar."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-12 22:54:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 221, 'date': '2013-06-13 16:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Russell Bryant:
We wanted to separate our code from the libvirt because it makes our code easier to review.
If it would be better to add it as a feature of the libvirt driver, it is also OK for us.'}, {'account_id': 221, 'date': '2013-06-13 16:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@ijw-ubuntu: 

Yes, we do not propose new virtualization method, scheduling, nor new way of resource request. We make use of the existing scheduler which can handle extra_spec field. We also assume to use extra_specs to request GPU resource in the flavor.'}, {'account_id': 221, 'date': '2013-06-14 14:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-14 15:02:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am not sure are my comments still actual=)"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-14 15:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2013-06-14 15:17:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not a massive fan of the subclassed virt driver, because superclassing a general purpose libvirt driver to make a general purpose libvirt driver with GPU extensions to LXC just seems *wrong* - your new subclass could equally easily replace the original libvirt driver, since it has all the original functionality, which begs the question why it's not just integrated.  Also, any driver could map in a CPU, be it libvirt/lxc, libvirt/KVM, Xen... We aren't going to subclass all of those to add the extensions.

That aside, Boris's comments about globals are valid, and you could just as easily merge your utils with the singleton driver class and have object-locals instead.

And nova.virt.gpu is misleading as a name.  This is general purpose GPU code, this is, and it appears always will be, LXC-specific."}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2013-06-14 15:18:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

That should read 'this is *not* general purpose...'.  Can't type today."}, {'account_id': 602, 'date': '2013-06-14 15:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

We agree with Borris and ijw-ubuntu.
We will integrate our virt/gpu/driver.py into libvirt/driver.py code.
And we will move virt/gpu/utils.py to libvirt/gpu_lxc_utils.py code.
We will use singleton to remove frequent use of global variables.
Please let us know if you have better idea.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 15:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/4/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/10398 : FAILURE in 33m 13s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/4/check/gate-nova-pylint/13816 : SUCCESS in 10m 06s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-06-20 14:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Do not merge

Can this just be a part of more general PCI passthrough?  If not, why not?

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27130/'}, {'account_id': 221, 'date': '2013-06-20 15:57:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Russell: The code for PCI Passthrough set is for non-LXC case. Our code set is for LXC case.
In LXC, any device (not necessarily PCI device) can be passed to VM.
We use this feature for gpu device in our code set.
In fact our scheme can be generalized for any arbitrary device for LXC, which is not done yet.
Resource registration and scheduling part can be shared between our code and the code for PCI Passthrough.
However, the core part of the two code sets cannot be shared.

We want to add this to libvirt driver as a separate case in this initial step.
After PCI passthrough sets are merged, we will adapt our code
to share the code for resource registration and scheduling part using db.
We're going to submit the updated patch set (integrated into libvirt driver).
Please let us know if you have different opinion or more comments."}, {'account_id': 221, 'date': '2013-06-20 21:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 22:44:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-nova-pep8/29687 : SUCCESS in 4m 51s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-nova-docs/23906/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 59s
- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-nova-python26/25291 : SUCCESS in 22m 24s
- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-nova-python27/25395 : SUCCESS in 11m 06s
- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/25147 : SUCCESS in 45m 44s
- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/24853 : FAILURE in 49m 03s
- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/32672 : SUCCESS in 26m 20s
- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11879 : FAILURE in 26m 19s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/32803/5/check/gate-nova-pylint/14357 : SUCCESS in 11m 31s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-06-21 08:29:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

LXC doesn't do PCI device passthrough in the same sense as KVM does, since it isn't offering full machine virtualization. It can however do USB device passthrough, and arbirary character & block device passthrough.

All of this feels like it falls under the more general topic of 'Host device passthrough'. I really don't think we should be doing this LXC GPU specific passthrough code at all, as it is far too limited to one specific use case. A more general approach is the only long term sustainable approach."}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2013-06-21 17:33:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 221, 'date': '2013-06-21 21:19:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Daniel Berrange:

Thanks for reviewing it. We were waiting for yours~
More general host device passthrough sounds good.
Do you mean separate driver for general host device passthrough
including KVM and LXC, w/o adding them into libvirt/driver?
But, KVM PCI passthrough is being added into libvirt/driver directly.
So we're trying to add LXC device passthrough into libvirt/driver too.

Based on several people's review, we're thinking about updates for
the generalized LXC device passthrough, not for specific gpu stuff.

Also, we're going to change cgroups/mknod part to xml configuration format.
We don't have to use lxc-attach. We will remove that.
(@Chuck Short: Right, we missed the rootwrap/compute.filters when pushing codes. Not needed any more. Thanks.)

To support general device passthrough, we can use similar device table to pci_devices table.
Until Boris code is merged, should we have to wait and then follow up that?
Or can we update our codes based on simple text file for device information and then update later?"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-06-21 21:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck bug 1193132'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-21 22:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add NVidia GPU support for LXC hypervisor

blueprint heterogeneous-gpu-accelerator-support

This enables NVidia GPUs to be provisioned as a resource.
GPU provisioning is supported for LXC only.
GPU allocation/de-allocation to/from a VM is implemented.
The protection of overallocation is also implemented.
The block device numbers of the GPUs allocated are passed to the VM,
and the corresponding nodes are created inside of the VM.
The codes are tested with NVidia Fermi GPU and Kepler GPU.

Change-Id: I3709e9b7abb36940f34a0560f558c1d98197d6cb
Co-authored-by: David Kang <dkang@isi.edu>
Co-authored-by: John Paul Walters <jwalters@isi.edu>
Co-authored-by: Mikyung Kang <mkkang@isi.edu>

I guess I'm OK with renaming xml_to_json to xml_to_data but there is a deeper issue. This "data" object we produce is consumed by code that is abstracted away from json/xml. This mostly works because the "data" produced from xml is almost the same as json except for the handling of booleans. I think the only case of json boolean in the specs is the "enabled" attribute in keystone. Our keystone tests are riddled with code that takes this attribute, stringifies it and then calls lower(). I don't think this is right. The "data" should be canonical whether we call it json or not. Is it the case that the xml, unlike json, does not differentiate between the boolean true and the string "true"? If so it is hard to do this cleanly.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-22 00:33:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

the whole to_data thing I think is pretty misleading, I'm ok with the directory move, the rest I think is churn."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-06-22 04:46:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

IMHO the to_json is more miss leading.
The to_dict is problematic if you would like to use the dict world on right side, but still better name for this function.

What is your opinion about just renaming the function xml_to_dict and using the 'data' as variable name ?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-29 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
rename  tempest/services/compute/xml/common.py -> tempest/common/xml.py

    The xml used by multiple components, is should
    not be in the compute directory.
    The xml_to_json renamed to xml_to_data.

subject: When we delete an instance, remove its network resources.
messages:
[{'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-06-12 15:18:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm looking for guidance on:

1. Whether bug 1183523 is worth fixing, or whether we'd prefer to keep instance-related rows in our tables forever to make restoring deleted instances easier.

2. If so, whether we want to add an API to get fixed IPs for an instance.  (The other get_fixed_ip* methods in nova.network are marked as unused.)"}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-06-12 15:31:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2013-06-12 15:16:03.000000000', 'message': "When we delete an instance, remove its fixed IPs.

Without doing this, the instance's UUID stays in the fixed_ips table
and a foreign key constraint prevents the soft-deleted instances row
from ever being archived.

References bug 1183523

Change-Id: I436276e2b0c7b1eac01f9aff918c6679d0c6dd5c
"}, {'created': '2013-06-12 15:47:08.000000000', 'message': "When we delete an instance, remove its network resources.

(This gets rid of fixed_ips, vifs, and DNS entries.)

Without doing this, the instance's UUID stays in the fixed_ips table
and a foreign key constraint prevents the soft-deleted instances row

commit_message:
When we delete an instance, remove its network resources.

(This gets rid of fixed_ips, vifs, and DNS entries.)

Without doing this, the instance's UUID stays in the fixed_ips table
and a foreign key constraint prevents the soft-deleted instances row
from ever being archived.

References bug 1183523

Change-Id: I436276e2b0c7b1eac01f9aff918c6679d0c6dd5c

subject: Ensure resync with service if there is an heartbeat exception
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/31950/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/7612 : SUCCESS in 1m 54s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/31950/1/check/gate-quantum-docs/6850/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 34s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31950/1/check/gate-quantum-python26/7222 : SUCCESS in 19m 32s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31950/1/check/gate-quantum-python27/7232 : SUCCESS in 13m 00s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31950/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/28098 : SUCCESS in 18m 08s
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Beyond the comment raised by gongysh, which looks sensible, I have to say that triggering a full resync for a missed hearthbeat it's something we need to consider carefully.

Indeed full resync for the DHCP agent, despite recent improvements, is still a very expensive task which puts a lot of burden on the server and the client.

In case of transient failures, I would consider different strategies for ensuring agent & server are in sync."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Perhaps we can then put this patch in WIP since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33254/ addresses this issue as well?'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This looks good, but bear with me for a second while I explain an issue that is somewhat related to this one: the stale presence of dnsmasq directories under /opt/stack/quantum/dhcp or /var/lib/quantum/dhcp: how do these directories get cleaned up if their networks no longer exist in the quantum db and their respective dnsmasq instance is no longer active? It seems like the method sync_state does not quite cover this case. Why? Beacause known_networks is empty, active_networks is not and (0 - 1) is 0 (see dhcp_agent.py#L152). Result: the directories stay. I don't think that netns_cleanup_util cover this case, even though we could make it so.

Maybe I am barking at the wrong tree, but if not I'd be happy to file a bug report and look into that, unless you beat me to it :)

What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Hopefully https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33254/ will address this.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi,
Yes, you are correct, there is no clean up of the directory when the network is deleted and it is certainly an issue that should be addressed.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I don't think it is a bug"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Sorry, I forget one thing.
server will not notify agent if connection between server and agent breaks. Currently server notifies just active agents. So if the Msg broker is down, the change on server will not synchronized to some agents which cannot report state to server. And even when we make the msg broker back, the agent cannot sync itself with server auto if there is no this garyk's patch."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

hi garyk,
can u abandon this patch according to your comment:
Please note that we will not need this patch if we use the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33254/"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

is it worth adding test case on this fix?'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

This patch is no longer needed as it is is solved by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33254/'}]

commit_message:
Deprecate enable_tunneling in the OVS agent

This patch properly deprecates the 'enable_tunneling' option in the OVS agent.
It does this be ignoring it if 'tunnel_types' is set, and if 'enable_tunneling'
is set, it defaults 'tunnel_types' to only GRE.

Fixes bug 1195374

Change-Id: I27fe6b930541a514fc51d3a6669347e52db8cb46

[{'created': '2013-06-28 14:43:01.000000000', 'message': 'Update docs to use default XFS inode size

In past couple of years, the XFS team has greatly improved inode use in
xfs.  With more recent kernels, there is no performance penalty for
using the default inode size, and a smaller inode size gives us
improvements in other areas where disk access is involved.

Change-Id: Ie9da53a6e8bf43d1d02881befbb52595462c9f2e

commit_message:
Update docs to use default XFS inode size

In past couple of years, the XFS team has greatly improved inode use in
xfs.  With more recent kernels, there is no performance penalty for
using the default inode size, and a smaller inode size gives us
improvements in other areas where disk access is involved.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie9da53a6e8bf43d1d02881befbb52595462c9f2e

commit_message:
Updating with patterns used in ops-database

We had two reviews which added an ops-messaging cookbook.  Updating
this cookbook with patterns we estabished from the database cookbook.
Craig already did most of the work, however, updated the tests to
use the chefspec find_provider, added clustering support, and attempted
to follow the service_type attribute patterns used in database cookbook.
Since these cookbooks are not complete, added a larger commit than
would have.

Change-Id: I0edfc996df413c6e41a31d53f964d7f5fc9e0aeb

commit_message:
Fix few missed issues with the reddwarf -> trove rename

There were still a few files remaining  after the reddwarf->trove
rename that were still referencing "reddwarf". Changed these
references to "trove".

Fixed bug: 1194637

Change-Id: Ib1cc57d909a2024ea650aefd82f2f7c91f39e5d4

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-05-31 18:01:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Do not merge

I had to think about this for a bit, but I don't think it's the right thing to do.  The AZ stored in the instance is the *requested* AZ, but is not necessarily where the instance ended up.  It may be elsewhere depending on how your scheduling logic is set up.  So, doing it how it is now gives a more accurate result here."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-05-31 18:04:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As for the original bug report ... I suppose this could be updated to report what's in the instance if a host hasn't been assigned yet."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-05-31 18:09:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hmmm, likely nothing will be in the instance 'az' field if its not assigned. And even when it does end-up on a host it seems like the 'az' field in the instance still isn't updated :-P"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-04 18:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Josh - not directly related to the bug, but since you're making changes to the caching anyway it would be great if the method that did the caching was the "inner" get_host_az() rather than get_instance_az() (which has to call the get_host_az method anyway) - as then both the public methods would be using the cache. 

That would allow things like the scheduler AZ filter to also use the cache - which would be a big performance gain on large systems.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-06-13 03:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-26 19:37:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

The thing that is now breaking the tests is that the change to moving the caching of AZ result into get_host_availability_zone() breaks tests where a host is moved from one AZ to another.  

The way the test does this doesn't seem valid to me (it changes the AZ of the aggregate, not move the host) - but it does raise the issue that a host being moved between AZs would result in the host still being reported as being in the old AZ for up to an hour.   The common case of first assignment to an AZ can be addressed by not caching results for the default AZ, but still leaves an open question of how to deal with a host that has to be moved (e.g. was wrongly assigned to an AZ).   Because the cache is per API server this could lead to inconsistent results where there are multiple API servers.

Because it was my bight idea to add this change to this patch I'm posting a new version which backs out this change.

Note that the original caching in get_instance_availability_zone() is exposed to the same issue, but the scope is more limited, and if seen as a problem should be treated as a separate bug."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-26 20:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-06-26 20:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

commit_message:
Report the az based on the value in the instance table.

When attempting to find the availability zone of an instance
do so by first trying to locate the availability zone of the
host the instance is active on. If that fails then attempt
to use the value that is in the instances 'availability_zone'
key instead.

For the caching used in the availability_zones module there
was a new method added to get and reset the cache that is
useful for unit tests, since during each run of a test you
do not want to be affected by something in cache from a previous
test.

Fixes bug 1172246

Change-Id: I6f54a44cc87434120656ccc789cebcc08d434418

After discussion in this review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/31016/ I'm not sure we should continue to focus on fixing SQLite migration utils.

Doing initial schema generation based on models definition seems to be a better solution for DB backends that have serious DDL limitations (i.e. SQLite) as they aren't used in production anyway.

Nevertheless, if we decide to go on with migration utils we have now, your patch will be relevant. In that case I would rather you split it into two patches instead: the first will address the bug with using of SQL reserved words and the second - the bug with FKs."}, {'account_id': 7711, 'date': '2013-06-25 11:41:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7711, 'date': '2013-06-25 11:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

commit_message:
Fix sqlalchemy utils.

This patch affects drop_unique_constraint() on sqlite engine.
1. Fix error for tables with foreign key(s).
2. Now work with tables contains reserved words in
column names ("key" for example).

Fix bug 1195216.

Change-Id: Idc4dfa5006eee115f578b00d675cae1d6241ec69

Peter, 

I will add a test for the additional params. 

Yes, I would like this to be an open API and well documented. 
Such documentation should be added in future patches when we complete the work - this patch is just a first step, and I wanted to declare the intention and discuss it as needed. 

There is at least one more step which is to screen all code and look for anywhere where path is calculated without the use of storage_directory. 

At the time where we complete all such changes to the code,  we should add formal documentation and an example how to extend the code if one chooses to make some modifications to the path scheme). 

Note that certain modifications may be harder to achieved than others due to the daemon code of iterating dirs. But we can discuss this based on future patches :)'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-11 19:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-11 20:19:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-11 21:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

I have a few tactical suggestions in line.

I like DRYing out, I think that's justification enough; I kinda don't really care for all the "this will make sense in the future" comments in the doc string of storage_directory.  Generally I'd say that kind of stuff is useful in the commit message and bug report; but looks like cruft once it's committed.

Also I think maybe it's worth it to just write a new utility function (e.g. full_storage_path) with a signature who's arguments are in a more sensible order just *call out to* storage_directory for the middle bits.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-11 22:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Clay, I will start working on the changes, but prefer not to change the function name or tests to avoid public beating. 

Lets not move to two functions as it is kind of against what I am trying to do here... 

We can have a followup in which we will change the function name, tests, re-position the arguments to their natural order and have all callers changed to use kwargs only. 

This can be done together with screening the code for all path related calculations (i.e. in the next patch).'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-12 14:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-12 14:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7968, 'date': '2013-06-25 01:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7972, 'date': '2013-06-25 05:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-28 21:32:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Do not merge

I don't think this has changed much from my first review, so I'm going to increase my object from -1 to -2 and describe the reasons I think this change is not finished in more detail.

I think the copy in the commit and the doc string referencing planned swift extendibility and some sort of API is premature.  I think other's have committed to DiskFile long term, but short term the best we can do is minimize the places where stuff has to change in order for DiskFile to offer the flexibility it needs to provide a clean abstraction point.

You shouldn't pin your hopes and dreams on this function never changing because you put "Planned Swift Extendiability API." in the doc string - in fact, that should come out before this merges because I don't think anyone besides you is planning to do that.

On to the implementation.

It seems like you've written a thin wrapper on os.path.join with unnatural ordering of params and some specific and IMHO confusing semantics.  I know what os.path.join does - most python developers don't even have to think about it, most people coming from different languages have something that works similarly.  If you want to move all of the code paths that call os.path.join throughout swift to a single call site (an ok idea IMHO given the DiskFile work) - that call site should have a *very* clear and expected behavior.  This change does not have that property for the following reasons:

    1. It is named "_directory" but might sometimes return a full path of a file.
    2. The args are unnaturally ordered.

So all we end up with is code that used to be easy to read is now difficult to grok (especially for pople new to the code base) because you have to apply the functions logic in your head to see how the final ordering of the parts appear in the resultant path.

My suggestion is two fold:

    1. familiarize yourself with Peter's trajectory on DiskFile and open a blue print which identifies how this change will help in *that* effort to define an internal class which will be used as an interface for the object server and it's supporting daemons interaction with the underlying storage system.  Reviewers coming fresh into a refactoring like to see documentation of what is *actually* going to benefit from this change not that something *might* or change for changes sake.
    2. create a new function with a better name and a natural call signature and simple side-effects.  Use that function everywhere it's appropriate and is helpful to the DiskFile abstraction.  I don't have a strong opinion if storage_directory should continue to exist or provide a deprecation warning.  While some utility methods are used outside of swift code base I'm not sure if this one is.  Probably wouldn't hurt to leave it in, but if it is documented as deprecated or emits a warning it should not be used anywhere in our code tree.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-28 21:33:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

My suggestions, hopefully with better formatting:

1. familiarize yourself with Peter's trajectory on DiskFile and open a blue print which identifies how this change will help in *that* effort to define an internal class which will be used as an interface for the object server and it's supporting daemons interaction with the underlying storage system.  Reviewers coming fresh into a refactoring like to see documentation of what is *actually* going to benefit from this change not that something *might* or change for changes sake.

2. create a new function with a better name and a natural call signature and simple side-effects.  Use that function everywhere it's appropriate and is helpful to the DiskFile abstraction.  I don't have a strong opinion if storage_directory should continue to exist or provide a deprecation warning.  While some utility methods are used outside of swift code base I'm not sure if this one is.  Probably wouldn't hurt to leave it in, but if it is documented as deprecated or emits a warning it should not be used anywhere in our code tree."}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-28 23:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Generalize storage_directory

Add basedir, device and filename optional aruments to
storage_directory, as often used by its callers.

This is a step in the direction of making all path in Swift
calculated by storage_directory, which is needed for:
- ring doubling
- Swift extendability

Change-Id: I34c6bc7715b1f8f5a644132b2b3077cd483bfdb6
Fixes: Bug #1189897

commit_message:
Move some of the ordered flow helper classes to utils.

Allow other flow types easier access to these helper
classes by moving them to the shared utils file.

Change-Id: I001754efc25b025e8070493d5861ffaedacafc7b

[{'created': '2013-06-27 09:33:55.000000000', 'message': 'Port flavor_disabled extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I01688d7f9d976b7e406d46283c6d0010ddc3476a
'}]
commit_message:
Port flavor_disabled extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I01688d7f9d976b7e406d46283c6d0010ddc3476a

[{'created': '2013-06-24 20:25:04.000000000', 'message': 'Manager instead of direct driver

Make calls via the maanger as opposed to the drivers

commit_message:
Manager instead of direct driver

Make calls via the manager as opposed to the drivers
in order to support refactoring of common code

Bug 1193420

Change-Id: I69117ea755ed7ef3f7d3732fee83cc758927d296

commit_message:
Stop installing libvirt on baremetal nodes.

As per bug 1191649 the presence of libvirt on the baremetal undercloud
node causes routing to fail, as the node ends up with a
192.168.122.0/24 virbr0 network. Fix this by splitting out some of the
kvm specific bits of boot-stack.

Change-Id: Ie7bba9d2bceb3720fc9074e197da4c3999f1d509

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-28 21:28:19.000000000', 'message': 'Filter bootps requests on the seed cloud host.

The seed cloud VM sees requests from all baremetal nodes in the
datacentre LAN, but is only meant to answer those registered with it -
the undercloud control plane. Other nodes will be registered with the
undercloud control plane and when the seed node answers they will fail
to boot, which is undesirable.

Fix bug 1195654.

Change-Id: I3818296176cfbd05f3ee28000aa3487f9f3b8ef6
'}]
commit_message:
Filter bootps requests on the seed cloud host.

The seed cloud VM sees requests from all baremetal nodes in the
datacentre LAN, but is only meant to answer those registered with it -
the undercloud control plane. Other nodes will be registered with the
undercloud control plane and when the seed node answers they will fail
to boot, which is undesirable.

Fix bug 1195654.

Change-Id: I3818296176cfbd05f3ee28000aa3487f9f3b8ef6

commit_message:
Add element-deps to apache2 element.

Apache2 element does not have element-deps file.
Yet it has OCA templates and ORC scripts.

Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I77902e7ef9adcf392c6d1a29ee486c77b563d0c1

commit_message:
Clean up keystone-all.rst

This change fixes warnings and errors from
doc/source/man/keystone-all.rst when generating documentation.

Change-Id: Ie33b2600f28c517644730b2371ce34ca2e73b7a5

commit_message:
Added integration tests for cluster creation

*CRUD operations for cluster creation via node processes were checked
*CRUD operations for cluster creation via node group templates and node processes were checked

Partially implemented blueprint itest-savanna-0-2

Change-Id: I8548124b7dfa64aa9e4578bb94c4fca067c4dcff

commit_message:
Removed the use of non-standard ohai plugin

We now have a helper method `#address_for` to return the
IP of a given interface.  Switched out the ohai use
in favor of `#address_for`.

Change-Id: I773b20d2e663c1d04c49bfbd79c750da78da2ed1

commit_message:
Install clients in their own venv

Fixes bug 1194807

This prevents dependencies from polluting the system
environment.

Change-Id: I47905f00ef0ffe7521098508def5f29839f9ae3f

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Change-Id: Ie629ee328d76a1595350b597c7874b430217c769
'}, {'created': '2013-06-14 05:56:58.000000000', 'message': 'Port cells extension to v3 API Part 1

will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The

easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3

Change-Id: Ie629ee328d76a1595350b597c7874b430217c769
'}]
commit_message:
Port cells extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ie629ee328d76a1595350b597c7874b430217c769

commit_message:
Removed db recipe

The db recipe have been removed. It is up to the operator to
setup the database, users, and grants before deploying openstack.
It has been moved to the `openstack-db` recipe in the
`openstack-ops-database` wrapper cookbook.

Change-Id: Ic9467b2473b9c5eea6dd4f74c9d5f83f47e86814

[{'created': '2013-06-17 02:03:14.000000000', 'message': 'Port server_diagnostics extension to v3 API Part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I52f906948b5873cf3fdfff14270c7384ee5e7b9f
'}]
commit_message:
Port server_diagnostics extension to v3 API Part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I52f906948b5873cf3fdfff14270c7384ee5e7b9f

[{'created': '2013-06-25 21:55:01.000000000', 'message': "Allow retrying network allocations separately

Introduce a new config option, 'network_allocate_retries', that allows
one to retry network allocations.  The default is 0 for no retries to
match the current behavior.

The network allocations currently get retried by a full retry of a build
via the scheduler, if those are enabled.  This patch reduces the need to
re-schedule for simple network allocation issues.

The retrying happens in the network alloc async greenthread, so for virt
drivers that support the new NetworkModel, the retrying potentially
happens in the background while the image is being downloaded, etc.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1a5fdcccbb736fc0b1d8c0cbc3b45a8372a6aef7
"}, {'created': '2013-06-26 20:01:36.000000000', 'message': "Allow retrying network allocations separately

Introduce a new config option, 'network_allocate_retries', that allows
one to retry network allocations.  The default is 0 for no retries to
match the current behavior.

The network allocations currently get retried by a full retry of a build
via the scheduler, if those are enabled.  This patch reduces the need to

drivers that support the new NetworkModel, the retrying potentially

Change-Id: I1a5fdcccbb736fc0b1d8c0cbc3b45a8372a6aef7
"}]
commit_message:
Allow retrying network allocations separately

Introduce a new config option, 'network_allocate_retries', that allows
one to retry network allocations.  The default is 0 for no retries to
match the current behavior.

The network allocations currently get retried by a full retry of a build
via the scheduler, if those are enabled.  This patch reduces the need to
re-schedule for simple network allocation issues.

The retrying happens in the network alloc async greenthread, so for virt
drivers that support the new NetworkModel, the retrying potentially
happens in the background while the image is being downloaded, etc.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1a5fdcccbb736fc0b1d8c0cbc3b45a8372a6aef7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 16:55:44.000000000', 'message': "db.compute_node_update: ignore values['update_at']

When individual instances are updated (e.g., during spawn and terminate),
ResourceTracker (in nova.compute.resource_tracker)  calls compute_node_update
with values=self.compute_node. Since self.compute_node is an instance of
ComputeNode that was retrieved from the database, it has updated_at set. Since
updated_at is in values, sqlalchemy doesn't automatically change the record's
updated_at column (see
nova.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy.models.TimestampMixin). Moreover, since
updated_at is set to the last value's updated_at, updated_at effectively doesn't
change until values without updated_at are sent, which only happens during the
periodic task that calls ResourceTracker.update_available_resources.

Nova-scheduler relies on ComputeNode.updated_at to keep its model of
available resources up-to-date. In particular, nova-scheduler doesn't play a
role in instance termination, so it doesn't account for freed resources until
ComputeNode.updated_at changes. Thus, between nova-compute's periodic calls to
ResourceTracker.update_available_resources, nova-scheduler's model of available
resources monotonically decreases. If, for example, a node has resources for 10
instances, and you manage to boot 10, terminate 10, then attempt to boot another
before the end of the period, nova-scheduler won't schedule the new instance on
the vacant node.

Note that f398b9e195cda582bad57396b097dec274384c07 fixed a separate issue
related to ComputeNode.update_at being stale.

Change-Id: Ifd1e56edfd811241816970715071876857de80d3

commit_message:
db.compute_node_update: ignore values['update_at']

When individual instances are updated (e.g., during spawn and
terminate), ResourceTracker (in nova.compute.resource_tracker)  calls
compute_node_update with values=self.compute_node. Since
self.compute_node is an instance of ComputeNode that was retrieved
from the database, it has updated_at set. Since updated_at is in
values, sqlalchemy doesn't automatically change the record's
updated_at column (see
nova.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy.models.TimestampMixin). Moreover,
since updated_at is set to the last value's updated_at, updated_at
effectively doesn't change until values without updated_at are sent,
which only happens during the periodic task that calls
ResourceTracker.update_available_resources.

Nova-scheduler relies on ComputeNode.updated_at to keep its model of
available resources up-to-date. In particular, nova-scheduler doesn't
play a role in instance termination, so it doesn't account for freed
resources until ComputeNode.updated_at changes. Thus, between
nova-compute's periodic calls to
ResourceTracker.update_available_resources, nova-scheduler's model of
available resources monotonically decreases. If, for example, a node
has resources for 10 instances, and you manage to boot 10, terminate
10, then attempt to boot another before the end of the period,
nova-scheduler won't schedule the new instance on the vacant node.

Fixes bug #1194900.

Note that f398b9e195cda582bad57396b097dec274384c07 fixed a separate
issue (bug #1153778) related to ComputeNode.update_at being stale.

Change-Id: Ifd1e56edfd811241816970715071876857de80d3

commit_message:
Change backports a fix from trunk into Grizzly

This commit has been made to get the indexing of tokens, both valid and
expired, into grizzly. Presently, indexing is not being used on tokens
which causes keystone performance issues.

Add index on token table for the valid/expired column of the SQL token Backend.
Fix added to dbmigrate.

referenced bug :
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1168399

relevant bug :
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1178063

Change-Id: I4b8a9748ebe4c99c1732cc46cd8a4735237bc276

commit_message:
Add support for SQL idle timeout.

Previously, cinder logged frequent
database-has-gone-away errors.

This patch adds a parameter that can configure
the sql_idle_timeout which can be increased
to reduce these errors.

More information on this issue can be found here:
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1007027 for more details.

Also cleans-up inline Puppet documentation.

Change-Id: I1479844a88ab9047e78c5060231c500f38b38720

commit_message:
Remove Unicode characters from README.md

Unfortunately for dear ole' Ionut, Berkshelf cannot handle
uploading cookbooks with files that contain Unicode characters.
When uploading, you get the following error:

Change-Id: I2c37a2761c25139bc44006cc0e5b13adf6413dd5
STDERR: ERROR: Encoding::InvalidByteSequenceError: "\xC8" on US-ASCII

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary timeout logging.

rpc.call timeouts are not necessarily fatal, so don't log an exception
with a traceback for every single one.  Let the caller decide what to
do.

This is a partial backport of 229b815fb72dccf998b18a0ad019cc61ccb888d8
from master, which removed this along with a bunch of other changes.

I noticed this during a sync to nova, where this line was getting added,
so it must have been removed directly in nova at some point.  It really
shouldn't be there, so let's just remove it from the original code.

Change-Id: Ide4f26865d8f2ce0630cc8824fbea6f17aa262fa

commit_message:
Port images functionality to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Note that this functionality will be moved from core to an
extension.  Consensus appears to be that we continue to need this
functionality for v3 because some deployers disable the public
image endpoint due security concerns and whether this will be
fixed in glance for Havana. Deployers can disable this extension
if they do not want it.

Partially implements nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I02b32b40b14a5593bf254ad9e6a78c14cb15ced5

commit_message:
xenapi: Add qemu-utils as a cinder dependency

If you are using xenapi, your system won't have qemu-img installed. This
patch adds the package qemu-utils to the list of cinder
apts/rpms/suse-rpms, thus devstack will pull the required binaries.

Change-Id: Id701880ce03bb3e78223df0af6a00b052408407c

commit_message:
Fix python exec prefix on SUSE.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1068386
"sudo python setup.py develop" installs to /usr/bin on SUSE

Otherwise it fails with "stack.sh:191 g-api did not start".

Change-Id: I1258240ce2a5a765188353fbc8a2e085d0b02fec

commit_message:
Enhance DevStack to allow user to specify the
following customizations for the predefined networks
created on startup (default in parenthesis):

PRIVATE_SUBNET_NAME    - Name of the local subnet (private-subnet)
PUBLIC_SUBNET_NAME     - Name of the public subnet (public-subnet)
PUBLIC_NETWORK_GATEWAY - IP for the public subnet (172.24.4.225)

Moved NETWORK_GATEWAY into lib/quantum, along with these new
customizations.

bug 1194218

Change-Id: I87ebc22e338df278db7523f11be07de1ca88234b

subject: Add AggregateRamFilter
messages:
[{'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-06-20 15:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Honestly, I don't get it.  If you satisfy the RAM ratio for one aggregate, then you could just as easily violate the ratio for another aggregate.

Why not just build out a separate cell if this is a use case you care about?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 15:24:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/33828/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/29608 : FAILURE in 3m 39s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33828/1/check/gate-nova-docs/23827/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 57s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33828/1/check/gate-nova-python26/25212 : SUCCESS in 19m 11s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33828/1/check/gate-nova-python27/25316 : SUCCESS in 9m 35s

- http://logs.openstack.org/33828/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/24694 : SUCCESS in 40m 20s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33828/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/32499 : SUCCESS in 16m 23s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33828/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11737 : FAILURE in 11m 36s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/33828/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/14301 : SUCCESS in 10m 17s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-06-20 15:56:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

>> Honestly, I don't get it. If you satisfy the RAM ratio for one aggregate, then you could just as easily violate the ratio for another aggregate.

Well, the point of this change is to introduce separate RAM ratio settings for different aggregates. For example, ram_allocation_ratio=1.0 for aggregate A w/o memory over commitment, ram_allocation_ratio=1.5 for aggregate B w/ memory over commitment.

So, with host1 in aggregate A and host2 in aggregate B, with same resource usage level (same total_usable_ram_mb and free_ram_mb), an instance could still be scheduled to host2 while host1 considered 'full'.

It is much more flexible than just single global value. Does that make sense to you?"}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-06-20 16:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Trying put it another way.

At some resource usage level, say actual ram allocation ratio has already reached 1.0 for both host1 and host2. At this point, we want no more instance scheduled to host1, but scheduling to host2 still allowable. Cause these two hosts falls into different aggregate with different ram_allocation_ratio.

Of course, in this case, the same host should be avoided adding to aggregates w/ different ram_allocation_ratio settings.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-20 22:10:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Overall seems reasonable to me.  IMHO Cells are a way of assisting in scaling nova (add making multiple isolated failure domains), they should not be the only way to do more complex configurations, this is exactly what aggregates were designed for.

A few inline comments.

Also having a db call in each pass is a scaling issue.  Can you put a comment in the docstring warning people about that.

You also have some pep8 issues"}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-06-21 08:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

>> Overall seems reasonable to me. IMHO Cells are a way of assisting in scaling nova (add making multiple isolated failure domains), they should not be the only way to do more complex configurations, this is exactly what aggregates were designed for.

Exactly. And this BP will make ratio value adjustable between aggregates, which is not conflict w/ Cells configuration.

>> Also having a db call in each pass is a scaling issue. Can you put a comment in the docstring warning people about that.
Not sure docstring is the right place to put. Make it into an separate TODO comments here. Please correct me if docstring should be used.

>> You also have some pep8 issues
Done.

Will upload a new patch set soon. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-06-21 08:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-21 09:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add AggregateRamFilter

Implements blueprint per-aggregate-resource-ratio

* AggregateRamFilter to support per-aggregate ram_allocation_ratio
* Falls back to global setting if per-aggregate value not found

DocImpact

Change-Id: I93e069f0ac3f595d9a2a17119274c7bfbe8fca31

commit_message:
Clear keypairs on teardown.

Heat tests have been leaking created keypairs - these are now deleted.

Change-Id: I4e43e3bb68d4e75b719497c5d5fbe3f56e531584

don't look bad at me but ... what's the point of testing if we can SSH on some instance of the stack in a Heat API test class?"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-06-27 07:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

also read, I don't see the need/usefulness of this"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-27 14:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-06-27 14:29:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

So this looks fine to me. I've got one little nit though, you shouldn't need to call TempestConfig() again inside of a test class since the base test class already does this. Once that's fixed this has got my +2."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-06-27 21:22:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Giulio, we've had multiple instances where cloud-init has failed due to boto versioning clashes. If all we had was a failing test_stack_wait_condition_data then there is a very long chain of potential failure points to check.

However if test_can_log_into_created_server fails too, then that indicates that something lower-level has failed (networking, cloud-init metadata retrieval).

Also test_can_log_into_created_server waits for the instance resource to complete, while test_stack_wait_condition_data waits for the stack to complete. This gives us some useful timing data to observe."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-06-28 00:09:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-06-28 15:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-28 15:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Starting gate jobs.

commit_message:
Heat test ssh to the server.

This is run when the resource creation is complete, but before
the stack creation is complete.

Change-Id: I05c5624a6f3c4817391de87224d647e260607f3e

subject: Event-based detection of ports in OVS agent
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/34762/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/8225 : SUCCESS in 2m 10s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/34762/1/check/gate-quantum-docs/7463/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 41s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34762/1/check/gate-quantum-python26/7831 : FAILURE in 19m 49s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34762/1/check/gate-quantum-python27/7845 : FAILURE in 15m 44s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34762/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/34532 : FAILURE in 18m 44s
"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As per the previous comment, testing will require devolving responsibility for generating monitoring results out of daemon_loop.  That method does far too much at present to be effectively tested.  An example of what I'm talking would be implementing the monitoring as a completely separate construct (perhaps a geneator) that provided events for consumption by daemon loop.

I'd also like to see functional tests before this goes in, not just unit tests.  I'm talking about a test that, given the necessary system dependencies like ovs, can monitor an ovs bridge and respond to changes to that bridge appropriately.  Manual or integration-level testing will not be sufficent.  If you need help with this part, I can assist."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

WIP or no, I'm disappointed to see a review posted for a change of this magnitude without tests.  Please ensure this is a priority for subsequent revisions."}, {'account_id': 6820, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 6820, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry for that, I agree that it's more a POC than a WIP, I just wanted to have some feedback about the approach prior to go further. I thought It was tolerated to publish initial reviews without tests, maybe should I have submit it as a Draft instead?

For sure, it must be refactored to be properly testable (and maintainable). But as you said, using event polling is quite a big change, I wanted to know if is reasonable, or if another approach should be considered to fix this bug:

We could also just try to optimise get_vif_port_set function, maybe we could use "ovs-vsctl find Interface external_ids:iface-id!={}" to retrieve the list of ports in a single command instead of issuing an ovs-vsctl command for each port.

An event driven model would be better but is more disruptive, and should be carefully designed. As you mentioned, there should be an independent monitor, producing ports events consumed by the agent trough a generic interface. Thus, in the future, we may be able to add other events generators (such as udev or netlink events using pyudev and ip monitor), and dispatch them to various callbacks.

If you prefer, I may also abandon this change and give you back the hand on the bug, you were maybe working on it?'}, {'account_id': 6820, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-28 16:15:24.000000000', 'message': "Event-based detection of ports in OVS agent

OVS agents periodically polls OVS to discover new devices,
which doesn't scales when OVS has many ports, as current
get_vif_ports method will send one ovs-vscl command per port.

The proposed patch uses ovsdb-monitor to be notified about
devices events. As main loop is listening ovsdb-events, RPC calls
are ensured with a looping call, to insist on plugin calls. We
must indeed ensure that methods like tunnel_sync or get_device_detail
will be answered.

Initial work was based on pyudev.monitor.pool that brings the same
kind of devices notification, however it is not suitable for OVS as
too much devices are set-up. But it could be used to implement the
same feature in linux bridge as a follow-on effort.

Fixes: bug #1177973

Change-Id: I074bed7694e6fa7fb820c678dc077675c87b6798
"}]
commit_message:
Event-based detection of ports in OVS agent

OVS agents periodically polls OVS to discover new devices,
which doesn't scales when OVS has many ports, as current
get_vif_ports method will send one ovs-vscl command per port.

The proposed patch uses ovsdb-monitor to be notified about
devices events. As main loop is listening ovsdb-events, RPC calls
are ensured with a looping call, to insist on plugin calls. We
must indeed ensure that methods like tunnel_sync or get_device_detail
will be answered.

Initial work was based on pyudev.monitor.pool that brings the same
kind of devices notification, however it is not suitable for OVS as
too much devices are set-up. But it could be used to implement the
same feature in linux bridge as a follow-on effort.

Fixes: bug #1177973

Change-Id: I074bed7694e6fa7fb820c678dc077675c87b6798

commit_message:
Stop passing context to managers (bug 1194938)

We don't have a use case for passing the request context to the manager
layer, so this patch removes a bunch of cruft.

Change-Id: Ic6435782c4c9f32e38c7800172645cc1af23ea09
