commit_message:
Fixes exposing trace during calling image create API

Now Glance will return trace instead of standard HTTP error
during create image with bad location and nonempty body.
The root cause is nonempty request body will make add image
as synchronous action instead of queuing it. And then, the
image upload will fail due to the bad location. As a result,
user will run into the exception trace instead of friendly
HTTP error.

Based on current design, it's invalid to provide multiple
image sources in one request. So this fix is adding an
explicit check to make sure there is only one image source.

Fixes bug: 1185055

Change-Id: I204aa14fa35e50aeb29b6dc22bbf5bbc66a2fb42

commit_message:
Add support for SQL idle timeout.

Previously, nova logged frequent
database-has-gone-away errors.

This patch adds a parameter that can configure
the sql_idle_timeout which can be decreased
to reduce these errors.

More information on this issue can be found here:
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1007027 for more details.

Change-Id: Icd08c95d59587fd9263714e4f31ef7974a6338e1

commit_message:
Fixed backups GET and DELETE to restrict access to the owner of backup

Fixed the db model find_by so that when a model instance is looked up and a
context is passed in, the find_by operation fails if the tenant_id in the
instance is not the same as the tenant_id in the context (except if the
tenant is an admin).

Fixed bug 1188822

Change-Id: I0374f999601fa3f2bc817901bbc428b8be219683

commit_message:
Moves scheduler.manager._set_vm_state_and_notify to scheduler.utils

This method is required by the scheduler.manager.prep_resize method
which is being moved to conductor.manager.

We move it to scheduler.utils until we completely move migrations
logic out of scheduler.manager.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: I8203577fc26da5cc1039815e31fb8fe356d1f7d6

commit_message:
Fix tox.ini config

We found that if tests run with testr --subunit option it can cause
wrong implementation of tests results.

Change-Id: I98c3f3ed90e2291ef984f07a93c89d24da7855d9

I think having a small set of tests that operate in a way closer to a real deployment (forking) is a good thing but the vast majority of glance's tests can be changed."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-31 22:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

good stuff Mark! Keep trucking. Good point about the duplication. Will be good to unify that. Looking forward to see future patches :)'}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-06-14 07:29:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

@Mark, great work, one inline comment, this approach is really a lightweight implementation then original. I have one concern here, I agree your definition about 'Functional Tests' from your etherpad (glance-improving-test-cycle-times), the test should asserts the end-to-end functionality of the project, but under this change the api and register server does not really running, all testing calls just put to wsgi app directly but not api/http server. Do you think this is a 'end-to-end' testing?"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-21 18:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (7 inline comments)

Thanks for all the feedback guys!

Zhi Yan, I agree, these are not end-to-end functional tests. I think I just put them in the wrong place. While reworking this patch, I hope to move these new tests and test infrastructure to an "integration" test module, where it will make sense to view tests as less end-to-end.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-22 02:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-22 02:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

lgtm.
Mark, I even have a little concern about end-to-end functional tests. I agree you point and saw you move the code to 'integration' tests in PS2. But I also saw you remove a lot of code from 'functional/v1/test_api.py', this means the *real* end-to-end test cases be removed from functional tests, that caused Glance has less end-to-end tests. is this result in normal/under your plan?"}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-06-22 12:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

supplement my latest comments on above:

Mark, so do you plan now to maximum replace existing end-to-end function tests with integration tests?'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-23 03:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Zhi Yan,

Yes, removing (most of) the slow functional tests in glance/tests/functional/v1/test_api.py and replacing them with generally equivalent but much faster integration tests is the goal of this patch.

This is just the first step in a general effort to align glance testing around the principles laid out in https://etherpad.openstack.org/glance-improving-test-cycle-times (which I know you are familiar with).'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-06-27 21:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I think this is great!  In addition to the other things mentioned it will make setting break points in more of the tests possible'}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-06-28 04:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm, great work markwash.'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-06-28 13:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Thanks for this!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-28 13:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-24 23:39:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Faster more stable V1 functional tests

This patch adds a lightweight base class for testing the glance api, and
ports the existing v1 api tests (while preserving them in place as
well). This patch does not port test_unsupported_default_store, however.
With the remaining tests, there is a factor of 12 speedup in test runs
on some test rigs.

Related to bp refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: Ifcc76b4bf4e484a52558538e5398cad882e48e4c
'}, {'created': '2013-06-22 02:10:24.000000000', 'message': 'Port slow, overly assertive v1 functional tests to integration tests

This patch ports existing v1 api functional tests to a newly added group
of integration tests. The new tests take about 1/8th of the time of the
previous tests, thanks to not forking off api and registry server
processes.

One original functional test is preserved, to ensure that we are still
testing the basic v1 functional wireup.

Related to bp refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: Ifcc76b4bf4e484a52558538e5398cad882e48e4c
'}]
commit_message:
Port slow, overly assertive v1 functional tests to integration tests

This patch ports existing v1 api functional tests to a newly added group
of integration tests. The new tests take about 1/8th of the time of the
previous tests, thanks to not forking off api and registry server
processes.

One original functional test is preserved, to ensure that we are still
testing the basic v1 functional wireup.

Related to bp refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: Ifcc76b4bf4e484a52558538e5398cad882e48e4c

commit_message:
Fix service alive information in os-services extension

Service alive information need to be compared with service_down_time
value and updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I9b9798c108a2da07ab78d5d05cbb51a73b14363e

See comment'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-06-12 08:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-06-12 10:00:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Hey Raymond,

Even though the idea is attractive, I don't think this is the behavior a user would want. 

When a port is set in the backdoor_port parameter, the user expects it to be used, period. This patch will force the user to verify if the port that was configured is actually the one used or if another one was picked up. What happens if another one was picked up but the user doesn't notice it and tries to access the one that was configured?

If the port is in use, then the app should raise an exception and if the user wants a random port to be picked up, it should just set the backdoor_port value to 0. 

If the user configures a port and it is in use, then the user will have to revisit its deployment and configuration files. 

Hope the above makes sense to you."}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-12 14:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The problem with the approach of using the port number the user specifies and failing if there is a conflict is that has an almost 100% chance of failing all but the first OpenStack service to come up when the user picks anything other than 0 for the port number.  Why have an option that has an almost 100% chance of failure.  I think no matter what we do, we need to deprecate the old option "backdoor_port".

I have proposed one alternative. Create a new option called "enable_backdoor" and setting it to True results in a random port number.  Personally, I don't like that option.

Here is another option.  Create a new option called "backdoor_starting_port" which has the behavior I implemented.  We know multiple services will want a backdoor port number and we know we don't want to have a configuration option specific to each service, so we provide a good name for an option that does not have unexpected behavior.

Comments?'}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-13 17:01:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-13 17:05:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Mailing list discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-June/thread.html#10346'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-14 16:05:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Do not merge

As I just said in the thread, we can go a long way to stopping people hitting this usability issue in this obscure feature by (1) improving the help string and (2) logging the randomly chosen port number

I don't think the complexity involved with backdoor_starting_port is really worth it - users still need to figure out which port each service ended up on"}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-14 19:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-06-14 19:24:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm going to resubmit this patch without deprecating backdoor_port.  The help for backdoor_port and its functionality will be as follows:

Enable eventlet backdoor.  Acceptable settings are 0, <port> and hint:<port>, where 0 results in listening on a random tcp port number, <port> results in listening on the specified port number and failing if it is in use and hint:<port> results in listening on the closest unused port number greater than or equal to the specified port."}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-17 05:20:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-17 05:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-17 08:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Ok, I still don't love the additional complexity vs user experience improvement - again, I think this is an obscure feature and even with the ability to configure a port range the user needs to check what port number was chosen so it doesn't matter what the port is ...

On configuration - better than 'hint:<port>' would be a '<start>:<end>' range

On the code - I'd like to isolate the additional complexity into new helper methods - one to parse the port range and another to iterate over the range

On configuration error - we need to throw an exception

Here's how I think it should look:

 class EventletBackdoorConfigError(Exception):

     def __init__(self, range, ex):
         msg = ("Invalid backdoor port configuration '%(range)s': %(ex)s" %
                {'range': port_range, 'ex': ex})
         super(EventletBackdoorConfigError, self).__init__(msg)
         self.port_range = port_range

 def _parse_port_range(port_range):
     if not ':' in port_range:
         start, end = port_range, port_range
     else:
         start, end = port_range.split(':', 1)
     try:
         return int(start), int(end)
     except ValueError as ex:
         raise EventletBackdoorConfigValueError(port_range, ex)

 def _listen(host, port_start, port_end, listen_func):
     try_port = port_start
     while True:
         try:
             return listen_func((host, try_port))
         except socket.error as exc:
             if (exc.errno != errno.EADDRINUSE or
                 try_port >= port_end):
                 raise
             try_port += 1

 ...
     if CONF.backdoor_port is None:
         return None

     port_start, port_end = _parse_port_range(CONF.backdoor_port)
     ...
     sock = _listen('localhost', port_start, port_end, eventlet.listen)


Finally, I'd like to see some real unit tests of this additional complexity - a set of tests for initialize_backdoor() specifically, with eventlet.listen() mocked out, with various different configuration values, testing for success, port range exhaustion and config errors'}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-18 15:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-18 16:02:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-04 22:07:43.000000000', 'message': 'Improve usability when backdoor_port is nonzero

Users who may not know that configuring a backdoor_port with 0
allows multiple services to be enabled for the eventlet backdoor
or who simply want a more predictable port assignment might like
this patch.  If the specified port is in use, it is incremented
until a free port is found.  This is a backdoor_port collision
recovery scheme as opposed to the collision failure scheme
that exists today.

This related to I95fdb5ca: Add support for backdoor_port to be
returned with a rpc call.

Change-Id: I7ec346db3575995fa15483b617eea34c1e003bb0

recovery scheme as opposed to the collision failure scheme
that exists today.

This related to I95fdb5ca: Add support for backdoor_port to be
returned with a rpc call.

Change-Id: I7ec346db3575995fa15483b617eea34c1e003bb0
'}]
commit_message:
Improve usability when backdoor_port is nonzero

Users who may not know that configuring a backdoor_port with 0
allows multiple services to be enabled for the eventlet backdoor
or who simply want a more predictable port assignment might like
this patch. If the specified port is in use, it is incremented
until a free port is found. This is a backdoor_port collision
recovery scheme as opposed to the collision failure scheme
that exists today.

This related to I95fdb5ca: Add support for backdoor_port to be
returned with a rpc call.

Change-Id: I7ec346db3575995fa15483b617eea34c1e003bb0

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible print syntax

Adding an extra pair of braces helps here to
let Python 3.x interpret it as print function,
while not confusing the Python 2.x print operator.

Change-Id: I05af267ecfbcc80753726743fdf82c330350afcb

Common routines for Key Derivation (RFC 5869) and Symmetric Cryptography
that uses standard Crypto functions as exported by PyCrypto

Implements: blueprint trusted-messaging

seems fine. I'm going to assume once RHEL7 gets out we can gut all these RHEL6 work arounds? I'm concerned how much of devstack is needed to change for those RHEL6.

I'm +2 based on the assumption that after RHEL7 launch, we purge the RHEL6 bits."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-06-27 15:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Sean, this is actually a workaround for a bug in Cinder: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1191812

In RHEL the autoextend feature of LVM snaps is disabled but it could well be disabled also on other systems too

Btw, devstack is _ready_ for use on RHEL/CentOS ... was one of the tasks I worked on, have a pull request open to update the website: https://github.com/cloudbuilders/devstack/pull/252'}, {'account_id': 6473, 'date': '2013-06-27 15:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-06-27 20:34:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

We'll put this in but I think it needs a bit more investigation:
* my raring laptop has the exact same config as RHEL6 in lvm.com re snapshot_autoextend_*, precise does not have them at all.
* as long as we keep testing for specific releases like this things will likely break in the future.  For platforms that aren't ubuntu or fedora the folks adding these checks should plan on doing the verify/update if necessary for new releases"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-27 20:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

> my raring laptop has the exact same config as RHEL6 in lvm.com re snapshot_autoextend_*, precise does not have them at all.

Do you run tempest on these?  Specifically tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_get:VolumesGetTestXML.test_volume_create_get_delete_as_clone?'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-06-28 13:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ian, I was just wondering if the same behaviour has been seen on raring or if there was some other difference that mitigated the issue there.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 23:14:09.000000000', 'message': "Update LVM autoextend config for RHEL6

Cinder clones are slightly larger due to some extra metadata.  RHEL6
will not allow auto-extending of LV's without this, leading to clones
giving hard-to-track disk I/O errors.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=975052

Change-Id: I09a5e061a9665c5310383f9f9eb281bfdc8e416d
"}]
commit_message:
Update LVM autoextend config for RHEL6

Cinder clones are slightly larger due to some extra metadata.  RHEL6
will not allow auto-extending of LV's without this, leading to clones
giving hard-to-track disk I/O errors.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=975052

Change-Id: I09a5e061a9665c5310383f9f9eb281bfdc8e416d

commit_message:
Ignore lifecycle events for non-existent instances

Since event delivery is asynchronous, there's an inherent yet benign race in the
event handler querying the database for a deleted instance.

Fixes bug #1180501.

Change-Id: I8e478fb13bedfc86730018ba849ecc71d4286f0d

cookbook-openstack-compute is dependent on the
0.3 openstack-common series already, so if you
try to put, say, a Berksfile together that pulls
in both compute and block-storage, you get an
incompatible dependency. When one cookbook upgrades
its dependency on a new version of the common lib,
all the other cookbooks need to change.

Change-Id: I45df927f0592d267c4da3343e9ccdf42f0410ca7
'}]
commit_message:
Up common depends to 0.3 series

cookbook-openstack-compute is dependent on the
0.3 openstack-common series already, so if you
try to put, say, a Berksfile together that pulls
in both compute and block-storage, you get an
incompatible dependency. When one cookbook upgrades
its dependency on a new version of the common lib,
all the other cookbooks need to change.

Change-Id: I45df927f0592d267c4da3343e9ccdf42f0410ca7

commit_message:
Update pycrypto to 2.6 or later.

The exportKey methods weren't available in pycrypto 2.1.

[{'created': '2013-06-23 18:37:08.000000000', 'message': 'Require eventlet >= 0.9.17

Update to eventlet 0.9.17 requirement from Nova,
commit log is:

    0.9.17 was released 2012-08-03 and
    includes two particular fixes related to OpenStack

    1. https://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/issue/123/
    Fix an exception thrown by epoll in certain cases.
    This can cause jenkins to deadlock, triggered for example by:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10767/

    2. https://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/issue/115/
       https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/903199
    Fix a significant memory leak of _DummyThread objects.

Change-Id: I4a614ff1fcd8deedfe37116d66d183e8aad4a7c3
'}, {'created': '2013-06-24 13:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Require eventlet >= 0.12.0

    This is based on this commit from Nova:

    0.9.17 was released 2012-08-03 and
    includes two particular fixes related to OpenStack

    1. https://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/issue/123/
    Fix an exception thrown by epoll in certain cases.
    This can cause jenkins to deadlock, triggered for example by:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10767/

    2. https://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/issue/115/
       https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/903199
    Fix a significant memory leak of _DummyThread objects.

Change-Id: I4a614ff1fcd8deedfe37116d66d183e8aad4a7c3
'}]
commit_message:
Require eventlet >= 0.12.0

Update to eventlet 0.12.0 requirement from Oslo-Incubator,
commit log is:

    This version has important fixes required
    for ZeroMQ (spurious wakeups).

    Fixes bug 1065532.

    This is based on this commit from Nova:

    0.9.17 was released 2012-08-03 and
    includes two particular fixes related to OpenStack

    1. https://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/issue/123/
    Fix an exception thrown by epoll in certain cases.
    This can cause jenkins to deadlock, triggered for example by:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10767/

    2. https://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/issue/115/
       https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/903199
    Fix a significant memory leak of _DummyThread objects.

Change-Id: I4a614ff1fcd8deedfe37116d66d183e8aad4a7c3

subject: Preserve order and comments when updating
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-10 22:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/32492/1/check/gate-requirements-install/113 : SUCCESS in 12m 12s
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-11 13:26:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Do we still need this tool? I thought we couldn't bring new dependencies into other projects without going through the requirements list first."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-12 12:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

the use of the tool is mainly for quickly updating the particular projects requirements from the canoncial requirements. similar to e.g. oslo-incubator's update.py works. 

I think it still has some use."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-12 12:49:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

My mistake, I thought this was for updating the requirements repo from the project files. 

This approach seems unnecessarily complex. Wouldn't it be simpler to handle each line in the project requirement file as it is read? Copy blank lines and comments directly to the output and update any real requirements with the new versions before printing those. Is there a problem with that approachthat I'm not seeing?"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-12 18:48:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This approach seems unnecessarily complex. Wouldn't it be simpler to handle each line in the project requirement file as it is read?

Thats possible if we want to abandon the possibility to lower-case (thereby deduplify) and sort the requirements file alphabetically. The current update.py script did that. 

I already removed the alphabetical reordering in this patch, although it is debateable if we shouldn't keep it. The patch originally evolved by keeping the comments, but still do the sorting. Later I decided against keeping the re-sorting."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-12 18:48:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-12 19:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can't the order of installation change the version of a second-level dependency that gets brought in? It seems like we've had issues in the past where there were version conflicts, but if we list the "right" version of a second-order dependency before the thing that depends on it, the conflict is resolved. Sorting would break that.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-13 09:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

that seems to be a pretty good reason for giving up the sorting idea then.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-13 09:56:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

removing the weird-dict-handling stuff'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-21 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Preserve order and comments when updating

This removes reordering of the requirements
when updatin the files, as preserving the
order makes reviewing significantly easier.

Also preserve comments around the requirements.

In addition, search for missing test-requirements
also in the tools/pip-requires, to avoid accidentally
dropping them.

Change-Id: I3c51783a42db9907da9d9a98b42b52b5f639bcc8

I agree with Gary that flooding should not be something we need to worry about a lot.

the problem is indeed due to RabbitMQ configuration, even if it might have a disruptive effect on quantum server.
Perhaps we can implement some facility to purge the queue at Quantum startup, or to discard messages when their frequency exceeds a threshold, but this is outside the scope of this patch.

My only question, before blessing this bit of code, is why haven't we tried to solve this issue by leveraging RPC versioning. I did not participate into that review, so I might be mssing something."}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-06-28 12:07:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I tested this with the big switch plugin and seems to be working. The 'call' is made exactly once after which the state report stops since the plugin is not supporting state report."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-06-28 12:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-28 12:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-28 12:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-28 12:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Prior to implementing i did a number of tests:
1. I check that the above code works when the dhcp agent restarts (it does)
2. I check that it works when the quantum service restart (it does)
3. I was also looking into the flood that you mentioned. This does not happen with qpid. I need to check with rabbitmq.
I do not see any code to change at the moment
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-28 12:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Regarding the burst I have a number of points to make here:
1. In my opinion this is a real edge case. The reasoning for this is that I would expect that if someone is running a quantum service then they would have at least 2 quantum servers up and running (this is for high availability). If this is the case then the messages will always be pulled from the message queues.
2. If all of the quantum services are down all of the queued messages will be discarded due to the following check: https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/db/agents_db.py#L169
3. If the issue of the burst is a real issue then this can be addressed by the user purging the queue prior to restarting the quantum service
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-28 12:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I do not think that the cast messages will flood the server. I will add in code that will ensure that flooding is not a problem on the server side.

In the event of a port update the server will check the state of the agent prior to notifying the agent. This means that the agent will not receive some updates.

I am currently checking a state when the server restarts that the sync is done correctly'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-28 12:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

cast is more efficient.

commit_message:
Ensure that the report state is not a blocking call

Fixes bug 1191768

For the dhcp and l3 agents the first state report will be done
via a call. If this succeeds then subsequent calls will be done via
the cast method.

Change-Id: I82a1d92fc84983b7bb46758db0aee3e3eca1d3be

commit_message:
Port location tracking for BigSwitch Plugin

Adds a new table to the Big Switch plugin to keep track of
the nova compute node host IDs that ports reside on.
This table is then used to allow users to override
the VIF type for a compute node based on the host ID.
This allows quantum to control an environment with multiple
VIF types.

Change-Id: I63eb66d970650237aed2d5dc6676a6d097988f8d
Implements: blueprint hostid-vif-override

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-27 15:41:31.000000000', 'message': "autoscaling : Fix issue when scaling to zero instances

As noted in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34564, we lack
coverage of the scenario when MinSize is 0 and we scale down
to zero instances then try to do a delete.  We do the wrong
thing here, by creating a GroupedInstance object with name '',
and this would also result in an incorrect update to the
LoadBalancer.  Fix is to reset the resource_id to None.

Fixes bug #1195364
Change-Id: Ie3a52badf35f7e660de9a8f38635d2a09463123a
"}]
commit_message:
autoscaling : Fix issue when scaling to zero instances

As noted in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34564, we lack
coverage of the scenario when MinSize is 0 and we scale down
to zero instances then try to do a delete.  We do the wrong
thing here, by creating a GroupedInstance object with name '',
and this would also result in an incorrect update to the
LoadBalancer.  Fix is to reset the resource_id to None.

Fixes bug #1195364
Change-Id: Ie3a52badf35f7e660de9a8f38635d2a09463123a

rc-local.service and rabbitmq-server.service. If not configured systemd
will start both services simultaneously and it might cause the first boot
execution to fail because rabbitmq-server wasn't up and running when the
scripts are running. Before I8985d8020f94c257d426065cf914213b35ec959f

Change-Id: Id86b43036f448262f241c04369191dfa253a6aeb
"}, {'created': '2013-06-28 10:36:16.000000000', 'message': "rc-local and rabbitmq-server ordering.

rc-local.service and rabbitmq-server.service. If not configured systemd
will start both services simultaneously and it might cause the first boot
execution to fail because rabbitmq-server wasn't up and running when the

commit_message:
rc-local and rabbitmq-server ordering.

This patch will configure the startup ordering dependency between the
rc-local.service and rabbitmq-server.service. If not configured systemd
will start both services simultaneously and it might cause the first boot
execution to fail because rabbitmq-server wasn't up and running when the
scripts are running. Before I8985d8020f94c257d426065cf914213b35ec959f
this problem wasn't apparent because rabbitmq was manually restarted at
the beginning of the first-boot.d/98-boot-stack script.

Change-Id: Id86b43036f448262f241c04369191dfa253a6aeb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-28 09:39:18.000000000', 'message': 'Port security_group_default_rules extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: If1a6ec71b67f924c008722fd585a24e4fbbd08a6
'}]
commit_message:
Port security_group_default_rules extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: If1a6ec71b67f924c008722fd585a24e4fbbd08a6

commit_message:
Fixed "show/hide advance configuration" in Cluster Templates

* Fixed "show/hide advanced configuration" links in Cluster Creation dialog tabs
* renamed this action to "show/hide full configuration"
* 'Filter' edit box is shown always, no matter if full config hidden or not
* + minor cleanup

Change-Id: I50546e33e6c680022b099062f521af2880328ad8

commit_message:
Add request/response logging when debug=True

* print headers/environ of request and response
* print bodies of request and response

commit_message:
Allow registration of image without tags

* Now user can register image without tags
* "Delete Image" action is renamed to "Unregister Image"
* + small cleanup

Change-Id: I8062005cea7e94f0d1783d40992ecc64426e096d

quantum does not use sqlite_db item.

"}, {'created': '2013-06-28 07:22:05.000000000', 'message': "sync database config items in various plugin's conf files

Bug #1194784

sqlite related sqlite_db and sqlite_synchronous are defined

commit_message:
move database config items into quantum.conf

Bug #1194784

This patch syncs all the DB configuration items into
quantum.conf and removes the related items of plugins' config
file to avoid duplication.

sqlite related sqlite_db and sqlite_synchronous are defined
in 'default' section, which I think is a defect. And it seems
quantum does not use sqlite_db item.

Change-Id: Ia47102ced0e4169f45f10b85311f298d8c026d31

[{'created': '2013-06-27 10:42:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for cleanup of libvirt instance logs

* Added "libvirt_log_path" config parameter in Nova to specify path of the
instance log files.
* The cleanup is performed during the following API operations:
    * Terminate instance
    * Resize
    * Live migration
* Added CommandFilter for rm command in compute filters
* Added corresponding unit test
Fixes LP bug #1160495

Change-Id: I7a15e00330f5a3c9b551f2244ddb96c1e377f5d6
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for cleanup of libvirt instance logs

* Added "libvirt_log_path" config parameter in Nova to specify path of the
instance log files.
* The cleanup is performed during the following API operations:
    * Terminate instance
    * Resize
    * Live migration
* Added CommandFilter for rm command in compute filters
* Added corresponding unit test
Fixes LP bug #1160495

Change-Id: I7a15e00330f5a3c9b551f2244ddb96c1e377f5d6

Chain FORWARD (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination
nova-filter-FORWARD-sitelocl  all  --  anywhere             anywhere
nova-filter-top  all  --  anywhere             anywhere
nova-api-FORWARD  all  --  anywhere             anywhere
quantum-filter-top  all  --  anywhere             anywhere
quantum-openvswi-FORWARD  all  --  anywhere             anywhere'}, {'account_id': 1446, 'date': '2013-06-20 07:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
add sitelocal network rule

this patch is part of a fix of bug 1187397
DocImpact:
  cloud admins can insert REJECT rules
  into the nova-FORWARD-sitelocal rule
  even before starting nova-network, to prevent unwanted traffic
  from VMs to private cloud infrastructure addresses.
  If they do not do this, everything will behave as before.

Change-Id: Iff9b1dbb93f9cf0b8a6f037f16ff9460aef6b6df

If the tap device is connected to an incorrect bridge, it should be
disconnected and re-connected to the correct bridge.

This would enable to update the network of a port in the server and is a
good idea in general to handle error cases when the tap is connected to
the wrong bridge, for whatever reason.

Change-Id: I7f987c2f7ea157ad86ba8775c707818c91d485f7
Signed-off-by: Mike Kolesnik <mkolesni@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Linux Bridge Agent connects tap to correct bridge

If the tap device is connected to an incorrect bridge, it should be
disconnected and re-connected to the correct bridge.

This would enable to update the network of a port in the server and is a
good idea in general to handle error cases when the tap is connected to
the wrong bridge, for whatever reason.

Change-Id: I7f987c2f7ea157ad86ba8775c707818c91d485f7
Signed-off-by: Mike Kolesnik <mkolesni@redhat.com>

Thanks Sean for your constructive criticism.
I have started a discussion on this on the dev mailing list. Previously I had tried to involve the IRC channel, but nobody was interested.
As for your points 2 and 3, the whole point of trying to contribute to OpenStack was so that the external tool, not in pip, not in openstack requirements, and not added to nova requirements or source tree would become an internal piece in the first place. commit_message:
Adds pinhead support

Hooks are declared for run_instance and terminate_instance. They call
into the same pinhead entry point, which triggers a pinhead run.

Change-Id: Ib333a87885a5f2bcc159c8182507576b380a36d3
Implements: blueprint auto-cpu-pinning

[{'created': '2013-06-17 21:11:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add Nova NoVNC Proxy to devstack-vm-gate

The NoVNC Proxy is not covered by gate tests right now, which can
result in problems like bug 1190628.  This change adds n-novnc
to the list of services started during devstack gate so that tests
can be run against it.

Change-Id: I836393ed6c353643ca1915f706bc6b7130141612
'}]
commit_message:
Add Nova NoVNC Proxy to devstack-vm-gate

The NoVNC Proxy is not covered by gate tests right now, which can
result in problems like bug 1190628.  This change adds n-novnc
to the list of services started during devstack gate so that tests
can be run against it.

Change-Id: I836393ed6c353643ca1915f706bc6b7130141612

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 23:20:34.000000000', 'message': 'Enable messaging for openstack-compute

Just as with openstack-image, this change lets openstack-compute take
advantage of the messaging attributes proposed for openstack-common.
Ultimately, this allows one to provide data about the messaging
infrastrcuture from openstack-common, thereby eliminating the need to
search (although this will still be possible at add later) and removes
any dependency on specific messaging implementations from
openstack-compute itself. Further this mechanism will support other
messaging services as they become available.

Change-Id: I567410eae6d84765afbaec16a78f380ab5a14b39
'}]
commit_message:
Enable messaging for openstack-compute

Just as with openstack-image, this change lets openstack-compute take
advantage of the messaging attributes proposed for openstack-common.
Ultimately, this allows one to provide data about the messaging
infrastrcuture from openstack-common, thereby eliminating the need to
search (although this will still be possible at add later) and removes
any dependency on specific messaging implementations from
openstack-compute itself. Further this mechanism will support other
messaging services as they become available.

Change-Id: I567410eae6d84765afbaec16a78f380ab5a14b39

'}]
commit_message:
Enable openstack-common messaging changes

As default messaging attributes have just been proposed to be added
to openstack-common, these changes rework openstack-image to take
advantage of that.  In these changes, I bump the openstack-common
dependency to 0.3.1 and enable rabbit in api.rb. This allows a user
to avoid searching for the rabbit node (but also provides the ability
for us to add search later) and is pluggable enough such that we can
later introduce alternative message queue services. As we are not
searching for the messaging nodes, I also remove those (now) unused
attributes.

Change-Id: Id462d0564d8a2fbdbab2ab7e6ce0953515dbb3ac

commit_message:
adapt zvm volume disk to cinder

IBM z/VM managed SCSI disks through xCAT disk pool. OpenStack will call
xCAT SCSI disk management REST API to carve or return disks from disk
pool, also, the snapshot, the volume to image and image to volume
features are supported.

Part of blueprint zvm-cinder

Change-Id: Ifd8bc271b9847f0a71f2f60cd72e45b789d96320

[{'created': '2013-06-11 11:22:56.000000000', 'message': 'Adds support for cleanup of libvirt instance logs

This patch adds support to the libvirt driver for removing instance's log files.
This cleanup is performed during the following API operations:
    * Terminate instance
    * Resize
    * Live migration

* Also adds "libvirt_log_path" config parameter in Nova to specify path of the
instance log files.

Fixes LP bug #1160495

Change-Id: I605d7b0b973bcf6a1bdb8215358be6a6ae023af8

commit_message:
Add support for cleanup of libvirt instance logs

* Added "libvirt_log_path" config parameter in Nova to specify path of the
instance log files.

* The cleanup is performed during the following API operations:
    * Terminate instance
    * Resize
    * Live migration

* Added CommandFilter for rm command in compute filters

* Added corresponding unit test

Fixes LP bug #1160495

Change-Id: I605d7b0b973bcf6a1bdb8215358be6a6ae023af8

commit_message:
Fix unit test for shell outputs error message

Unit tests provide output like Unknown command ['f', 'a', 'k', 'e']
Because logging.level was seted to Debug
Change log level from DEBUG to INFO.
Also delete unused code from tests

Fixes: bug #1161849
Change-Id: I488e390d6b203a6fd2b3932d606b83656d49b7f2

commit_message:
Run flake8 also on cinder/*/openstack

exclude=openstack also matches cinder/api/openstack,
which is however not merged from oslo-incubator.
Exclude=common instead, and explicitely include
cinder/common

Change-Id: I331d8c0d17e519386ae72caeca8a336eecde3ad3

subject: Better default for my_ip if 8.8.8.8 is unreachable
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5371, 'name': 'Mathew Odden', 'email': 'locke105@gmail.com', 'username': 'locke105'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 7629, 'name': 'Shawn Hartsock', 'email': 'hartsock@acm.org', 'username': 'hartsocks'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-25 13:49:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Picking the first interface's IP address doesn't seem reliable enough for our purposes. You should be able to find out what interface the default route will use, and then snag the address of that interface specifically, right?

Of course, that interface could have multiple addresses (which you won't find with ifconfig, which is a good reason not to use it, by the way. So some matching of the address to the netmask of the default route would be most reliable I think."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-25 13:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:09:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/34389/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/30098 : SUCCESS in 4m 12s

- http://logs.openstack.org/34389/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/26039 : SUCCESS in 37m 30s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34389/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/25745 : SUCCESS in 53m 17s

- http://logs.openstack.org/34389/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/14715 : SUCCESS in 10m 46s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-25 16:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-25 16:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks for the comments, Dan and Gary. I am trying another tactic...how about this?

run "ip route | grep default" and grab interface from there say eth0

then run "ip addr show dev eth0" and pick the first ipv4 from there. 

example from one of my boxes.

    # ip route | grep default
    default via 172.21.160.1 dev customer 

    # ip addr show dev customer
    24: customer: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN 
        link/ether 00:00:c9:d9:24:02 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
        inet 172.21.160.22/24 brd 172.21.160.255 scope global customer
        inet 172.21.160.32/24 brd 172.21.160.255 scope global secondary customer
        inet6 fe80::200:c9ff:fed9:2402/64 scope link 
           valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

would give us 172.21.160.22'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-25 17:18:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's what I was suggesting, but with one change. I think you should grab the gateway and netmask for the default route, and choose from the addresses on the corresponding device based on what is in the same subnet as the gateway address (one of them has to be, else the route could not have been added or something has changed since). If nothing matches, then take the first. If no addresses are on that interface, then take localhost."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 00:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 00:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 00:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dan, Gary,

Made the recommended changes. please take a peek.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 00:29:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 00:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 00:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 00:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 00:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-26 01:00:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Thanks, I think this implements the algorithm I described (although I haven't checked very closely).

Some concerns about the implementation inline, but those should be easy to resolve."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 01:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-26 01:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Better default for my_ip if 8.8.8.8 is unreachable

Run if route/show, extract ipv4 addresses and pick the first one.
Fall back to 127.0.0.1 as before if we don't find anything
or if we have running the ip route/show commands

Fixes LP# 1193013

Change-Id: If73f0f6bf67f858f7506220debab0f74cc9e3cb4

commit_message:
Add method get_host_uptime for powervm driver

This commit implements method get_host_uptime for powervm compute driver
like KVM did. It makes powervm compute driver can return uptime through
Rest API /v2/{tenant-id}/os-hypervisors/id/uptime

Fixes bug #1195151

Change-Id: If3b09b5c00e687775af19e26a7400fc3eb5b68aa

commit_message:
Rename SQL get_session() -> create_session()

As ayoung pointed out in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27881/ :

get_session() implies that the method is accessing an existing session,
rather than always creating a new session using the sessionmaker. This
rename makes the actual behavior much more obvious.

Change-Id: Iad77a7e950e4942c52e8c9858b21bad27d0d5283

commit_message:
Format resource required_by in resource-show.

This change has no effect if the resource details contains
no requires key (such as for older API versions).

Change-Id: I4dca0e1d7515c1e3b4cbd7be4e5b4220fbca9242

[{'created': '2013-06-20 06:48:09.000000000', 'message': 'Unmock requests when testing complete.

Any other tests running will unexpectedly have mocks installed for
requests otherwise. Make the time mock behave the same way whilst there.

Change-Id: Iec4f35c51ed4650a35ae2780637192c82042a980
'}, {'created': '2013-06-20 08:08:22.000000000', 'message': 'Unmock requests when testing complete.

Any other tests running will unexpectedly have mocks installed for
requests otherwise. Make the time mock behave the same way whilst there.

Change-Id: Iec4f35c51ed4650a35ae2780637192c82042a980
'}, {'created': '2013-06-20 08:08:22.000000000', 'message': 'Unmock requests when testing complete.

Any other tests running will unexpectedly have mocks installed for
requests otherwise. Make the time mock behave the same way whilst there.

Change-Id: Iec4f35c51ed4650a35ae2780637192c82042a980
'}]
commit_message:
Unmock requests when testing complete.

Any other tests running will unexpectedly have mocks installed for
requests otherwise. Make the time mock behave the same way whilst there.

Change-Id: Iec4f35c51ed4650a35ae2780637192c82042a980

commit_message:
Fix Notifications

    Conditionally include Service ID for create/delete instance
    Removed old configuration for Exists Notifications

Change-Id: Id2d87b6dffff00479c9ef0ecd8dd77e3e1e3eb47
Fixes: bug #1192384

commit_message:
Orchestration tests to use own credentials.

Heat tests have unique credentials requirements, so the identity admin.
credentials cannot be used.

These requirements are:
- (username=admin) must be an admin user with authority to create
  other users
- (tenant_name=demo) tenant must have a private quantum network
  with dhcp enabled

Change-Id: I72134e124ca9f207d5102d089009413a6e149b62

commit_message:
Fix resizes with attached file-based volumes

Bug 1190364

get_instance_disk_info() now takes an additional, optional argument
of block_device_info. When passed in, we use it to filter out
volumes, such that they are not returned. Previously, any devices
classified as "file" as parsed from the instance XML were considered
local disks. This assumption is incorrect, since some volumes are
simply files, rather than block devices.

Added a new test, based almost entirely off the existing test case
for this function, which represents an XML file with two fake
file-based (NFS-like) volumes and associated block_device_info to
claim those volumes.

Change-Id: I4809a8fd68eb0f709347aa7cad0fa85389ade41c

commit_message:
Fixed wrong security-group-rules endpoint in docs.

The Security Group Rules endpoint was wrong in the docs
(/security_group_rules). All erroneous occurences have been corrected
to the right endpoint (/security-group-rules).

Change-Id: I2c3a13ddd8ec4376865858a71b024737adc32423

commit_message:
Allow tenant ID for authentication

Tenant names are not necessarily unique for a User, so the client
should also allow authentication by tenant_id

Change-Id: Id758174529b763cfb1dfccb2d5c4a6fd6278e85f

[{'created': '2013-06-19 08:38:11.000000000', 'message': 'Do not reraise exceptions

Replace "raise e" with "raise"

Change-Id: I8dffc36ba5780911dd57d7161d218d0324af60b3
Fixes: bug #1191730
'}, {'created': '2013-06-24 09:43:10.000000000', 'message': 'Do not raise NEW exceptions

Raising NEW exception is bad practice, because we lose TraceBack.
So all places like:

except SomeException as e:
    raise e

should be replaced by

except SomeException:
    raise

If we are doing some other actions before reraising we should
store information about exception then do all actions and then
reraise it. This is caused by eventlet bug. It lost information
about exception if it switch threads.

fixes bug 1191730

Change-Id: I8dffc36ba5780911dd57d7161d218d0324af60b3
'}]
commit_message:
Do not raise NEW exceptions

Raising NEW exception is bad practice, because we lose TraceBack.
So all places like:

except SomeException as e:
    raise e

should be replaced by

except SomeException:
    raise

If we are doing some other actions before reraising we should
store information about exception then do all actions and then
reraise it. This is caused by eventlet bug. It lost information
about exception if it switch threads.

fixes bug 1191730

Change-Id: I8dffc36ba5780911dd57d7161d218d0324af60b3

Hi Walter!  I have a concern regarding get_all_block_devices.  It uses /dev/disk/by-path to decide if there are still LUNs attached.  During my testing (for target that allows more than one LUNs to be attached), I found that it is not reliable because it is displaying stale entries.  It doesn't always refresh correctly even after rescan.  The only way for me to get it to display correctly is to logout and login again, which is not an elegant solution.  Thanks."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2013-06-19 17:51:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Seems that the dangling/stale iSCSI LUNs in the host's /dev/disk/by-path exists in the current nova code, which I just confirmed.

1) create a VM instance
2) create 2 volumes
3) attach both volumes and look in /dev/disk/by-path
4) detach 1 volume and look in /dev/disk/by-path
both LUNs are still there."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(10 inline comments)

Mostly formatting questions, one major issue that should be looked at/worked through before moving forward.

The major issue is the compound if statement with the in-line list comhprehension in cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py.

The rest are minor and more consistency ease of reading later related."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2013-06-19 21:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (9 inline comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-11 22:34:32.000000000', 'message': "First step in attach/detach refactoring.

This patch adds the new brick initiator connector object
which contains the code to do volume attach and detach to a host
machine.  It includes hooks to work in both cinder and nova.
Nova has different exec wrapper and it also needs to talk to a
hypervisor at certain points during detach.

This patch also pulls the copy/pasted code from nova in the base
ISCSIDriver's _attach_volume method to use this new brick library.

This patch also includes a fix in the ISCSIDriver's
copy_volume_to_image code that didn't actually detach a volume
when it was done with the operation.

Blueprint cinder-refactor-attach

Change-Id: Ieb181f896adb9230bbb6a2e5c42f261d61a0f140

commit_message:
Add Brick iSCSI attach/detach.

This patch adds the new brick initiator connector object
which contains the code to do volume attach and detach to a host
machine.  It includes hooks to work in both cinder and nova.
Nova has different exec wrapper and it also needs to talk to a
hypervisor at certain points during detach.

This patch also pulls the copy/pasted code from nova in the base
ISCSIDriver's _attach_volume method to use this new brick library.

This patch also includes a fix in the ISCSIDriver's
copy_volume_to_image code that didn't actually detach a volume
when it was done with the operation.
Bug 1194962

This patch also includes a fix for iSCSI detaches where the
iSCSI LUN wasn't being removed from the system until the very
last detach issues an iscsiadm logout.
Bug 1112483

This patch includes a fix for iSCSI multipath detaches where
the multipath device and the iSCSI LUNs for the multipath device
were never removed from the kernel.
Bug 1112483

Blueprint cinder-refactor-attach

Change-Id: Ieb181f896adb9230bbb6a2e5c42f261d61a0f140

commit_message:
Add support to linuxbridge for Red Hat distros

This mirrors the changes made to the OVS plugin/agent to support
Red Hat-based distros. It also adds default sql_connection and
network_vlan_ranges that mirror the ones set for the OVS plugin.

Change-Id: I8b84a67306275bbb446cf9a913b02b6580f1f67c

[{'created': '2013-06-27 01:57:58.000000000', 'message': 'Changed to the common `["openstack"]["database"]` attributes.

We have standardized on our attributes.  As we work on the wrapper
cookbook, the openstack-common library needs to have the default
attributes.  The wrapper cookbooks would then override these
settings or use the defaults.  This update is minimally invasive,
it allows the global setting of port and db type.  However,
doesn't touch the existing per database overriding of port and db
type.

Change-Id: I2dd6f03f30901f5dfb118c82024055c2d0e0d255
'}, {'created': '2013-06-27 18:34:09.000000000', 'message': 'Using the common `["openstack"]["db"]` attributes.

Allows the global setting of port and db type.

Change-Id: I2dd6f03f30901f5dfb118c82024055c2d0e0d255
'}]
commit_message:
Using the common `["openstack"]["db"]` attributes.

Allows the global setting of port and db type.

Change-Id: I2dd6f03f30901f5dfb118c82024055c2d0e0d255

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-22 04:48:43.000000000', 'message': 'Continued work on rabbit host methods

Did not increase the version, b/c 1.3.0 is still under development.
We should not migrate to this version, until we complete this work.
We are using the new ["openstack"]["mq"] attributes.  It is up
to the operator to install rabbit, and make these ["openstack"]["mq"]
attributes available.
* The #rabbit_servers method will return the ["openstack"]["mq"]["servers"]
  value if defined.  Otherwise, it will perform a search, and construct
  a comma-delimited list of servers.
* The #rabbit_server method will return the ["openstack"]["mq"]["server"]
  value if defined.  Otherwise, will perform a search, and return the first
  rabbit server found.

Change-Id: Ia3771d70ea7eeb367b1fa17c5258f719528b5d22

commit_message:
Continued work on rabbit host methods

Did not increase the version, b/c 1.3.0 is still under development.
We should not migrate to this version, until we complete this work.
We are using the new ["openstack"]["mq"] attributes.  It is up
to the operator to install rabbit, and make these ["openstack"]["mq"]
attributes available.
* The #rabbit_servers method will return the ["openstack"]["mq"]["servers"]
  value if defined.  Otherwise, it will perform a search, and construct
  a comma-delimited list of servers.
* The #rabbit_server method will return the ["openstack"]["mq"]["server"]
  value if defined.  Otherwise, will perform a search, and return the first
  rabbit server found.

Change-Id: Ia3771d70ea7eeb367b1fa17c5258f719528b5d22

commit_message:
Add cli_dir to tempest config

Add the cli_dir option to the generated tempest config.  This is
required on platforms such as RHEL where the binaries are not in the
standard location.

Note that to be fully operational this requires [1] in tempest so that
the cli path is created correctly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34302/

Change-Id: Ic7369193f1434974366cfabc7550e8545de244cd

commit_message:
Fix test cases not running under python 2.6

Test cases running depends on `discover' package, but in python 2.6,
`discover' package is not there. So need to add `discover' in
test-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I1129bc50c97861c9fca3894261ea1b831cd3f6cc
Fixes: bug #1193349

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 06:00:51.000000000', 'message': "Remove formpost's custom cache lookups.

Formpost was looking for tempurl keys in memcache, but it's been
broken since commit 21343ab (2013-05-02) when tempurl changed its
memcache keys, so the lookup would always miss. (Since tempurl started
storing *lists* of keys, formpost would have choked on the new data,
so that oversight was the only thing keeping formpost working at all.)

Now formpost just uses the same get_account_info() call as everyone
else does, so it gets all the benefits of the new caching framework.

Change-Id: I426d8f2882ebe3ce373de604b9ff18846f5999e3
"}, {'created': '2013-06-26 19:37:54.000000000', 'message': "Make formpost work with multiple tempurl keys.

Formpost wouldn't look at X-Account-Meta-Temp-URL-Key-2 for signature
validation, which was confusing to users. Now it does, and there's a
utility function that formpost and tempurl both use to help prevent
divergence in the future.

Also removed formpost's custom cache-lookup logic. Formpost was
looking for tempurl keys in memcache, but it's been broken since
commit 21343ab (2013-05-02) when tempurl changed its memcache keys, so
the lookup would always miss. (Since tempurl started storing *lists*
of keys, formpost would have choked on the new data, so that oversight
was the only thing keeping formpost working at all.)

Now formpost just uses the same get_account_info() call as everyone
else does, so it gets all the benefits of the new caching framework.

Change-Id: I426d8f2882ebe3ce373de604b9ff18846f5999e3
"}]
commit_message:
Make formpost work with multiple tempurl keys.

Formpost wouldn't look at X-Account-Meta-Temp-URL-Key-2 for signature
validation, which was confusing to users. Now it does, and there's a
utility function that formpost and tempurl both use to help prevent
divergence in the future.

Also removed formpost's custom cache-lookup logic. Formpost was
looking for tempurl keys in memcache, but it's been broken since
commit 21343ab (2013-05-02) when tempurl changed its memcache keys, so
the lookup would always miss. (Since tempurl started storing *lists*
of keys, formpost would have choked on the new data, so that oversight
was the only thing keeping formpost working at all.)

Now formpost just uses the same get_account_info() call as everyone
else does, so it gets all the benefits of the new caching framework.

Change-Id: I426d8f2882ebe3ce373de604b9ff18846f5999e3

commit_message:
Create the /images directory used by the resize functionality.

XenServer's resize uses /images as a known-path for each hypervisor.
This is a symlink to the storage repository so disks can be moved between
the /images path and the storage repository efficiently.

Change-Id: I13b39dbf5537ad45160c1af4cc10bd867b7f89c1

'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-05-24 18:34:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

A thought - why is write_queue_file called on Exception, only to have the same file unconditionally removed at the end of the function?  If these lines were removed this patch would be unnecessary...

Also, the test is relying on the fact that the call to update_image will throw an uncaught exception, hence the queue file isn't removed and we can verify it's been encrypted.  I have some error handling code for the call to update_image but just realised it would break this test.

It would be good to understand if it's necessary to re-write the queue file in the first place."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-05-29 17:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Paul, you raise a very good point. The only thing that I can see is if self.registry.update_image() raises an exception then the information in the file could be used.

Can anyone else verify this?'}, {'account_id': 6662, 'date': '2013-06-05 20:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-09 18:25:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The practice of writing failed cleanup attempts back into the queue, and then immediately deleting them from the queue seems to have originated in a logical error in the patch that initially switched the scrubber to using a file-backed queue. (Patch is 27b3df28)

Prior to that patch, failures were simply logged and not retried, which I guess is exactly what is happening now.

Since I am not aware of any bug reports about scrubber failing to retry, I think the best thing to do is to simply remove the write_queue_file calls from the exception handlers.

In addition, it appears that the attached functional test would not pass because the queue file should have been deleted before the test can assert the queue files contents. The reason the jenkins run passed is because the attached test is skipped."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-17 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-17 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix for unencrypted uris in scrubber queue files

The scrubber can write unencrypted uris in queue files in
certain conditions. This fixes the problem by removing the
lines which write the queue files when exceptions occur.

Test included.

Fixes bug 1180884

Change-Id: If742a84cea1bd1f5abf99fb0e3cbd1e0c1623171

commit_message:
Permit PXE deploy timeout configuration.

Nova defaults PXE deploys to not time out, which leads to wedged
machines requiring admin intervention -  even when they can be
software recovered.

Fix bug 1184475.

Change-Id: I600a5dd1da19228023cc82e4b4fd961280f54b96

commit_message:
Remove reference to quantum cli in provider network extension

We don't need this info in the doc string as it is already in the admin
guide. If the CLI changes then we'll also have to update the doc string.

Fixes bug 1195429

Change-Id: If27788477c886f6faedbc5fca7856b683a6953f1

commit_message:
Fix volume restore failure.
volume.py changes to add transition state restoring-backup
and handle cinder backup restore.

Change-Id: I9c209e66034c0b347bf5ab7809fab65ba1855aba

commit_message:
Remove trivial cases of unused variables (3)

Kill some of the variables marked as unused by flakes8. This should
allow to enable F841 check in the future.
Only trivial cases with no function calls and obviously pure functions
(like datetime.now(), or len()) are cleaned up here.

Part 3, split to reduce conflicts.

Change-Id: I7b8e806ddd7b0e077243d4e31de140cd08fe0155

commit_message:
Fix cluster delete when instances are already deleted

The commit fixes an error during cluster delete caused by
nova.servers().delete(instance_id) fail if given instance
is already deleted

Change-Id: Icc63b3a2e5e159de110f99d22a6a13181c2d2c62

Nothing that jumps out at me, would like John's POV"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:06:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

OK, so almost there. Most of the comments are very very minor.

However, currently we default to using that interface you are removing:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/stackrc#L181

I think BobBall suggested there was a nice way to auto-detect the management URL, rather than defaulting to something that will now never work.

You could just change stack.sh to ask the user for the correct answer, until we have the above logic in place, just like we do for passwords already."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-06-20 09:56:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We're running install_os_domU in dom0 so we should get the IP from there and either inject it into the localrc or, more preferably, xenstore.

Perhaps - since a hosts IP address could change - we should be getting it on host boot and punshing it into xenstore / the VM's xenstore-key."}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-20 13:23:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Okay, so I tried out the xenstore communication, but it seems, xenstore could not be read before the xenfs is mounted, so it might not be available by the time devstack needs it. I would prefer not to modify localrc, it's already a placeholder for too many things, making it an r/w access general purpose communitation channel would not help in this situation. BobBall has strong feelings against using kernel parameters, and also keen to get back the HIMN to play.

So for now, I will remove the HIMN on eth0, and die if I don't have a xenapi url.

As soon as we know how to use HIMN to communicate with xenapi, we could start using that. But for now, let's stay only on the management network.

@John: If we had a HIMN (Host Internal Management Network), and xapi would also have an IP on the OS Management Network, would that work (after making xapi calls to discover the xapi IP on OS Management net)?"}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-20 13:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-20 14:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress

testing'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 14:43:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-20 14:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Ready For Review

tests ran'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-20 15:33:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

I think the easiest place to pass the URL into the VM is here:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/tools/xen/build_xva.sh#L143

Anyway, I am OK with this change, but there are ways we could make it easier when the user doesn't want to change anything in localrc

If we change the above line in build_xva, we can probably do away with a lot of the silly settings listed in the readme as required."}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-20 21:08:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Yes, you can change the generation of run.sh You just need to remember, that run.sh is your entry point from now, so that you can't run stack.sh - because your localrc would be incomplete. Anyhow, thanks for the comments."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-06-24 10:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-24 10:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

You already have to run from run.sh, otherwise strange things can happen, but agreed that is a bit strange.

I think, long term, we should ask the user questions and populate the localrc for them, just like stack.sh does, but either way, this is a good step forward.'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-06-24 12:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

At the moment you can run stack.sh, there is nothing special in run.sh that would cause "strange things".

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/tools/xen/build_xva.sh#L139'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-24 16:34:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

But what about these bits, if you don't happen to set them in the localrc file?
VIRT_DRIVER=xenserver FORCE=yes MULTI_HOST=$MULTI_HOST HOST_IP_IFACE=$HOST_IP_IFACE $STACKSH_PARAMS

Anyways, lets worry about this in another change. What you have here looks like a nice simple approach that is a good step forward."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-06-24 21:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'created': '2013-06-20 13:53:20.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: Cleanup networking

OpenStack VM had 4 interfaces, from which eth0 was connected to HIMN (Host
Internal Management Network), and not used at all. The reason for not
using this interface according to johngarbutt is:
 - VNC console would not work
 - migrations would not work
 - many other things
This change removes the interface, thus devstack is providing the
same architecture as described in the official documentation, YAGNI
applied on the HIMN:

    http://goo.gl/dmrNF

The change also modifies some defaults, so it's easier to get started:
 - The Ubuntu VM is network-installed through the management network
 - OS VM is getting its address on the management network through DHCP
 - Default Public IP addresses aligned to stack.sh defaults
 - OS Services are listening on Management Interface

Related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: I73c9751ade6f4786b8b682a1994cb87f0a624379
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Cleanup networking

OpenStack VM had 4 interfaces, from which eth0 was connected to HIMN (Host
Internal Management Network), and not used at all. The reason for not
using this interface according to johngarbutt is:
 - VNC console would not work
 - migrations would not work
 - many other things
This change removes the interface, thus devstack is providing the
same architecture as described in the official documentation, YAGNI
applied on the HIMN:

    http://goo.gl/dmrNF

The change also modifies some defaults, so it's easier to get started:
 - The Ubuntu VM is network-installed through the management network
 - OS VM is getting its address on the management network through DHCP
 - Default Public IP addresses aligned to stack.sh defaults
 - OS Services are listening on Management Interface

Related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: I73c9751ade6f4786b8b682a1994cb87f0a624379

commit_message:
Baremetal_deploy_helper error message formatting.

Updates our baremetal_deploy_helper so our error message use
formatting that works with translations.

Change-Id: I8811df50f0e80c5680e6316c829a197b0ade5967

commit_message:
Organize limits units and per-units constants

During v3 api review there was an agreement that would be nice to move limits
constants to utils file and refactor its usage inside limits api to avoid
unnecessary code duplication.

Also changed TestLimiter class to MockLimiter since that name can be confuse to
some unit test frameworks.

Change-Id: I1b8626e8d1e3257333d4dfee61591fd4cde82bd1

commit_message:
Don't keep the state/version in the task name.

Instead of having individual entries for the task
that change with the state name + version, we should
instead just keep the same task name but update the metadata
about the states the task has gone through instead. Also
store the task version in the same metadata and warn users
when the versions may be incompat.

This makes it easier to see what a task has done
without having to know all the states it has gone
through (just to find the task details about that
task) as well as being able to detect version issues.

Change-Id: Ia6b9400394212230905341d205d966dfdee5dfdf

b

Change-Id: I92ed534d9a2c5ef68e6d5d1e189bf65650ba80d3

commit_message:
Fix @property_hash creation in custom types.

 * @property_hash for the network, subnet and router types was
   previously being created by referencing values in a hash indexed
   by strings, but using symbols to do so.  This patch ensures
   that strings are used to reference values in the hash.

Change-Id: I778ce277574d5f5b201b0173d51dfc16086e73cb

Current implementation of check_for_setup_error() of sheepdog driver
cannot work correctly with the latest version of sheepdog cluster.
This patch fixes it and adds tests for both old and new version.

Fixes: bug #1195098
Change-Id: Ia710789e4bedd7c83cd47eff6b2fc532af39d94a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix check_for_setup_error for sheepdog driver

Current implementation of check_for_setup_error() of sheepdog driver
cannot work correctly with the latest version of sheepdog cluster.
This patch fixes it and adds tests for both old and new version.

Fixes: bug #1195098
Change-Id: Ia710789e4bedd7c83cd47eff6b2fc532af39d94a

[{'created': '2013-06-17 17:35:13.000000000', 'message': 'eventlet.monkey_patch() for spince and vnc proxy.

The spice and VNC proxy apps did not run eventlet.monkey_patch().  These
services use rpc to talk to nova-consoleauth, so eventlet is required.

Note that this is a stable/grizzly patch only.  The issue does not
affect master (havana) anymore as it was resolved as a side effect of
switching everything in bin/ over to using entry points.  The monkey
patching is done in nova/cmd/__init__.py now.

Fix bug 1191886.

Change-Id: Ib6c2ee8909638bec012e29cd2be06838b90e31b8
'}, {'created': '2013-06-17 18:23:34.000000000', 'message': 'eventlet.monkey_patch() for spice and vnc proxy.

services use rpc to talk to nova-consoleauth, so eventlet is required.

Note that this is a stable/grizzly patch only.  The issue does not
affect master (havana) anymore as it was resolved as a side effect of
switching everything in bin/ over to using entry points.  The monkey
patching is done in nova/cmd/__init__.py now.

Fix bug 1191886.

Change-Id: Ib6c2ee8909638bec012e29cd2be06838b90e31b8
'}]
commit_message:
eventlet.monkey_patch() for spice and vnc proxy.

The spice and VNC proxy apps did not run eventlet.monkey_patch().  These
services use rpc to talk to nova-consoleauth, so eventlet is required.

Note that this is a stable/grizzly patch only.  The issue does not
affect master (havana) anymore as it was resolved as a side effect of
switching everything in bin/ over to using entry points.  The monkey
patching is done in nova/cmd/__init__.py now.

Fix bug 1191886.

Change-Id: Ib6c2ee8909638bec012e29cd2be06838b90e31b8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-27 16:43:06.000000000', 'message': "Don't rely on Array.to_s which differs between Ruby 1.8 and 1.9

The should contain_quantum... call is relying on the stringification
of params bridge_mappings/bridge_uplinks arrays for a successful match.
With ruby 1.8, this currently works by accident since the array only
has 1 value and is stringified to something like 'default:br-ex'.
With ruby 1.9, it is stringified to '[default:br-ex]' causing the
match (and therefor the tests) to fail.

This patch bypasses the differing to_s implementations by just
calling join(',')

Change-Id: I6ab9fd6a04cdee652c86512d871560effd7b08a5
"}]
commit_message:
Don't rely on Array.to_s which differs between Ruby 1.8 and 1.9

The should contain_quantum... call is relying on the stringification
of params bridge_mappings/bridge_uplinks arrays for a successful match.
With ruby 1.8, this currently works by accident since the array only
has 1 value and is stringified to something like 'default:br-ex'.
With ruby 1.9, it is stringified to '[default:br-ex]' causing the
match (and therefor the tests) to fail.

This patch bypasses the differing to_s implementations by just
calling join(',')

Change-Id: I6ab9fd6a04cdee652c86512d871560effd7b08a5

This initial commit provides support for an openstack-ops-messaging
cookbook. In this initial release, we provide the capability to install
and configure RabbitMQ. This cookbook is modeled after the
openstack-ops-database cookbook in the way in which it can be utilized.

Included are tests for all recipes and this release supports Ubuntu
only.

Change-Id: I4d799fa46e67e0f2eca2ac8b205f51c07e0df01e
'}]
commit_message:
Initial commit of openstack-ops-messaging cookbook

This initial commit provides support for an openstack-ops-messaging
cookbook. In this initial release, we provide the capability to install
and configure RabbitMQ. This cookbook is modeled after the
openstack-ops-database cookbook in the way in which it can be utilized.

Included are tests for all recipes and this release supports Ubuntu
only.

Change-Id: I4d799fa46e67e0f2eca2ac8b205f51c07e0df01e

commit_message:
Moved database table, user, grants creation

This cookbook should handle the creation of tables, users, grants
for use with OpenStack.  Once this is merged, will remove the
db recipe from each cookbook.

Change-Id: I309c4d0fedc8c78f779dbd17b265bfa7e78ffd89
