commit_message:
Log xml in libvirt _create_domain failures

When an error occurs defining, launching or enabling hairpin mode on a
libvirt domain, log the xml for reproduction and analysis.

Fixes bug 1183534

Change-Id: Ic8f1d11c5a92779c686b7248895bbc6f2cfdbf0b

commit_message:
Port flavor_access extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the flavor_access extension and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I671f490bad2daaaae06d48328f4fff10076ab0ed

commit_message:
Sync to_primitive() IPAddress support from Oslo

This enlightens to_primitive() that it may just call str() to
serialize netaddr.IPAddress objects.

We need this for NovaObject serialization through legacy interfaces
temporarily while we migrate things.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Ibdee90e4bbd337d541344977e2a689982e0a7d34

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-27 09:46:00.000000000', 'message': 'Save some more image attributes to volume_glance_metadata.

Current issue: When copying an image to a volume, attributes like size, disk_format, container_format,
checksum, min_disk and min_ram have not been copied so far. When booting a VM from a volume, we are
not able to check these atrributes without giving the image id. Furthermore, if the original
image is deleted, we will lose all the information.

This patch saves these attributes into volume_glance_metadata. We can still check these attributes
without giving the image id when booting a VM from a volume.

Fixed Bug 1159824.

Change-Id: I42ce676026d32be6e3f4bec6fd269908e2df0a8c
'}, {'created': '2013-06-27 10:02:44.000000000', 'message': 'Save some more image attributes to volume_glance_metadata.

Current issue: When copying an image to a volume, attributes like size, disk_format, container_format,
checksum, min_disk and min_ram have not been copied so far. When booting a VM from a volume, we are
not able to check these atrributes without giving the image id. Furthermore, if the original
image is deleted, we will lose all the information.

This patch saves these attributes into volume_glance_metadata. We can still check these attributes
without giving the image id when booting a VM from a volume.

Fixed Bug 1159824.

Change-Id: I42ce676026d32be6e3f4bec6fd269908e2df0a8c
'}]
commit_message:
Save some more image attributes to volume_glance_metadata.

Current issue: When copying an image to a volume, attributes like size, disk_format, container_format,
checksum, min_disk and min_ram have not been copied so far. When booting a VM from a volume, we are
not able to check these atrributes without giving the image id. Furthermore, if the original
image is deleted, we will lose all the information.

This patch saves these attributes into volume_glance_metadata. We can still check these attributes
without giving the image id when booting a VM from a volume.

Fixed Bug 1159824.

Change-Id: I42ce676026d32be6e3f4bec6fd269908e2df0a8c

commit_message:
Remove creation of Domain entries in LDAP

Domain entries are no longer stored in keystone ldap.
Removing the creation from devstack ldap install

Fixes Bug 1194204

Change-Id: I9c93d3021cc2bb058d1ef57bebcf3a13dc5bdd34

commit_message:
engine : autoscaling refactor Instance list->object logic

Refactor the conversion from instance list to GroupedInstance
objects, so it's not contained by the handle_delete and can be
reused (e.g for suspend)

Change-Id: Iaaf8b7568e06fa50b03348ad3bb61a7da91be127

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-27 15:16:26.000000000', 'message': 'Make Create Cluster dialog take images from IR

Right now when Savanna shows Create Cluster dialog, shows image list taken
directly from glance. That is a wrong behaviour, Savanna should take image
list from Image Registry. That commit fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ie2c804e48cf9d181081c4e7e1861a0ec9cb446f6
'}]
commit_message:
Make Create Cluster dialog take images from IR

Right now when Savanna shows Create Cluster dialog, shows image list taken
directly from glance. That is a wrong behaviour, Savanna should take image
list from Image Registry. That commit fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ie2c804e48cf9d181081c4e7e1861a0ec9cb446f6

commit_message:
Node Group Template copy.

Node Group Templates moved to separate module.
Helpers updated.
Rest client updated to send cinder information.
Copy workflow added.
Cinder volumes support implemented for both create and copy flows.

Change-Id: I0c41a6b19449967d5b9b1499ba76e8a3715231c5

commit_message:
Determine git workdir properly

".git" can also be in a parent directory of the
current workdirectory. Figure out if it exists
at all, and then call git log.

Fixes LP Bug 1194804

Change-Id: Ic209724c64158b0e87b2e12a0fa8220ea2cb5155

[{'created': '2013-06-25 16:52:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add H232 check for octal number literals

Python 3.x deprecated the use of e.g. 0755 for octal
strings. 0o755 seems to be compatible with all Python 2.x
versions as well as Python 3.x, so recommend that
one instead.

Change-Id: I148dad7d4fbe852ea92ec223d44b2a8b6ef20ce1
'}, {'created': '2013-06-26 09:19:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add H232 check for octal number literals

strings. 0o755 seems to be compatible with all Python 2.x
versions as well as Python 3.x, so recommend that
one instead.

Change-Id: I148dad7d4fbe852ea92ec223d44b2a8b6ef20ce1
'}, {'created': '2013-06-26 23:19:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add H232 check for octal number literals

versions as well as Python 3.x, so recommend that
one instead.

Change-Id: I148dad7d4fbe852ea92ec223d44b2a8b6ef20ce1
'}]
commit_message:
Add H232 check for octal number literals

Python 3.x deprecated the use of e.g. 0755 for octal
strings. 0o755 seems to be compatible with all Python 2.x
versions as well as Python 3.x, so recommend that
one instead.

Change-Id: I148dad7d4fbe852ea92ec223d44b2a8b6ef20ce1

[{'created': '2013-06-20 02:42:03.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Make BitTorrent url more flexible

Change xenapi bittorrent plugin to not assume that torrent file
is under CONF.xenapi_torrent_base_url + image_id + ".torrent".

This allows for sources images from arbitrary torrent URLs.

Change-Id: Ica9462a51c6299b5affc861781f3054d18866458
'}, {'created': '2013-06-26 17:18:09.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Make BitTorrent url more flexible

Change xenapi bittorrent plugin to not assume that torrent file
is under CONF.xenapi_torrent_base_url + image_id + ".torrent".

This allows for sources images from arbitrary torrent URLs.

Change-Id: Ica9462a51c6299b5affc861781f3054d18866458
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Make BitTorrent url more flexible

Change xenapi bittorrent plugin to not assume that torrent file
is under CONF.xenapi_torrent_base_url + image_id + ".torrent".

This allows for sources images from arbitrary torrent URLs.

Change-Id: Ica9462a51c6299b5affc861781f3054d18866458

- http://logs.openstack.org/33746/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/14251 : SUCCESS in 10m 22s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-20 03:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-06-20 04:20:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This change worries me in that it can cause silent performance degradation.

If the two files are on the same filesystem, moving the file is cheap: it's just changing some metadata associated with the inode. But if it's on a different filesystem, `shutil.move` falls back to copying all of the data to the other filesystem and then deleting the original file.

The problem is that, for the size of files we're dealing with (multi-gig VHDs), the difference between a 'cheap' and 'expensive' move is huge, both in terms of time and disk I/O.

Hence, the original code requires that the staging-area and SR reside on the same filesystem and enforces it by way of the lower-level `os.rename` call.

Unless there is some reason we've found that a staging area can't reside on the same FS as the SR (I can't think of any at the moment), I'd prefer the short-term headache this causes by failing-fast to the potential for long-term degradation.

Maybe we can do better by way of error-messages for developers/operators? Or, less ideal, maybe we add a flag to enable 'move-with-copy-fallback' mode (yuck!).

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-20 04:26:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

I guess Rick's comment makes sense...  it would be nice if os.rename failed it would raise a useful error saying 'Hey, idiot, you forgot to symlink /images.  Use the same filesytem.'  etc etc."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-20 09:53:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am with Rick on this one. Would be good to get a better error message though."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-06-26 17:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-06-26 17:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

[{'created': '2013-06-20 02:42:01.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Use shutils.move

Use shutils.move instead of os.rename.  This avoids problems with
invalid cross-device links if the src and dest are on different
filesystems.

Change-Id: I22b6a145141431b6d4e4cb0176881f0cf0dd609f
'}, {'created': '2013-06-26 17:18:08.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Improve cross-device linking error message.

Catch invalid-cross device linking exceptions raise from os.rename
and provide a more intelligible error message.

Change-Id: I22b6a145141431b6d4e4cb0176881f0cf0dd609f
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Improve cross-device linking error message.

Catch invalid-cross device linking exceptions raise from os.rename
and provide a more intelligible error message.

Change-Id: I22b6a145141431b6d4e4cb0176881f0cf0dd609f

commit_message:
api : Add ReST actions POST method

Initial support for an actions subpath, which will be the access-point
for non-lifecycle operations on stacks, e.g suspend/resume

This adds support for a  POST method for /actions subpath, so that requests for
specific actions may be made, using a similar interface to that provided by
nova for the admin actions extension.  So a body of {'suspend': None}
will suspend the stack, see http://api.openstack.org/api-ref.html

blueprint: stack-suspend-resume
Change-Id: I180345c818cbfa38ac8c17caba2c0f64adabf6be

Remove duplication between create_task and suspend_task
by refactoring to provide a more general stack_task

commit_message:
Ensure namespace package is installed.

This is a workaround for bug 1194742. There is actually a bug in
upstream d2to1 that has a PR up:

https://github.com/iguananaut/d2to1/pull/32

But until that is released, this should fix the immediate problem.

Change-Id: I136b8493c8d8d48a0116facf5f23c2a1479c070f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

Dan,

one question, shouldn't this go in your bp rpc-object-serialization?

And what project is having problems with serializing IPAddress?"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-26 22:59:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If you like, I can tag it for that blueprint. It's not really related to that effort.

We need this in nova because we're passing new style instances to code that will pass the dict version of the instance over a legacy RPC interface. You can see the full stack of merged and pending nova patches here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/nova+branch:master+topic:bp/unified-object-model,n,z"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-06-27 02:16:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Was just confused since there is no bug report or bp linked from this patch. It's clear now thanks."}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-06-27 08:30:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Please, take a look at inlined comments.

Additionally, I think it'll be better to use try_import instead of adding new dependency."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-06-27 12:56:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Some minor suggestions in comments"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-06-27 13:05:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-27 13:32:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

I don't see why adding a netaddr dependency here is unreasonable. It's already a dependency for at least nova and it's a pretty fundamental thing.

I'll resubmit with the six.text_type() change while I wait for comments."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-06-27 13:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add netaddr.IPAddress support to to_primitive()

This enlightens jsonutils.to_primitive() about how to serialize
netaddr.IPAddress objects. Since these types are serializable
in their native form with just string coercion, just do that here.

Fixes bug 1195097

Change-Id: I358b0731e4d3774e5b36aefb5384fdfb75fd31b6

Devstack is pulling s3_token into the swift pipeline and so depending on
keystone.environment is breaking devstack installs.

Change-Id: Ifd89e542f79a2bee00113e7df676d30da0f05e59

commit_message:
Revert environment module usage in middleware.

Devstack is pulling s3_token into the swift pipeline and so depending on
keystone.environment is breaking devstack installs.

Fixes bug 1193112

Change-Id: Ifd89e542f79a2bee00113e7df676d30da0f05e59

[{'created': '2013-06-19 13:15:10.000000000', 'message': 'raise ServerError when validates

fixed Bug#1191009

If nova returns an error looking up images during stack validation, we
return a StackValidationFailed, but we should probably catch
this and return ServerError instead, since this is really an internal
error not a validation failure.

commit_message:
Raise suitable exception when stack validation fails

fixed Bug#1191009

If nova returns an error looking up images during stack validation, we
return a StackValidationFailed, but we should probably catch
this and return ServerError instead, since this is really an internal
error not a validation failure.

Change-Id: Id509b2fa9f78e197cacfe44bae6c3db37cfd6179

commit_message:
Special case netaddr to json

netaddr.IPAddress doesn't get matched as a class and causes recursion
loops.  Special-case turning it to a string.

Change-Id: I5211746eb2e206b48a7907d3d2223553cd0e70f6
Fixes: bug #1195097

commit_message:
Prevent repeatedly recording of availability zone in _check_availabilty_zone function

The current _check_availabilty_zone function simply adds all availability zone in service['availability_zone'] ,
and it exists a posibility that availability zone maybe recorded repeatedly.

Change-Id: I1eacedcdd7fb1955595de75cbaeccedb57be819a

[{'created': '2013-06-26 15:31:51.000000000', 'message': 'Port flavor_access extension to v3 API Part 1

into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to

commit_message:
Port flavor_access extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I6a2648ac9f59ff122f06a63991b57e595b2c5696

commit_message:
Merge Fixes from oslo-incubator into Quantum's rootwrap

As part of converging Quantum and Oslo's rootwrap, merge
already approved fixes into Quantum:

* Update KillFilter to stop at '\0' for readlink() function.
* Handle relative path arguments in Killfilter

Also, rootwrap filters are updated to use relative paths for
KillFilter where feasible.

Change-Id: I35635d33b50dbec1dae8ec75ef56993fa83dc71d

This is really good. I will improve the backup_volume method once this is commited.'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-06-25 12:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-06-25 18:57:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The code here looks good, but I think using librbd directly to do I/O would be better.

There are several ways to do this:

1) kernel rbd 
This doesn't support format 2 (needed for cloning) until 3.10, and even then it's not gotten a ton of use and testing yet.

2) exporting to a file
This requires a bunch of disk space on the host doing the backup (if a lot of backups are done at once, or a very large volume is backed up, this could be a big problem)

3) librbd python bindings
These are easiest to use within cinder. They don't have asynchronous I/O support, but it's easy enough to convert sync to async if we really need it in cinder.

4) rbd-fuse
Little benefit over librbd, and more complex to manage. It does synchronous I/O and fuse doesn't support direct-io
until recent kernels."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2013-06-25 19:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-06-25 19:54:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Added volume backup and restore to Ceph RBD driver

It is now possible to backup and restore volumes
when using volume.drivers.rbd.RBDDriver

Implements: blueprint cinder-backup-to-ceph

Change-Id: Ic1b8db8f0acd7974423414171b8fb45197d05dc6

commit_message:
Check the instance ID before creating it

At least with libvirt 1.x instance goes into shutdown state
before its ID is changed. This means that there's a race
condition during reboot where nova might try to create an
instance that's already defined. By checking if the ID of
the new and old instance is the same, we avoid that situation
and reiterate on the loop.

The tests for this are added in
I6215f80bd15820dac80151e7063916dbbc21d761

Change-Id: I493b828f0c6848fbadc591be2f47fd1b12fd3a51
Fixes: bug 1181924

[{'created': '2013-06-27 07:57:36.000000000', 'message': 'Drop libvirt qemu configuration

This configuration fix with regards to cgroup ACL should go to the
puppet-nova module instead. With latest OpenStack Network architecture
there are valid setups to use this module dedicated for the network
part without any compute service, like libvirt, runnin on that node.

This got introduced due to this bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-cisco/+bug/1086255

I guess the issue is/was that /dev/net/tun access is missing by default
for some distribution. Which is required if OVS is used and needs to
be configured by libvirt.

But such fix should go to puppet-nova or a libvirt puppet module instead.

Change-Id: I3b4f0ec03e3f2e2041598ee2c6086ef8157518da
'}]
commit_message:
Drop libvirt qemu configuration

This configuration fix with regards to cgroup ACL should go to the
puppet-nova module instead. With latest OpenStack Network architecture
there are valid setups to use this module dedicated for the network
part without any compute service, like libvirt, runnin on that node.

This got introduced due to this bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-cisco/+bug/1086255

I guess the issue is/was that /dev/net/tun access is missing by default
for some distribution. Which is required if OVS is used and needs to
be configured by libvirt.

But such fix should go to puppet-nova or a libvirt puppet module instead.

Change-Id: I3b4f0ec03e3f2e2041598ee2c6086ef8157518da

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-05-20 20:21:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not convinced this is the right approach. I think there is potential for race conditions here that may be unaccounted for. We need to explicitly think about what will happen if the instance if the dhcp request is still in flight or things happen out of order.

Also we have the cleanup periodic task which will return these to the pool later, so do we really need to risk the possibility of introducing race conditions?"}, {'account_id': 3189, 'date': '2013-05-20 21:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Vish. There are at least 2 possible issues I see.

1) You are not guaranteed that the dnsmasq config has been updated when you are trying to free the IP. As a result the IP could still be in the dnsmasq config making a valid IP from dnsmasq's perspective.

2) You are checking to see if the IP is leased against a locally cached copy of the data. Once you have called deallocate_fixed_ip there is a chance that the IP could be freed and re-allocated. You need to re-fetch the status of the IP before trying to free it.

In order to address #1 you should move your code to the deallocate_fixed_ip function. Your call to fixed_ip_disassociate should occur immediately after the _teardown_network_on_host call in the same "if teardown:" block. Since _teardown_network_on_host calls update_dhcp you are assured that the IP is no longer considered valid by dnsmasq.

It address #2 you will need to re-fetch the fixed IP record from the DB and ensure that it is not allocated to another instance. If its still associated with the old instance its safe to free it.'}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-05-22 13:09:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-22 13:20:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-05-28 17:35:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This version seems safer. Unfortunately there is stil potential for out-of-order things to occur. There is a small window between sending the dhcp-release packet and the dnsmasq config being updated.

force-dhcp-release hits before the lease comes in
then the lease hits
then dnsmasq config is updated
then new code releases the ip

While rare, this would leave an unallocated ip in the db that dnsmasq has given a lease for. The only way around this would be to ensure that the config for dnsmasq is updated before sending out the force_dhcp_release packet. Also if force_dhcp_release is false I don't think there is a way to ensure that dnsmasq won't end up with a lease that nova doesn't know about.

All-in-all I'm not sure if this is worth fixing considering the potential for introducing new race conditions."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 3189, 'date': '2013-06-27 06:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I realize this is selfish but I hit this bug this past week and it annoyed me.

I propose we resurrect this and see if we can find another way to fix it.'}, {'account_id': 3189, 'date': '2013-06-27 07:46:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Since I can't re-opened the Abandoned review I've created a new one with updated logic based upon Yufang's last patch.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34688/"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-16 11:51:09.000000000', 'message': "Disassociate failed dhcp fixed ip in deallocate_for_instance() method.

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Ibe88c9bd2e090ba2ff42344564387b7e2b93e649
"}, {'created': '2013-05-16 12:21:27.000000000', 'message': "Disassociate failed dhcp fixed ip in deallocate_for_instance() method.

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate

commit_message:
Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Ibe88c9bd2e090ba2ff42344564387b7e2b93e649

commit_message:
Check definition of package resources

bug 1195162

Tempest is installing some very common packages
which are likely to conflict with other modules.
This patch checks to see if the resources are
already defined, which will prevent compile time
errors relating to duplicate resources.

Change-Id: I9b4eb46ec0b9affb905e19a034a26d16e01119e2

commit_message:
Add update() method to NovaObject for dict compatibility

In order for objects to behave like dicts, they need to
support the update() method. This patch adds that.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Icb3932682285cbf8e7362e5b748e42a754b17fe7

commit_message:
Add obj_to_primitive() to recursively primitiveize objects

Occasionally we need to recursively process a NovaObject into a
representative dict or list. This patch adds a function to do that
recursively, accounting for nested objects and lists of objects.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I6adb84f9e5a0564ec4af14200e26e838b4a5bb6e

commit_message:
Stop creating folders in virt unit tests

Before nova.tests.virt.libvirt tests created 4 empty UUID named folders
in the top level nova directory.  Tests should not leave artifacts like
these around.

Fix bug 1194676

Change-Id: I941b23ecb94db2f4a0cc60eeb06766f960775ba1

subject: Reserve additional space for LVM clone-from-volume snapshots
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1207, 'name': 'Duncan Thomas', 'email': 'duncan.thomas@gmail.com', 'username': 'duncan-thomas'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 5997, 'name': 'Walt', 'display_name': 'Hemna', 'email': 'waboring@hemna.com', 'username': 'walter-boring'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 7593, 'name': 'Haomai Wang', 'email': 'haomaiwang@gmail.com', 'username': 'HaomaiWang'}]

- http://logs.openstack.org/33347/1/check/gate-cinder-pylint/525 : SUCCESS in 3m 29s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/33347/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/24019 : SUCCESS in 49m 34s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33347/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/23725 : SUCCESS in 50m 42s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33347/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/31450 : SUCCESS in 20m 03s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33347/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/10949 : FAILURE in 39m 02s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-06-17 22:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do we not need to worry about someone looking like they have sufficient space on their filesystem but the 5% bump pushes them over the limit?  Just thinking that there should maybe be an info message indicating that the actual size is being bumped so the user would have some bread crumbs to follow to the source of the problem.'}, {'account_id': 7593, 'date': '2013-06-18 04:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think there should exists some promotion on this, it looks strange for end-user if it only satisfy size under (105% * size).'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2013-06-18 05:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This feels a little wrong to be allocating 105% of requested space.   Why does doing a dd wipe on the snapshot fill up the snapshot and cause LVM to fail?'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:04:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Jay:
Really I don't think we do, since this is not for normal user-created snapshots, but snapshots that are only used internally for the clone operation.  If the extra bit of space causes them to exceed capacity, they likely were close enough that things like this would fail anyway -- we don't expose information about this space usage to the user through quotas, volume info, etc.

@Haomai:
This isn't exposed to the user directly.

@hemna:
Basically, it turns out that LVM snapshots are a little weird.  If you create a snapshot of a 1G volume which is 1G -- you can't actually write 1G of data to it since there is a small percentage of space consumed by the metadata used to track the snapshot data, and this lives inside the space allocated for the snap LV itself.


I am looking at other options here too, but they are all relatively hacky.  (Write less data, allow failure due to snap being full, etc.)"}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-06-18 22:29:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Going to try something different first."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-06-18 22:57:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

FWIW, I'm not horribly against this change by any means.  The alternate approaches Eric has mentioned and is working now also sound pretty good and perhaps less confusing to the end-user."}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2013-06-19 10:29:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> there is a small percentage of space consumed by the metadata used to track the snapshot data, and this lives inside the space allocated for the snap LV itself.

Can this metadata space be quantified?'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-06-19 12:52:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@eric harney: 'Write less data' doesn't really cut it... this is not just a zeroing issue, but a customer visible one too - if the customer does create volume from snap then tries to write the whole volume, they get I/O errors before the driver is full..."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-06-19 15:54:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Duncan: True, but here I was really only going after the clone problem specifically.  I think it's worth fixing that if possible since it's a predictable failure, rather than trying to fix all of LVM-based snapshots."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-27 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-27 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-17 21:17:47.000000000', 'message': 'Reserve additional space for LVM clone-from-volume snapshots

For snapshots created when cloning an LVM volume to a new volume,
reserve an additional 5% of space.

By default we do a wipe using dd from /dev/zero on this snapshot
before removing it as part of the clone process.  If LVM is not
configured to autoextend snapshots, this can fill up the LVM snap
and cause the clone process to fail.  This ensures the snapshot
has enough capacity to complete the process.

Fixes bug: 1191812

Change-Id: If0f01faeaea0133b89982e72b75b8c9b37d34960
'}]
commit_message:
Reserve additional space for LVM clone-from-volume snapshots

For snapshots created when cloning an LVM volume to a new volume,
reserve an additional 5% of space.

By default we do a wipe using dd from /dev/zero on this snapshot
before removing it as part of the clone process.  If LVM is not
configured to autoextend snapshots, this can fill up the LVM snap
and cause the clone process to fail.  This ensures the snapshot
has enough capacity to complete the process.

Fixes bug: 1191812

Change-Id: If0f01faeaea0133b89982e72b75b8c9b37d34960

messages:
[{'account_id': 7736, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:16:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

As requested I'm breaking my original change request up into multiple requests. I'm submitting this first request as a work in progress because I'd like a little feedback as to whether there is any chance that this change could be accepted before I spend a bunch of time testing, writing unit tests, jumping through Jenkins hoops, etc. only to find out later that the whole idea is not right. If the idea is right, but requires some tweaking then I'm more than happy to continue investing time into getting this to a non-work-in-progress state."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 00:00:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/33734/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/2847 : FAILURE in 35s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33734/1/check/gate-swift-docs/2677/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 05s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33734/1/check/gate-swift-python26/2925 : FAILURE in 3m 00s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33734/1/check/gate-swift-python27/2923 : FAILURE in 1m 37s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33734/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/24804 : SUCCESS in 43m 38s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33734/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/32300 : SUCCESS in 18m 55s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33734/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/24510 : SUCCESS in 50m 10s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33734/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11596 : FAILURE in 16m 18s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-20 00:30:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm really not a fan of this approach. I don't want to maintain an inheritance-based API, as they make code much harder to change. I especially don't want to maintain an inheritance-based API for clients that live outside the Swift source tree.

However, I looked at the document you referenced earlier (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1crYUlbb7UhwI3CRJSb9yeF1Xy_R1nYv-maS9bW2D-cU for those playing along at home). I think you can get (most of) what you want with Swift today plus just a little other stuff.

To avoid simultaneous writes, you'll want to stick each cluster in the ring only once. Stand up an HAProxy (or other load balancer) instance per-cluster, and add it to the ring *but* set its replication IP and port to go to one of the backend servers directly. That way you don't have two devices in the ring that are really the same; each ring-device is a separate set of files. The node with the replication IP will take some extra load, though, so maybe don't put it in HAProxy?

If you don't want 3 replicas of your data because Isolon clusters have super-secret durability sauce, just set your replica count to 1.

As for the busted rsync stuff... bug the vendor? Based on your email address, I suspect you work for the vendor, so go fix your rsync. ;)"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-27 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-27 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

in order to allow custom iteration of nodes to be implemented
in subclasses and updated the proxy-server, updaters,
replicators, and container synchronizer to use them.
This change was done because of issues that I came
upon when trying to get Swift to work with the Isilon OneFS
operating system as a storage node. By moving the functionality
from where it was to these new classes it allows me to
implement support for Isilon by subclassing. More details on the
issues associated with running Swift on Isilon refer to:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1crYUlbb7UhwI3CRJSb9yeF1Xy_R1nYv-maS9bW2D-cU/edit?usp=sharing

commit_message:
Created Customizable Node Iterator

I added the NodeIterator and NodeIteratorFactory classes
in order to allow custom iteration of nodes to be implemented
in subclasses and updated the proxy-server, updaters,
replicators, and container synchronizer to use them.
This change was done because of issues that I came
upon when trying to get Swift to work with the Isilon OneFS
operating system as a storage node. By moving the functionality
from where it was to these new classes it allows me to
implement support for Isilon by subclassing. More details on the
issues associated with running Swift on Isilon refer to:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1crYUlbb7UhwI3CRJSb9yeF1Xy_R1nYv-maS9bW2D-cU/edit?usp=sharing

Change-Id: Ie990f43a6a68ac4b95e8097c3ff35d6442b5bacb

This is clearly not an improvement IMO. "Multiline docstring should start with a summary" is a fine goal to have, but putting a blank line in the middle of the first sentence of every docstring does not in any way make the world a better place.

Additionally, many docstrings that are effectively single lines have been turned into 3 lines of the form:

   """Trivial docstring.

   """

instead of:

   """Trivial docstring."""

Finally, I am opposed to putting the first line of the docstring directly after the opening quotes (instead of on the following line), because it makes it harder to visually match the opening and closing quotes. PEP257 makes clear that the two forms are equivalent and automated tools will see the same thing after stripping indentation.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-06-12 10:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I can change trivial docstrings to:
"""Trivial docstring."""
also I don't think there needs to be a new line between the "headline" and the rest, I can kill those.

Your last point should not be relavant, we (each openstack project) are not in the business of inventing styles, exactly for this reason - people disagree. So some openstack people have come up with a hacking rule (and cared enough to do so). Lets just get it done and stop discussing it. The point is consistency and and automated way of enforcing it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-12 10:54:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-06-07 19:18:28.000000000', 'message': 'Change to policy checking

This is a change to the rule based access control policy checking.
This change makes empty rules fail by default.  This is more
secure since it forces the need to specify desired behavior
instead of defaulting to a command being open to anyone.  This
also is intended to support another proposed change in the rbac
improvement blueprint where hardcoded admin context checking will
be removed from nova.  Removing the hardcoded admin context checks
opens up the possibility that an empty rule could allow access to
an api where it was previous blocked for only admin access.  This
change will prevent that possibility.

Change-Id: I031348a6c398cc51c92caf28493c961f48426bb1
Implements: blueprint rbac-improvement
'}]
commit_message:
Change to policy checking

This is a change to the rule based access control policy checking.
This change makes empty rules fail by default.  This is more
secure since it forces the need to specify desired behavior
instead of defaulting to a command being open to anyone.  This
also is intended to support another proposed change in the rbac
improvement blueprint where hardcoded admin context checking will
be removed from nova.  Removing the hardcoded admin context checks
opens up the possibility that an empty rule could allow access to
an api where it was previous blocked for only admin access.  This
change will prevent that possibility.

Change-Id: I031348a6c398cc51c92caf28493c961f48426bb1
Implements: blueprint rbac-improvement

commit_message:
Reduce MTU for 1454 for GRE tunnels

As pointed out in
https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg24208.html
GRE tunnels add a header of 44 bytes. When a 
full package with 1500 bytes is sent through
a GRE tunnel, the last 44 bytes will be missing
from the package. This fix changes the MTU to
1454 to avoid that.

Change-Id: Ia02a5ff05e2e30c9f544ee9bb069af3730b5ab99

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-06-18 17:00:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I can't see why you can't do these tests in initialize_connection, rather than adding a new driver method that is always call immediately before initialize_connection?"}, {'account_id': 7808, 'date': '2013-06-19 07:37:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

That's what the first and second patch sets were about but, because base iscsi's class initialize_connection is overridden by almost all the iscsi subclasses, this meant either to copy the same validation code into every iscsi driver or, to change the driver's API to accommodate the validation in the base class.

The proposed solution means no changes in any of the subclasses or the driver's API by just moving the validation into a new method and calling it before initialize_connection from the manager."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-06-25 05:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Raise an error if iSCSI is not supported

Since the compute nodes may not have iSCSI support, volume drivers
requiring it will raise an error if the connector's initiator attribute
is not set when initializing the connection.

bug #1007084

Related to: I5da472e5013fdc0c733ecb12b919c1068873bdc6

Change-Id: I95d859c11cf81bf57cecf7af8b224cdbb71592d5

netaddr.IPAddress doesn't get matched as a class and causes recursion
loops.  Special-case turning it to a string.

Fixes: bug #1195097
"}]
commit_message:
Special case netaddr to json

netaddr.IPAddress doesn't get matched as a class and causes recursion
loops.  Special-case turning it to a string.

Change-Id: I9c52ca4adc74cbc490c25f06ad68ded89b428051
Fixes: bug #1195097

commit_message:
Add dependency between RouterGateway and RouterInterface

When a template has a RouterGateway and a RouterInterface with the
same router_id, there is an implicit dependency on delete where
the gateway must be deleted before the interface.

This is implemented by overiding add_dependencies in RouterGateway
and looking in the stack for RouterInterface resource to depend on.

Fixed bug: #1182266

Change-Id: I90ebe987c1d6e81f8936ceb81b81376c7e0d497a

commit_message:
Using pipe to handle tgz sources

For tgz(or tar.bz2) sources, use pipe like `wget -O -
http://www.example.com/a.tar.gz | tar -xvf -` to save disk space
usage.

Change-Id: I59663aed098e8c96d8a41b2d84200f2a1e43a927
Fixes: bug #1192135

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-06-21 17:10:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If you can't use a provider template to stand in for a resource that there is no plugin for, then your cloud provider and not you controls what you can do. Returning this control to the user is one of the main points of provider templates. It's unfortunate that this allows you to accidentally override the wrong type, and maybe we need some syntax in the environment to say "yes I really mean to define a new one", but IMO this is an essential feature.

-1 because error checking here is non-existent; if the whole point of this is to prevent the user making typos in resource types, they at least deserve a better error message than "NoneType object has no attribute 'properties_schema'".

Also, as Randall points out, we now have an attributes schema as well.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-06-21 17:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Actually, scratch that on the error-checking - get_class does actually raise the correct exception.

Leaving -1 because of lack of attributes schema.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-06-24 01:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-24 02:00:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Update kombu library version requirement

Openstack requirements mandate kombu>2.4.7, we seem to be the only
project pinning the version.
 - See: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/

Change-Id: I8758cda0d5561cc2971ac8723f6e899bdd9189ee

[{'created': '2013-06-27 01:22:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fixup https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33308.

The local_ip value of 127.0.0.1 breaks clusters. Using 0.0.0.0 will
have the right value when the heat-localip element is used.

Change-Id: Id0da5d46c60e808944a40bcaf05f1072be55eed7
'}]
commit_message:
Fixup https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33308.

The local_ip value of 127.0.0.1 breaks clusters. Using 0.0.0.0 will
have the right value when the heat-localip element is used.

Change-Id: Id0da5d46c60e808944a40bcaf05f1072be55eed7

I think there should be at least a skeleton of unit tests for this?"}, {'account_id': 6997, 'date': '2013-03-13 03:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Duncan,

The method added needs interactions with sheepdog command line which requires installing sheepdog on testing machines. If we fake all the interactions with sheepdog in the test, there is nothing left to test. So we may leave the test later until we find a good way to install sheepdog on the testing machines. 

Regards,
Wenhao'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-03-13 04:18:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Wenhao, this is how all unit tests with the different drivers in cinder work. We're not looking for integration tests. We look forward to seeing the unit tests, thanks."}, {'account_id': 6997, 'date': '2013-03-13 04:34:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mike,

Yeah, I know. But the tests will be only including stub mox, something like:
self.stubs.Set(..., ...)

There is no logic here to test. I don't even know what to assert in the test. Do we want a test that only including faked stubs? I don't see the value here.

Regards,
Wenho"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

commit_message:
List groups by domain in keystoneclient.

Currently keystone support filtering of
groups by domain. This fix is to add
support in keystone-client for filtering
groups by domain.

Fixes Bug #1180581

Change-Id: I3906e2474d968426d06d498928ce2c7094c6fbe9

commit_message:
Don't run store tests without a store!

Store tests reuse a base test case which defines relevant test
functions. However, the base test case should never run independently,
only in a subclass, because it has no store to test.

Somehow, this issue only occurs if you run tox -- --tests
glance/tests/functional/store

Change-Id: I5d8d26ba68d034fb8e94e5408a757d9869825285

Error was:

  NvpInvalidClusterConfiguration: Invalid cluster values: ['default_tz_uuid', 'nvp_controllers']

Problem was how we were registering deprecated NVP config options ...

I changed the config file:

  -[CLUSTER:fake]
  +[cluster:fake]

which mean we were doing:

  CONF.register_opts(..., 'cluster:fake')

which means this wouldn't work anymore:

        for arg in cfg.CONF:
            ...
            if arg.startswith("CLUSTER:"):

so, I've fixed the code to always register the group with the 'CLUSTER:' prefix'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-26 22:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

The group name - i.e. conf.database vs conf.DATABASE - is governed by what you pass as the group name to register_opt(). It doesn't matter whether uppercase or lowercase is used in the config file.

I made I9357397f39d8f7d0d4f445b78aae5665c7ece3d4 a separate change to try and make this as clear as possible."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-26 22:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

In the configuration files we have changed to lowercase but not in the code - for example - https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/db/api.py#L80
Maybe the DB is not a good example as we plan to make this use OSLO.
Did I miss something?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-26 22:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Allow use of lowercase section names in conf files

Fixes bug #1189889

oslo.config-1.2.0 normalizes section names in config files to lowercase.
This means that simply by upgrading to oslo.config-1.2.0, users will now
be able to do e.g.

  [default_servicetype]
  description = ...
  service_definition = ...

Change the default config files to make it clear we recommend the use of
lowercase section names.

Note, the use of an alpha tarball of oslo.config requires pbr>=0.5.15
but we already require >=0.5.16.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia47fb3d168da71d3221b25979f8c9257d70dd64d

commit_message:
Accept is_public=None when listing all flavors

nova-client uses a None (with capital N) when listing all the flavors.
Right now this is interpreted as a wrong query by n-api preventing us
from listing the private flavors using the nova-client.

Fixes bug #1190239

Change-Id: I2a9b1c24cd744c8819c1d41e0ad103d05398401c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-25 08:51:39.000000000', 'message': 'TempAuth: check user_group before acl referer

There're two kinds of checking in tempauth.authorize()

1. check .r, .rlistings ...
2. check accout:user ...

With an acl like ".r:*, account:user", point 1 failed and point 2
passed. That is bug # 1082973. In Keystone, point 2 will be check first
so this kind of acl will be passed, but in tempauth it failed. My
patch is to check point 2 first in tempauth to fix this bug.

Change-Id: Ib60e59b7c80331a699cb5c3496f948cf32135d0b
'}, {'created': '2013-06-25 17:32:23.000000000', 'message': "TempAuth: don't return 401/403 if .r without .rlistings

When checking referer (.r, .rlistings), tempauth return 401/403 if '.r'
exists without '.rlistings' or obj. Actually it should skip this kind of
authorizing and check the following authorizing.

Change-Id: Ib60e59b7c80331a699cb5c3496f948cf32135d0b
"}, {'created': '2013-06-26 15:35:21.000000000', 'message': "TempAuth: don't return 401/403 if .r without .rlistings

When checking referer (.r, .rlistings), tempauth return 401/403 if '.r'
exists without '.rlistings' or obj. Actually it should skip this kind of
authorizing and check the following authorizing.

And remove some unnecessary lines

Change-Id: Ib60e59b7c80331a699cb5c3496f948cf32135d0b
"}]
commit_message:
TempAuth: don't return 401/403 if .r without .rlistings

When checking referer (.r, .rlistings), tempauth return 401/403 if '.r'
exists without '.rlistings' or obj. Actually it should skip this kind of
authorizing and check the following authorizing.

And remove some unnecessary lines

Change-Id: Ib60e59b7c80331a699cb5c3496f948cf32135d0b

commit_message:
Adds support for the Indigo Virtual Switch (IVS)

Implements: blueprint ivs-vif-driver

Adds line to rootwrap config to allow call to ivs-ctl to control the Indigo switch.
Adds a new 'ivs' VIF type in network/model.py.
Adds support to the LibvirtGenericVIFDriver class for the IVS switch.
Adds functions to linux_net.py to create and delete IVS vif ports.
Adds unit tests to test the new IVS methods.

Change-Id: I65436b82f65374103644af8aba9dba14ba73f94c

commit_message:
Fix the cache interface to use time= by default.

Historically the swift cache conection used the argument timeout= for
the cache timeout, but this has been unified with the official python
memcache client with time= since grizzly, we still need to handle folsom
for a while until this could get removed.

Fixes bug 1193032

Change-Id: Ia9d544a0277beb197ed9824d7c1266d12968393d

commit_message:
Fix cache-url to use single '=' in test expression

When downloading the base image for the first time, the response
test expression fails with '[: 200: unexpected operator'.  This is
caused by using '==' in the test expression, which is not supported
in sh scripts.

Fixes bug 1195030

Change-Id: I66260814cb591371dc5c10f8436f90c2f18d78cf

commit_message:
Port quota classes extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I328b32aee29021bae42cba5d97e0735e7b691ac9

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-30 23:16:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Consider a 32-character hex string S_0 such that:

md5hexdigest(S_0) = S_1
md5hexdigest(S_1) = S_2
...
md5hexdigest(S_n) = S_0

That's an MD5 cycle. If one of those exists, it can be used to send the slo downloader into an infinite loop by careful manifest construction.

Not sure if it's something to worry about, as AFAICT nobody's found one yet, but I wanted to bring it up so people are aware of it.

This could be mitigated by not allowing infinite slo recursion; maybe keep it to 4 levels (that's 10^12 segments of 5 GiB each, or a maximum effective object size of 5 zettabytes).

(Are your CPUs underutilized? Burn clock cycles with this MD5 cycle finder: https://gist.github.com/smerritt/5681998)"}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-05-31 02:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-14 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Anyway, I just changed the comment "is and nested slo" to "is a nested slo" and the exception-handling comment to:

    # Normally, exceptions before any data has been yielded will
    # cause Eventlet to send a 5xx response. In this particular
    # case of SloSegmentError we don't want that and we'd rather
    # just send the normal 2xx response and then hang up early
    # since 5xx codes are often used to judge Service Level
    # Agreements and this SloSegmentError indicates the user has
    # created an invalid condition.

Things left for David:

* Why don't deletes work something like bulk deletes where a couple failures don't abort the whole thing?

* Could we just drop the cascade delete feature and then not worry about the above?'}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-06-17 22:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-29 21:57:04.000000000', 'message': "Allow SLOs to be made up of other SLOs

We've gone back and forth about this. In the initial commit, it couldn't
possibly work because you wouldn't be able to get the Etags to match. Then it
was expressly disallowed with a custom error message, and now its allowed. The
reason we're allowing it is that 1,000 segments isn't enough for some use cases
and we decided its better than just upping the number of allowed segments. The
code to make it work isn't all that complicated and it allows for virtually
unlimited SLO object size. Think I'll leave the python-swift client support for
nested SLOs to somebody else though :).

Change-Id: Id16187481b37e716d2bd09bdbab8cc87537e3ddd

commit_message:
Allow SLOs to be made up of other SLOs

We've gone back and forth about this. In the initial commit, it couldn't
possibly work because you wouldn't be able to get the Etags to match. Then it
was expressly disallowed with a custom error message, and now its allowed. The
reason we're allowing it is that 1,000 segments isn't enough for some use cases
and we decided its better than just upping the number of allowed segments. The
code to make it work isn't all that complicated and it allows for virtually
unlimited SLO object size. There is also a new configurable limit on the
maximum connection time for both SLOs and DLOs defaulting to 1 day. This will
hopefully alleviate worries about infinite requests. Think I'll leave the
python-swift client support for nested SLOs to somebody else though :).

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id16187481b37e716d2bd09bdbab8cc87537e3ddd

commit_message:
Cells: Pass object for start/stop

The compute_api start/stop methods expect an Instance object, but cells
is still passing the dict or sqlalchemy form.

Fixes bug 1191040

Change-Id: I21e0f0b5d7e3160e23c7a84f59ae3899538c7327

commit_message:
Ignore import lines with noqa

flake8 says that lines with '# noqa' should be ignored, but the
import rules checker isn't ignoring those lines.

This change makes it so that import lines with # noqa are ignored.

Change-Id: Icb2c3eaf0cec87e18bc3c6dcf28f8e2642ec23a2
Fixes: bug 1186188
(cherry picked from commit d728031755269d352ea43c1ea4fb59fd0eceebd5)

commit_message:
Retry quota_reserve on DBDeadlock

quota_reserve() can raise DBDeadlock... so this adds the decorator that
retries the transaction.

Fixes bug 1193199

Change-Id: Id632360372b21f3e75a2af50153eb18cc2025390

commit_message:
Include HACKING.rst in MANIFEST.in

Without this, I'm seeing:

  Running setup.py egg_info for package from file:///.../hacking-0.5.5.6.ga6bef44.zip
    error in setup command: Error parsing ../setup.cfg: IOError: 2

This is a "file not found" when it tries to open HACKING.rst.

Not sure whether something changed recently to cause this to start
happening.

Change-Id: I499332181c83a7bb127261efd6354ae4d92f5709
(cherry picked from commit 7c4421e470f53bea90a08ea5cb4273b6b43806a5)

commit_message:
Threading utils implemented

* context.spawn spawns green thread w/ cloned ctx
* context.sleep sleeps using eventlet.sleep
* all eventlet usages has been replaced w/ new util

Implements blueprint thread-utils

Change-Id: I1062ca4ac8e3cc3b1d045cd6a4be89837c41afbc

commit_message:
Cells: Add support for global cinder

Implements cinder support for compute cells when cinder is a global
installation.  Adds syncing of the block device mapping table between
child cells and API cells.

Implements blueprint cells-cinder-support

Change-Id: Ife5be9922db0742c8ee4f970517396be86597cce

commit_message:
Make fake_network tolerant of objects

This makes fake_network not break if passed an instance object or
list of instance objects.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Ic484e850966d514c758baedb46571b5296e89580

subject: Prepare fake instance stubs for objects

commit_message:
Prepare fake instance stubs for objects

This fixes a couple of calling convention tolerances on fake
instance_get methods, as well as makes stub_instance() return
a more accurate instance dict.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I9772be52c3f8bbd8cab0ec2dd93821f3e4287b6a

commit_message:
Port flavors core API to v3 tree

Port flavors core API (which does *not* include all extensions, like flavor
create) to the V3 API, adapting the way it's loaded to fit with the new
extension framework and, of course, its tests.

This also change the flavors requests and responses links on unit tests since
project_id  is no longer present on v3 url

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-core-as-extensions

Change-Id: Ide2eb22a89be3bd9adcf5e09cbef23e824a83fc1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-04 11:39:17.000000000', 'message': 'Change resource links when url has no project id

This patch allow response body to be look like the request url. So if a
project_id is passed the resource links on the response will also have a
project_id, and in the case of api-v3 where project_id are no longer present in
the url the response will not have it either.

Complements bp v3-api-remove-project-id.

Also fix two minor issues on the unit tests, which were breaking with this
change:
 - When doing ServersViewBuilderTest there was no api version specified.
 - ServersControllerTest was duplicating api version on the application url.

Change-Id: I872332ef56b4b6e99fedb43833ad45e8e654f44f

commit_message:
Change resource links when url has no project id

This patch allow response body to be look like the request url. So if a
project_id is passed the resource links on the response will also have a
project_id, and in the case of api-v3 where project_id are no longer present in
the url the response will not have it either.

Complements bp v3-api-remove-project-id.

Also fix two minor issues on the unit tests, which were breaking with this
change:
 - When doing ServersViewBuilderTest there was no api version specified.
 - ServersControllerTest was duplicating api version on the application url.

Change-Id: I872332ef56b4b6e99fedb43833ad45e8e654f44f

commit_message:
Fixes my.cnf not reverting with a resize revert.

Added GA method to fix db configurations without a restart.
Revert resize now uses this method.

Fixes Bug #1187028

Change-Id: I2045d11c5a99ef26c1de297562a0a6239ca04789

[{'created': '2013-06-20 04:56:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add scenario test of instance snapshot and boot

This test is for snapshotting an instance and booting with it.
 * boot a instance and create a timestamp file in it
 * snapshot a instance
 * boot a second instance with the snapshot
 * check the timestamp file in the second instance

Implements: blueprint add-instance-snapshot-scenario-tests
Change-Id: Ia20eaaae08af50d716c435e10e02d19d70d3adb5

commit_message:
Add scenario test of instance snapshot and boot

This test is for snapshotting an instance and booting with it.
The following is the scenario outline:
 * boot a instance and create a timestamp file in it
 * snapshot the instance
 * boot a second instance with the snapshot
 * check the existence of the timestamp file in the second instance

Implements: blueprint add-instance-snapshot-scenario-tests
Change-Id: Ia20eaaae08af50d716c435e10e02d19d70d3adb5

commit_message:
Require greenlet 0.3.2 (or later)

Version 0.3.2 resolves a bug that allowed generic "except
Exception:" clauses to catch GreenletExit exceptions.

bug 1097203

Change-Id: Ifc5a40dd1da8d115ccbe7fa4a948d12ff1c89099

'}, {'created': '2013-06-26 01:12:30.000000000', 'message': 'Prep work before adding each db recipe

Brought in openstack-common as a dep.  Updated the tests to
better match what the recipes are doing (added tests where
missing).  Updated attributes to match the format of our other
cookbooks.  This is mostly some cleanups, to prepare for features.
Since this cookbook is not in use, made a larger commit than
would have if adding functionality to a released cookbook.  Also,
upgraded to new Berkshelf which handles locking to cookbooks properly.

Change-Id: I8e4123d30012a9890ce3029184e1396d2083a6f1
'}]
commit_message:
Prep work before adding each db recipe

Brought in openstack-common as a dep.  Updated the tests to
better match what the recipes are doing (added tests where
missing).  Updated attributes to match the format of our other
cookbooks.  This is mostly some cleanups, to prepare for features.
Since this cookbook is not in use, made a larger commit than
would have if adding functionality to a released cookbook.  Also,
upgraded to new Berkshelf which handles locking to cookbooks properly.

Change-Id: I8e4123d30012a9890ce3029184e1396d2083a6f1

commit_message:
Pass before and after snippets to template diff

The before template should be passed explicitly, rather than relying on
some state stored in the object.

Change-Id: I5b0af8da2e1df3f6ad3291554cbbc243b51e3fe5

(3 inline comments)

Looks like a good start, thanks!  Some comments re the regex stuff which I'm not sure about, and a couple of other minor things."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:44:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

-1 for trying to sneak in a change to openstack/common ;)

The basic class/getitem/translate stuff looks fine to me. Can I suggest that the resolve_* functions be submitted as separate patches? It seems like those require a deeper discussion and perhaps some examples."}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2013-06-19 20:53:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@zaneb: Regarding the change to jsonutils: the reason I made this was that when something like 2013-05-23 is not quoted in the yaml, it is read in as date and not datetime. I did not know this code came from Oslo, so just went ahead.

Workaround would be to just it in the yaml, but that's more fragile from a user perspective. Or inject some pre-processing when reading the yaml (have to look at a stacktrace again to see if we have a chance).

Clean solution IMO would be if I propose this change to Oslo.

What is your recommendation?"}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2013-06-19 20:57:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@zaneb again: Forgot to comment on your second point. So regarding the samples, aren't the ones in the hot/hello_world.yaml posted to heat-templates enough?

I can still create this as a separate patch, but then we would be able to only process something very CFNish, whereas my idea was to always have code that can parse a HOT template posted in parallel."}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2013-06-19 21:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-06-20 08:26:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Re samples, yes that's fine. I missed the comment with that link, sorry.

Re multiple patches, I agree on the goal, but I don't necessarily think we need to get there in one patch. Erring on the side of more patches is usually better (there are some helpful guidelines are on the OpenStack wiki: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Structural_split_of_changes).

Re Oslo change, yes, I think you should submit the change to oslo-incubator."}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2013-06-21 13:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-21 13:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Changes for HOT hello world template processing

This patch contains the base enabling code required for processing a most
simple HOT template ("hot hello world"), so that the template can be
parsed and a stack with a single instance can be deployed.

Contributes to blueprint hot-hello-world

Change-Id: I4f0a04a06fab2f5472cb4481dcdf10d5239d5def

[{'created': '2013-06-20 19:57:31.000000000', 'message': "Make info_cache not break network_info

The info_cache['network_info'] data can be None, so don't string-
convert it to 'None'. Also, JSONify network_info instead of just
stringifying it. This is used in some places where _from_db_object()
is called with a real object for network_info, which we don't want
to just stringify.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

commit_message:
Make info_cache handle when network_info is None

The info_cache['network_info'] data can be None, so don't string-
convert it to 'None'.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I7a18f9189ab31beca0f8df764531387b4dd41b50

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 18:26:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix and Use rabbitmq-server element in boot-stack

Rabbit MQ is a separate service and has configuration logic, so the
entangled configuration within boot-stack was inappropriate.

* Remove rabitmq-server restart in boot-stack firstboot.
* Move custom upstart script from boot-stack into rabbitmq-server
  element.
* Make rabbitmq-server orc properly handle empty heat_users.json file.

Fix bug 1166838

Change-Id: I8985d8020f94c257d426065cf914213b35ec959f

  element
* Make rabbitmq-server orc properly handle empty heat_users.json file

Fix bug 1166838

Change-Id: I8985d8020f94c257d426065cf914213b35ec959f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix and Use rabbitmq-server element in boot-stack

Rabbit MQ is a separate service and has configuration logic, so the
entangled configuration within boot-stack was inappropriate.

* Remove rabitmq-server restart in boot-stack firstboot.
* Move custom upstart script from boot-stack into rabbitmq-server
  element.
* Make rabbitmq-server orc properly handle empty heat_users.json file.

Fix bug 1166838

Change-Id: I8985d8020f94c257d426065cf914213b35ec959f

commit_message:
Fix instance object's use of a db query method parameter

The limit and marker arguments are kwargs, which need to be
correct to pass some mock tests in the unit tests for api.

Related to unified-object-model

Change-Id: I16b45ff73a6d79313fdd4a1124309f558497ab72

commit_message:
Make NovaObject support the 'in' operator

This is needed for dict emulation.

Related to unified-object-model

Change-Id: I6e024dc284a353181d3ffc84329f234e16b79118

commit_message:
Add Instance.fault

This makes Instance load fault as an optional attribute, if
requested. I didn't implement save for this, as I'm not sure
we will (want to) support setting instance faults via that
interface.

Related to unified-object-model
Fixes bug 1192004

Change-Id: I581e1f49c4c593ece97cf32dc7cea3f7a7cbd953

subject: Add basic InstanceFault model

commit_message:
Content-length missing in put_object

Radosgw returns a "411 Length Required" in case the content-length is not
specified. The parameter content_type is not set which leads to the problem
that content_length cannot be determined. Since the content length is already
computed in backup/services/swift it shouldn't be a problem to set this
parameter.

Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/services/swift.py

Change-Id: I4c56823d70fcd1a801a75bfd14f474a2780dc1ac

commit_message:
Deliver HOT hello world template

This patch delivers a most simple HOT template with only a single instance,
no software, and just a few basic parameters and output.
The template can be processed with the code delivered in this patch

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33258/

applied to the heat repository.

Contributes to blueprint hot-hello-world

Change-Id: Ib87a88aa4a71f1c1f147084273610b95bda704c1

commit_message:
Change ring partition size for SAIO

Making this smaller (10 instead of 18) can make some of the tests run
faster and makes rebuilding of the rings faster.

Change-Id: Ibe46011d8e6a6482d39b3a20ac9c091d9fbc6ef7

'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2013-06-19 02:24:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

hi Chris, From my experience I think the 'floatingips' keyerror maybe caused by bellow reasons:
1) floating ip quota is exhausted, but the allocate_floating_ip method of $nova/nova/network/quantumv2/api.py doesn't handle this exception.
2) multi greenthreads (like backgroud network allocating greeenthread here, like some periodic task in the $nova/nova/compute/manager.py) have the chance to visit the same share socket ($nova/nova/network/quantumv2/__init__.py cached admin client)"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-19 03:54:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The thing is... for libvirt, there really is no background network allocation.  Which is why I don't think it's this patch.  The call to _legacy_nw_info() in _spawn() will cause a call to network_info.legacy() to be called...(because libvirt's legacy_nw_info() returns True).  This will cause a greenthread.wait() before calling driver.spawn().  So this patch does not really change the behavior for libvirt... other than maybe add a few milliseconds of delay to the network allocation (before the greenthread is switched to).  But there's almost *no code* between the start of the greenthread... and the greenthread.wait().

The real problem of sharing the socket is because of a different bug (commit dd9c27f9992) which has been reverted.  That could be triggered with or without my patch... which is why it was reverted.

Anyway, I'm still fairly confident the bug is somewhere else.."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-19 03:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 04:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Only reason I mention it is because the log statement 2013-06-17 15:32:13.837 22755 DEBUG quantumclient.v2_0.client [-] Error message: Second simultaneous read on fileno 25 detected. Unless you really know what you're doing, make sure that only one greenthread can read any particular socket. Consider using a pools.Pool. If you do know what you're doing and want to disable this error, call eventlet.debug.hub_multiple_reader_prevention(False) _handle_fault_response /opt/stack/new/python-quantumclient/quantumclient/v2_0/client.py:899 before the exception"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-19 06:05:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That problem should have been from the patch that was reverted earlier today.  The cached admin client one.   If that's still happening after reverting that patch, there's something else caching a quantumclient instance, then."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-19 06:08:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

To clarify further:  With or without this patch, 2 network queries can occur in 2 greenthreads at the same time.  One such example is the periodic task that gets nwinfo for instances for healing... it can run at the same time as a new build.  My patch doesn't change that.  But yes, that'd be very bad.  You can't re-use quantum client connections without using a context manager or having some sort of tracking... That was the problem with the patch that was reverted earlier today."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-19 06:09:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Revert "Allocate networks in the background"

This reverts commit 3a89638691b1e9eb167886793c7819be4fd8dc4f.

We're seeing a lot of jenkins failures and this patch is a potential
cause.  I'm proposing a revert so we can see if it helps, and merge it
if it seems to be the fix.

Change-Id: Ib66c7cc02c7c1ac012ce3afaf413f8b6961bb785

commit_message:
LDAP list group users not fail if user entry deleted

Using the LDAP identity backend,
if a group member entry doesn't exist in the LDAP server anymore
and the group's members are listed using GET /v3/groups/{groupId}/users,
Keystone returns 404 Not Found.

The server should return all the group members that do exist
and ignore the missing members.

Fixes bug 1174585

Change-Id: I97b53e3d5a5810aa0818b785e23a1948499b29e8

commit_message:
Set cli.cli_dir option for tempest config

Use NOVA_BIN_DIR as value for cli_dir to make it portable.
Default value of '/usr/local/bin' does not work on Fedora.

Change-Id: Ia5232056642aae2cf5e322cf30f0cac21d3c7d0b

[{'created': '2013-06-21 15:30:04.000000000', 'message': "Refactor db.security_group_get() instance join behavior

Currently, security_group['instances'] is always joined when we
do a db.security_group_get(). This patch adds the growingly-
conventional columns_to_join argument to the call, allowing
us to selectively choose when we want to make this expensive
join operation.

Related to unified-object-model

Change-Id: I1945365c8cf03c027fd143f677cbd6d63a7f8122
"}, {'created': '2013-06-22 21:24:23.000000000', 'message': "Refactor db.security_group_get() instance join behavior

Currently, security_group['instances'] is always joined when we
do a db.security_group_get(). This patch adds the growingly-
conventional columns_to_join argument to the call, allowing
us to selectively choose when we want to make this expensive
join operation.

Related to unified-object-model

Change-Id: I1945365c8cf03c027fd143f677cbd6d63a7f8122

commit_message:
Refactor db.security_group_get() instance join behavior

Currently, security_group['instances'] is always joined when we
do a db.security_group_get(). This patch adds the growingly-
conventional columns_to_join argument to the call, allowing
us to selectively choose when we want to make this expensive
join operation.

Related to unified-object-model

Change-Id: I1945365c8cf03c027fd143f677cbd6d63a7f8122

commit_message:
Use python-fixtures for image resource tracking in glance tests.

This patch switches the resource tracking of the glance api tests to
use fixtures. Instead of keeping a list of created images and then looping
over it at class teardown this patch switches to making a fixture for
each image.

Partially implements: blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: Ib54835d2c2de16d30e72feffad366b0c6ace00c3

commit_message:
Remove explicit distribute depend.

Causes issues with the recent re-merge with setuptools. Advice from
upstream is to stop doing explicit depends.

Change-Id: If1a97a574dbc0370a0a2de5d99a92610b048907d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-24 15:42:50.000000000', 'message': 'Document the OVS restart for the Ryu agent

When installing Quantum Ryu agent, the OVS service might not be properly
started due to a missing kernel module (compiled using DKMS). Make sure
that the OVS service is (re)started before restarting the Ryu agent
(completes commit 9489e66).

Change-Id: I659415bb7514cf5ac3619141e715351692c80854
'}]
commit_message:
Document the OVS restart for the Ryu agent

When installing Quantum Ryu agent, the OVS service might not be properly
started due to a missing kernel module (compiled using DKMS). Make sure
that the OVS service is (re)started before restarting the Ryu agent
(completes commit 9489e66).

Change-Id: I659415bb7514cf5ac3619141e715351692c80854

commit_message:
No need for --token and --endpoint options

Use the same format for all `keystone endpoint-create` examples.

Change-Id: I9332b0d527cc4d0307894d0970a27028658cec48
Fixes: bug #1194511

module.
