* 404 is now returned instead of 500 in all API calls;
* utils/api has been updated to avoid implicit magic.

Partailly implements blueprint savanna-rest-api-1-0-validation

Change-Id: Id1e64b03920c59bc96da6c8f709bd1beccb59d76
"}, {'created': '2013-06-26 10:11:27.000000000', 'message': "The 'check_exists' applied to all API calls

* 404 is now returned instead of 500 in all API calls;
* direct calls to nova client moved from api/v10 to service/api
* utils/api has been updated to avoid implicit magic.

Partailly implements blueprint savanna-rest-api-1-0-validation

Change-Id: Id1e64b03920c59bc96da6c8f709bd1beccb59d76
"}]
commit_message:
The 'check_exists' applied to all API calls

* 404 is now returned instead of 500 in all API calls;
* direct calls to nova client moved from api/v10 to service/api
* utils/api has been updated to avoid implicit magic.

Partailly implements blueprint savanna-rest-api-1-0-validation

Change-Id: Id1e64b03920c59bc96da6c8f709bd1beccb59d76

commit_message:
Remove references to tty-linux

The Cirros qcow2 image has been used to create a glance image, reflect
this change in the `nova image-list` output.

Change-Id: I1f7e7b84f3cfbcc2c4b404ce2ae14c66a169ed59

[{'created': '2013-06-25 16:59:55.000000000', 'message': "Skip fixed_ip_details test with Quantum

Currently Quantum doesn't support all the features provided
by nova-network. Thus some tests related to features not
available in Quantum API must be skipped.

Fix Bug #1194569

Change-Id: If9b88c5b5883059d10116c72eeae17c22f6083cc
"}]
commit_message:
Skip fixed_ip_details test with Quantum

Currently Quantum doesn't support all the features provided
by nova-network. Thus some tests related to features not
available in Quantum API must be skipped.

Fix Bug #1194569

Change-Id: If9b88c5b5883059d10116c72eeae17c22f6083cc

bug #1194468

[{'created': '2013-06-24 21:23:53.000000000', 'message': 'Use os.path.join to form the cli command

The cli_dir path without a trailing "/" was generating a malformed
command.

Change-Id: I4d367d4b6cde492ceb224c4b644d4853181a62ce
'}, {'created': '2013-06-24 22:53:33.000000000', 'message': 'Use os.path.join to form the cli command

 * If cli_dir path has no trailing "/" the generated command would no
 longer be malformed

 * Fix tempest.conf.sample: CLI group should not be capitalized

Change-Id: I4d367d4b6cde492ceb224c4b644d4853181a62ce
'}, {'created': '2013-06-25 14:27:59.000000000', 'message': 'Use os.path.join to form the cli command

 * If cli_dir path has no trailing "/" the generated command would no
 longer be malformed

 * Fix tempest.conf.sample: CLI group should not be capitalized

Change-Id: I4d367d4b6cde492ceb224c4b644d4853181a62ce
'}]
commit_message:
Use os.path.join to form the cli command

 * If cli_dir path has no trailing "/" the generated command would no
 longer be malformed

 * Fix tempest.conf.sample: CLI group should not be capitalized

Change-Id: I4d367d4b6cde492ceb224c4b644d4853181a62ce

commit_message:
Skip list_vifs test with Quantum

Currently Quantum doesn't support all the features provided
by nova-network. Thus some tests related to features not
available in Quantum API must be skipped.

Fix Bug #1183436

Change-Id: I02ece3c49c9852197c7fb22c5025920baf60d98d

commit_message:
Import sql_connection option before using it.

This change fixes issues that would arise when testing certain files on
their own. Normal test runs were not affected due to serendipity in the
implied import order.

Change-Id: I9a85bf0112a9796482624e860efc2ec620aaf0f2

'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-06-16 05:08:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

The -1 is mostly for the extraneous print left in (inline comment added). A very minor issue.

This patch does everything is claims on the label, but I'm not sure I agree with the solution. (To be clear, I can see the problem.)

I'm concerned that returning the account info headers for an account that has been deleted but not reaped is leaking information that shouldn't be leaked.

One alternate solution similar to the proposed patch would be to add a different, more generic header (eg X-Account-Locked: true) to indicate that it cannot be recreated.

Another idea may be to change the response on the account PUT to return a different status code or add a header to indicate that account creation (for this account) is prohibited.

I like the second idea (fix the account PUT) better, but I think both of the above may be better than what is proposed in this patch."}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-17 21:25:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (2 inline comments)

Done changing to return a specified header. 

I used X-Account-Status which than have a value of 'Locked' if the account was deleted and not yet reaped.

The Status header can be used for more function in the future (e.g. to support an undelete period)."}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-17 21:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-17 22:36:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

(3 inline comments)

See my inline comments.  I'm also a little leery of introducing the concept of an "Account Status".  If we do this, do we need to return a header on all other requests indicating that it is on an "OK" status?

I also wonder if there is a better term to use than "locked?"  Why not "deleted?"  Locked usually implies something else.

I'm open to changing my mind though if you can expand on your reasoning a bit.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-21 20:07:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (3 inline comments)

commit_message:
Deleted account respond as non existing accounts

Currently clients can not distinguish between non existing accounts
(which can be created) and accounts marked for deletion, which has
not yet been reaped and therefore cannot be re-created until reaped.

Following this patch, if an account is marked as deleted but hasn't
been reaped and is still on disk, responses will include a status
header:
    'X-Account-Status' = 'Deleted'

Fixes:Bug #1188609
Change-Id: Ibd39965ae3f5d45fd78f130e0e31f5a0141a8633

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 13:04:24.000000000', 'message': "Re-use cache_url() in fedora element.

The fedora element downloads images too, so we should re-use the caching
code from the ubuntu element.

There doesn't seem to be other examples of code shared between root.d
scripts. In the fedora and dpkg elements we copy install-packages into
the chroot, but that model doesn't apply when we're running scripts
outside of the chroot. Seems sane to just run it directly from the bin/
dir in the temporary hooks directory.

Change-Id: Iaa6aca660042fea323cab4271633a4bdbbc271b8
"}, {'created': '2013-06-26 13:04:24.000000000', 'message': "Re-use cache_url() in fedora element

The fedora element downloads images too, so we should re-use the caching
code from the ubuntu element.

There doesn't seem to be other examples of code shared between root.d

the chroot, but that model doesn't apply when we're running scripts
outside of the chroot. Seems sane to just run it directly from the bin/

Change-Id: Iaa6aca660042fea323cab4271633a4bdbbc271b8

commit_message:
Re-use cache_url() in fedora element.

The fedora element downloads images too, so we should re-use the caching
code from the ubuntu element.

There doesn't seem to be other examples of code shared between root.d
scripts. In the fedora and dpkg elements we copy install-packages into
the chroot, but that model doesn't apply when we're running scripts
outside of the chroot. Seems sane to just run it directly from the bin/
dir in the temporary hooks directory.

Change-Id: Iaa6aca660042fea323cab4271633a4bdbbc271b8

[{'created': '2013-06-17 13:43:35.000000000', 'message': 'Do not reraise exceptions

Replace "raise e" with "raise"

Change-Id: I047e355607318bf9fa6208c2b174b7cc394297f0
Fixes: bug #1191730
'}, {'created': '2013-06-24 11:33:01.000000000', 'message': 'Do not raise NEW exceptions

Raising NEW exception is bad practice, because we lose TraceBack.
So all places like:

except SomeException as e:
    raise e

should be replaced by

except SomeException:
    raise

If we are doing some other actions before reraising we should
store information about exception then do all actions and then
reraise it. This is caused by eventlet bug. It lost information
about exception if it switch threads.

fixes bug 1191730

Change-Id: I047e355607318bf9fa6208c2b174b7cc394297f0
'}]
commit_message:
Do not raise NEW exceptions

Raising NEW exception is bad practice, because we lose TraceBack.
So all places like:

except SomeException as e:
    raise e

should be replaced by

except SomeException:
    raise

If we are doing some other actions before reraising we should
store information about exception then do all actions and then
reraise it. This is caused by eventlet bug. It lost information
about exception if it switch threads.

fixes bug 1191730

Change-Id: I047e355607318bf9fa6208c2b174b7cc394297f0

cloud it's on was installed using MySQL, then MySQL will be instaled.

Change-Id: I9ad5fd3268fd35e20ec87a800123e522e34844c4

commit_message:
Remove dependency on MySQL-python.

Tempest does not depend on MySQL, it depends on sqlalchemy. If the
cloud it's on was installed using MySQL, then MySQL will be instaled.
If it was installed using PostGres, then postgres will be instaled.
This dependency is misleading.

Change-Id: I9ad5fd3268fd35e20ec87a800123e522e34844c4

commit_message:
engine : stack_resource change state_description to status_reason

The internal API changed this name recently, but this got missed
due to lack of test coverage for this exception.  Turns out adding
that test coverage is really hard due to all the coroutine magic,
so we'll have to fix that at some later time.

Change-Id: I98a0c5bb8f3f001a7d215bcdf64cad841e42ef85

commit_message:
Avoid jsonschema 1.4.0 - Release was pulled.

JSONSchema 1.4.0 appears to have been an accidental release of 2.0
code under the 1.4.0 version. It's been pulled from PyPi, but still
exists on the OpenStack mirror.

Discussion with the infra folks suggests updating the requirements
file rather than removing the release from the mirror is the best
solution.

Change-Id: I7619cc41c7924f2f02c8cf8d17034e58ac3b116c

commit_message:
Add network_utils.urlsplit

This unfortunately needed if we want to parse URL with params and
unknown schemes.

Change-Id: Ia7d8212370201254e537e6f1dd9b15d669a3252f

commit_message:
Don't reconnect to exclusive fanout consumers.

See bug #1180166, basically we shouldn't be trying to reconnect to
exclusive queues.

Fixes: bug #1180166
Change-Id: I71ac5a150ea8c4d97a34404cb821ce8e8dfa152d

I thought of a problem with my last patch set.  If a second exception occurs within a 60 seconds period and it is a different exception, it won't be logged.  Plus, I decided it would be nice to log how many exception of the same type occurred during the maximum of 60 seconds of non-logging.  That is the reason you see the more complicated version of forever_retry_uncaught_exceptions().  I do like the the goal of recovering within a reasonable amount of time yet not flooding the logger with exceptions, so have stuck with the approach of loosely only logging the same exception once a minute.

And now that the forever_retry_uncaught_exceptions() is more complicated, I will write some unit test cases for it.  That is why I -1'ed my own code review.  Please comment if you do not like this approach and save me the time of writing the unit test cases if you will just reject the approach anyway."}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-11 22:34:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Maybe you could clarify what you suggest."}, {'account_id': 7963, 'date': '2013-06-24 21:21:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Is it possible to make the '1' in sleep(1) and the 3 failure retries configurable?"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-06-24 23:01:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

Generally seems good to me.  Just some test comments.

I don't think it's worth making the time configurable, personally."}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-25 03:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

Quing He, regarding your comments, the idea behind a 1 second sleep is to prevent retries from eating up a lot of resources such as CPU and at the same time allow for a fairly quick recovery. If 1 second ends up not working we can always make it a parameter later. As for the 3 retries, that is an arbitrary test choice. It could have been 100. The decorator retries forever.'}, {'account_id': 7963, 'date': '2013-06-25 03:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

in that case, is it possible to have sub second -- micro or nano second-- sleep?'}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-25 04:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-25 04:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Works for me

Have we done root cause analysis as to what kind of 'unexpected' exceptions they are? If they are fatal, we just get out without retry, if it is benign, then we can go back to top level thread event loop without this inner loop. This can not be non-blocking socket busy (EAGAIN), can it?"}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-06-25 16:51:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

By definition, unexpected exceptions are unexpected, so there is nothing yet to do root cause analysis on.  We could argue as to what the appropriate action to take is, but that has already been discussed on the mailing list started by this thread: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-June/010040.html
Please comment on that thread since you don't agree with the consensus that was reached."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-06-25 19:57:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-08 05:08:44.000000000', 'message': 'Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust

There are unprotected holes in the thread kicked off by RPC
consume_in_thread such that an exception will kill the thread.
This exists for both the service (TopicConsumer) and the new
reply proxy (DirectConsumer) consumers.  This patch plugs
those holes as close to the base of the consumer thread as
possible by catching all non-caught exceptions and retrying
with sleeps between retries and some pacing of the log
output to prevent log flooding.

Change-Id: I0d6ec8a5e3a310314da201656ee862bb40b41616

'}, {'created': '2013-06-25 21:49:56.000000000', 'message': 'Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust

bug 1189711 Should RPC consume_in_thread() be more fault tolerant?

There are unprotected holes in the thread kicked off by RPC
consume_in_thread such that an exception will kill the thread.
This exists for both the service (TopicConsumer) and the new
reply proxy (DirectConsumer) consumers. This patch plugs
those holes as close to the base of the consumer thread as
possible by catching all non-caught exceptions and retrying
with sleeps between retries and some pacing of the log
output to prevent log flooding.

Change-Id: I0d6ec8a5e3a310314da201656ee862bb40b41616
'}]
commit_message:
Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust

bug 1189711 Should RPC consume_in_thread() be more fault tolerant?

There are unprotected holes in the thread kicked off by RPC
consume_in_thread such that an exception will kill the thread.
This exists for both the service (TopicConsumer) and the new
reply proxy (DirectConsumer) consumers. This patch plugs
those holes as close to the base of the consumer thread as
possible by catching all non-caught exceptions and retrying
with sleeps between retries and some pacing of the log
output to prevent log flooding.

Change-Id: I0d6ec8a5e3a310314da201656ee862bb40b41616

commit_message:
Session is not used for flow communications.

Plugin and hadoop_version parameters are passed through request parameters.
Helper method moved to util module.

Change-Id: Ie584bfb3823c8cbb6f00c53bd2253f4eb2103f31

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add oslo-config-1.2.0a2 and pbr>=0.5.16 to requirements."

This partially reverts commit:
   43b7f22b30244114f809e4c3b44dc337cade95f1.

The oslo.config change in that patch seems to break running unit
tests with tox. This reverts just that part of the change.

Change-Id: I977700d73342e81ee962019b76238d2cb2b1fff4

commit_message:
z/VM driver - Implement xCAT connection and get_host_stats

xCAT connection:
Provide zvm.utils.XCATUrl to generate xCAT uri. Implement
XCATConnection to send xCAT request via httpsconnection and do
some basic error check for the response data.

get_host_stats:
Get host information via xCAT host inventory function, and resolve
the infomation to OpenStack format.

Part 2 of blueprint zvm-plugin

Change-Id: I065072a003af91acbb0446a65375dccf9ffe96ea

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-14 14:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Instead of building our own versions of the messaging drivers, I would prefer extending the Oslo API to support a flag for "ack only on success" or something similar. I wonder if it would be better to not ack the message on failure, which wouldn't require a flag. Do you know why we're doing that in Oslo now?

We're working on a new messaging library API right now, so this is a good time to take cases like this into account.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-06-14 15:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@doug, agreed, this should go in oslo. I have a blueprint for this and have been keeping markmc up to date on this progress (as a spec). As the rpc rework takes more shape we can work with them to get this functionality in there.

And, there's more to it than just the ack(), there's also the mangling that goes on to work around the "rpc" stuff like method and parameters. Not used with notifications.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-14 15:51:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The join_consumer_pool() method doesn't make any assumptions about message format, so we're using that for subscribing to notifications now. We should be able to add a boolean to that method to change the ack() behavior, but I haven't studied how many other classes will have to change to get the value to the place where it would actually be used.

https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/collector/service.py#L149
https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py#L756

If we make those changes, I wonder if we could also just have the existing collector process store the values before doing the meter conversions with its pipeline."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-06-14 17:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Re-evaluating the world.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-17 21:42:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, please don't add another place we need to add qpid and zmq drivers

We absolutely should be able to support this oslo.messaging - see https://github.com/markmc/oslo.messaging"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-06-18 03:33:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

As I mentioned, it was only here until the rpc refactoring was settled out. 

So, should I add the ack() changes to oslo.messaging or to oslo.incubator? (this is the issue I was hoping to avoid :)'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-18 05:07:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

There's no kombu driver for oslo.messaging yet, so you could help make that happen ...

... or we can just add it to openstack.common.rpc"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-06-18 11:49:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

k, I'll add to oslo.rpc first (so the other devs behind me aren't held up) and try to add it to messaging afterwards. btw> looks like a nice refactoring."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-26 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-26 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Create a Collector which can store raw Events.

This introduces a new service called ceilometer-collector-event
which will grab notifications and store them in the Event and
Trait tables. The only driver currently implemented is for
AMQP via Kombu and librabbitmq.

This is different than the existing notification collector in that
it will only ack() the message when the event is successfully
persisted and it doesn't need to work around the oslo.rpc "method"/
"parameters" structure. It reads the notifications as they were sent.

More will need to be done to this to extract all the popular
traits from the events.

Change-Id: I9723134d6647ce2f7a90e2bc8633c6951bc9d8cf

(11 inline comments)

This is an intensely frustrating patch to review ... there's far more changes here than necessary and these changes need careful review.

I suggest you start again - do the minimal required to pass recv=False to those two recv() calls, then add another to refactor out ZmqMsg with *zero* behavioural changes, then other patches to make changes like the additional message validation in ZmqProxy and changes to debug logging

If you're not familiar with 'git rebase -i', that's the tool you need for managing a patch series like this

Please, please, please - make life easier on reviewers"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-06-18 16:06:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (6 inline comments)

Mark, I understand your concerns. I also know how to rebase code and deal with large patchsets. There are patches queued against this, I'm just not pushing them yet.

If I split this, it will be the ZmqMsg change first, then the logging, and finally zero-copy. The zero-copy change depends on debug_log, so this needs to follow the logging changes, or they need to come together. This is why ZmqProxy no longer does any logging, as it had to be removed in absence of a debug_log() method."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-06-18 16:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
ZmqMsg class: Zero-copy and safe_log improvements

Introduces a ZmqMsg class to simplify decoding
zeromq-wire messages and our driver-specific envelope.

This also allows us to use zero-copy messaging throughout
the driver and introduces a "debug_log" method that
wraps rpc_common._safe_log.

ZmqProxy which previously added zero-copy support, but
in the process had to remove debug logging, now
has had debug logging restored.

Fixes bug 1171556

Change-Id: I929d365b53cc94e34aaf03b0b60dfe4ff2a4a881

commit_message:
Map internal S3 image state to EC2 API values

Fixes the EC2 API so it maps internal S3 image state values to
ones defined by the EC2 API rather than returning the internally
used values.

Fixes bug #1074904

Change-Id: Iabbda0e5fcbe4d572c76367c6f98d4bece050e73
(cherry picked from commit a977294b86287ebefba6eecb48d70166b1daf0f2)

commit_message:
The stop lpar method is not properly timing out

The self.run_vios_command(cmd) will not return immediately such that
the polling code in a certain timeout doesn't work as designed.
Let the self.run_vios_command(cmd) run by another thread by facilitating
the greengthread module in python.

Change-Id: I42a7004629d44d664c98b38e364ae52cd9fca864
Fixes: bug 1182002

subject: Workaround for Debian/Ubuntu precompression
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-13 19:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/32945/1/check/gate-puppet-horizon-puppet-unit-2.7/36 : SUCCESS in 51s
- http://logs.openstack.org/32945/1/check/gate-puppet-horizon-puppet-unit-3.0/36 : SUCCESS in 31s
- http://logs.openstack.org/32945/1/check/gate-puppet-horizon-puppet-unit-3.1/36 : SUCCESS in 35s
'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-13 19:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

you really need to submit some tests with this.'}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-06-13 19:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-06-13 19:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Aren't Debian/Ubuntu already shipping compressed CSS and JS?

Why does Puppet have to "fix" it?'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-13 19:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-06-13 20:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have reports from users who are hitting debs where it's not

This ensured that their debs works with the default Stackforge settings (COMPRESS_OFFLINE = True) whether or not their packages have that issue

We can probably drop and take a strict "get fixed packages" if these sorts of precautionary fixes aren't mergeable in Stackforge'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-06-13 20:29:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Which debs? (dist, dist. version, OpenStack version)

From my recent experience, running python manage.py compress on Ubuntu will break your Horizon installation.

First, the path to lessc is incorrect. It is using '/usr/share/bin/less/lessc' but the script is located at '/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/bin/less/lessc'.

Second, if you manage to fix the path, it will update the wrong manifest.json. It will update '/usr/share/static/dashboard/manifest.json' while the correct file is '/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/static/dashboard/manifest.json'.

This will result in the wrong compressed CSS file being loaded by the interface. (no CSS will be loaded)"}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-14 22:13:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was curious about the status of this patch?

Can we confirm if this is an issue with the upstream packages or not?

I'm a little hesitant of fixing this in the cisco specific packages b/c it means that the issue has not generally been solved, and it also puts Cisco in a position of having customized packages which seem like they will be more of a headache to manage in the future."}, {'account_id': 7888, 'date': '2013-06-17 20:19:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Package where compressed True is not working:
http://packages.debian.org/source/sid/horizon

I would prefer to make compression an optional parameter.'}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-06-17 21:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Defaulting COMPRESS_OFFLINE to False is how Cisco dealt with the problem prior to moving to Stackforge. We were initially looking to avoid that on this patch just in the interest of trying to align with the existing defaults in Stackforge. I can certainly update this to go that direction instead if it would be more generally useful: drop the compression done in puppetry, parameterize COMPRESS_OFFLINE, default it to False on debian osfamily and to True on redhat osfamily'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-06-19 01:32:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I installed Horizon without Puppet and it's working fine. I copied local_settings.py from Puppet and it broke. I'm comparing both files and the version generated by Puppet seems outdated. We should update it."}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-06-19 02:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I had the problem with Ubuntu 12.04 and Cloud Archive (Grizzly). However I found out the source of my problem. An "from settings import *" in my local_settings.py was messing up some paths.

Which distributions are you having this problem with? My concern stays the same: we shouldn't patch in Puppet what should be fixed upstream. (package)'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-13 19:29:05.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for Debian/Ubuntu precompression

Precompress / compile JS and CSS. Otherwise users must change
local_settings.py COMPRESS_OFFLINE to False

Change-Id: Id82b2ffc34c5643d2ae7a457cf35b2026acf53cb
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for Debian/Ubuntu precompression

Precompress / compile JS and CSS. Otherwise users must change
local_settings.py COMPRESS_OFFLINE to False

Change-Id: Id82b2ffc34c5643d2ae7a457cf35b2026acf53cb

commit_message:
update fault['message'] to have more info

In many cases a fault's message will be set to the name
of the exception which caused the fault. This is not ideal
because it often hides the reason for the error from the user.
This information is available in the details section of the fault,
but that is not intended to be exposed to users.

This change sets the fault's message to the string representation
of the exception, which will include the message explaining why
the exception happened. If, for some reason, that message is empty
then the new code will still fall back to the exception class name
as before.

Fixes bug 1180618

Change-Id: I7ee6facbc309cf4113467f5b31443fd90a75d99c

commit_message:
Add Midonet Plugin support

Midonet has a plugin in Quantum, and this is a first patch to support it from
Puppet Quantum Module.

Change-Id: Id81e5fd8be23b03153525a1de75a249921369d46

Reserver a H23x range for Python 3.x compat checks

Rename the just recently merged H203 check to
H231 (adjust entry point name accordingly).

Change-Id: I6648f2cb522d06634af7f73dd468437fe2a2599a

commit_message:
Store created nova client in OpenStackClients.

All created clients are stored in the instance of OpenStackClients
which is associated with a stack - this prevents clients from
being repeatedly created throughout the request.

Commit f3fc5c5 introduced a regression which stopped storing the
nova client. This change addresses that regression.

Change-Id: I60088b60f623aac11e473d185f2924d4f4bd1cfe

commit_message:
Allow a resource delete to be re-attempted.

If a resource is in a DELETE IN_PROGRESS state, and the resource
is deleted again, another attempt will be made to delete the resource.

Fixes bug: #1193975

Change-Id: I615612b4e5f21f2a2cb168f47c33a8f9db7e9e81

http://logs.openstack.org/33333/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/23717 : SUCCESS in 50m 47s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/10944 : FAILURE in 34m 34s (non-voting) '}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2013-06-18 08:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments) Lgtm, but I have some question in code.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-18 13:15:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I'm not sure I understand the use case here. Data will be placed locally for speed and then synced later across a slow link to where it should be? I guess this is okay for a very bursty traffic cluster that doesn't need to read its own writes? Any sustained traffic and you end up with too much locally than you can sync remotely? But if you write locally and then try to read that data wouldn't it try the remote nodes, or do you have to changed your read affinity as well -- and doesn't that change the characteristics once the data is in place remotely? Anyway, I'm confused I guess. This change, and maybe the other affinity changes, really seem like they need some docs to explain why and how you would use them, pros and cons, etc."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-18 15:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress Working up some docs'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-18 23:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments) '}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-18 23:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:55:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: This seems okay to me. Things sure are getting complicated; though I guess it's a bit inevitable as we try to support all sorts of odd setups. iter chains of chains with filters throughout. * DocImpact needed In my opinion, tests need just a little bit of work: * affinity_locality_predicate isn't tested for garbage-in. * Need some specific direct iter_nodes tests for the new functionality of the node_iter kwarg and that its old use remains the same. Tested indirectly already of course. * Same with iter_nodes_local_first as far as some specific direct tests."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me Build succeeded. - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/3/check/gate-swift-pep8/2815 : SUCCESS in 41s - http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33333/3/check/gate-swift-docs/2645/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 02s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/3/check/gate-swift-python26/2893 : SUCCESS in 2m 23s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/3/check/gate-swift-python27/2891 : SUCCESS in 1m 06s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/24437 : SUCCESS in 39m 01s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/31901 : SUCCESS in 16m 46s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/24143 : SUCCESS in 39m 40s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11298 : FAILURE in 33m 46s (non-voting) '}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-06-19 02:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve I agree with gholt, things are getting complicated. Not sure what to do about it, though. This work seems reasonable, none the less.'}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2013-06-19 09:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment) '}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment) '}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-19 18:39:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: The main changes here are (a) more unit tests, and (b) not paying any attention at all to write_affinity_node_count if write_affinity is unset. There was a case where, if you had write_affinity='' and write_affinity_node_depth=$BIGNUM, then you'd end up walking the entire handoff chain only to put it back together in the same order. Now we don't do that (see early bailout in ObjectController.iter_nodes_local_first). I don't know if it counts as a bug, since it didn't change the return value of any function, but it did chew CPU and memory for no good reason. (You can call it a bug if you want as long as you also call it fixed.)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 19:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me Build succeeded. - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/4/check/gate-swift-pep8/2840 : SUCCESS in 57s - http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33333/4/check/gate-swift-docs/2670/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 17s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/4/check/gate-swift-python26/2918 : SUCCESS in 2m 50s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/4/check/gate-swift-python27/2916 : SUCCESS in 1m 33s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/24717 : SUCCESS in 40m 32s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/32207 : SUCCESS in 19m 19s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/24423 : SUCCESS in 41m 44s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/4/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11528 : FAILURE in 39m 20s (non-voting) '}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2013-06-20 08:40:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment) '}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2013-06-20 08:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve '}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-20 13:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer) I'll +2 because I think this seems the way to go for this kind of behavior. However, I'm not really the "target market" for this, so it'd be good to get a +2 from someone that is.'}, {'account_id': 7935, 'date': '2013-06-21 14:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Tests were executed on multi node with 9 devices divided to 3 region. All swift services were running. If we enable proxy write and read affinity in proxy-server.conf, swift requests "swift delete --all" send a notification "Object not found", some files stay in the storage and this files with conatiners are shown in swift list. Proxy affinity in proxy-server.conf depends on the region and for the 3 nodes from first region is set like: write_affinity = r1 read_affinity = r1 = 300'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-21 23:55:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I think the 404s on delete are to be expected. With write affinity turned on to 1 region out of 3, only 1/3 primary nodes will get the object. Therefore, when the proxy hits the backends, it'll get back one 204 (the primary node with the object) and two 404s (the primary nodes without), and then that turns into a 404 response to the client. If you wait to perform the deletion until after replication has moved things to their proper homes, it should work."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-06-24 03:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer) (2 inline comments) A couple of minor questions inline. Any changes could be done in a follow-up patch later, I think. More significant question: object PUTs have an affinity, but they still do the container update over the WAN. Is this intended? It will slow down throughput and cause async pendings to pile up in the local region. An alternative would be for the object server to be given a "don't write this container server, but store it as an async pending" header by the proxy (since the proxy knows the affinity). With larger objects, the WAN container update isn't as significant as with small updates. Still, it's something to consider. I'd like to have justification for the container updates and make sure it isn't an oversight. This is lgtm, but I won't approve (ie merge) until I have the above question answered.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-24 05:08:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments) Yes, I deliberately omitted doing anything with the container updates. My main focus here is on throughput for large objects, not so much on latency. I figure that for a 100MB PUT request, the extra few hundred milliseconds to have the container update go across the WAN is pretty negligible. If I'm wrong, that's fine, but I'd rather not have to add complexity to that code path unless it's warranted."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-24 05:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-24 05:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch set 5 is just to fix a small redundant call to Ring.get_part_nodes that John Dickinson noticed. The only diff is in proxy/controllers/base.py.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-06-24 05:32:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer) '}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-24 05:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me Build succeeded. - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/5/check/gate-swift-pep8/2890 : SUCCESS in 44s - http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33333/5/check/gate-swift-docs/2720/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 05s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/5/check/gate-swift-python26/2968 : SUCCESS in 2m 34s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/5/check/gate-swift-python27/2966 : SUCCESS in 1m 32s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/25693 : SUCCESS in 39m 39s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/33275 : SUCCESS in 15m 49s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/25399 : SUCCESS in 39m 58s - http://logs.openstack.org/33333/5/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/12358 : FAILURE in 21m 24s (non-voting) '}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-24 13:01:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer) Not merging yet just to give folks one last bit of time to review this and leave comments. If it's unchanged when I do my review run tomorrow, I'll start the merge."}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2013-06-25 09:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments) Some unused imports in test.'}, {'account_id': 7935, 'date': '2013-06-25 12:23:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Scenario was executed on multi node environment: * Stop all swift services, reset swift and start all services (script nodes.sh execute swift ?ommands on all nodes): ./nodes.sh swift-init all stop && ./nodes.sh reset && ./nodes.sh swift-init all start * Upload of the file raise 404 error: root@swift-r1-01:~# swift -A http://10.10.12.6:8080/auth/v1.0 -U test:tester -K testing upload cont1 pdelete.scenario Error trying to create container 'cont1': 404 Not Found:

Not Found

The resource could not be found. * Create a container raise 404 error: root@swift-r1-01:~# swift -A http://10.10.12.6:8080/auth/v1.0 -U test:tester -K testing post cont6 Container PUT failed: http://10.10.12.6:8080/v1/AUTH_test/cont6 404 Not Found [first 60 chars of response]

Not Found

The resource could not be found. * Creating container and uploading files become available only after swift list is requested: root@swift-r1-01:~# swift -A http://10.10.11.6:8080/auth/v1.0 -U test:tester -K testing list root@swift-r1-01:~# swift -A http://10.10.12.6:8080/auth/v1.0 -U test:tester -K testing post cont6 root@swift-r1-01:~# swift -A http://10.10.11.6:8080/auth/v1.0 -U test:tester -K testing list cont6 * /var/log/syslog: Jun 24 05:41:05 swift-r1-01 object-server 10.10.11.1 - - [24/Jun/2013:12:41:05 +0000] "HEAD /sdb1/790/AUTH_test/cont1/pdelete.scenario" 200 282 "HEAD http://10.10.12.6:8080/v1/AUTH_test/cont1/pdele te.scenario" "txcaed3360e9ad49cbab413-0051c83e61" "proxy-server 14744" 0.0005 Jun 24 05:41:05 swift-r1-01 object-server 10.10.11.1 - - [24/Jun/2013:12:41:05 +0000] "PUT /sdb1/790/AUTH_test/cont1/pdelete.scenario" 201 - "PUT http://10.10.12.6:8080/v1/AUTH_test/cont1/pdelete.s cenario" "tx269711b297f44bfda6cb2-0051c83e61" "proxy-server 14744" 0.3546'}, {'account_id': 7935, 'date': '2013-06-25 12:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Benchmarking tests using ssbench show, that the amount of fulfilled requests is decreased also when proxy affinity is disable. More info: * https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tYqkEcUToyWMsWlg5CRZ92d-JBlb-Zj1Aw2jhdvZodw/edit?usp=sharing'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Not sure I follow the previous message right, but the results posted seem to show that when we *enable* proxy affinity throughput drops, but it is restored when we *disable* proxy affinity. Am I reading this wrong?'}, {'account_id': 7935, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Yes, you read it wrong: on default configuration (with disable proxy affinity) throughput is less then throughput on one of the previous master commit with default configuration.'}, {'account_id': 7848, 'date': '2013-06-25 18:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve Did a simple 4 node, 2 region each with 2 zone test. High latency link between the regions. I can confirm that with write affinity enabled for region 1 and with the # of replicas set to < the number of disks in the region, all writes stayed within the region and there was a significant increase in write throughput as a result of using the feature.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-06-25 19:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: So perhaps I can compare the numbers a little bit differently then to confirm. All the numbers with an asterisk next to them are the best number compared across the five environments for a given run ID. This following comparison assumes all numbers are the average latency for first byte of a response. Summary: Creates: Change set I09a0bd00 clear winner (enabled) Updates: Change set I09a0bd00 clear winner (enabled) Deletes: Change set I09a0bd00 clear winner (disabled, but no numbers for enabled) Reads: Mixed, only I09a0bd00 (enabled) wins for run 3, for runs 1 & 2 the original master code is best Creates: Disabled Enabled Disabled Enabled ID_run dec517e3 2bdfaff8 2bdfaff8 I09a0bd00 I09a0bd00 1 20.1 7.3 4.8 7.2 4.2* 2 22.2 6.8 - 7.9 3.9* 3 22.8 7.2 - 7.5 4.5* Updates: Disabled Enabled Disabled Enabled ID_run dec517e3 2bdfaff8 2bdfaff8 I09a0bd00 I09a0bd00 1 25.0 5.9 4.1 7.7 3.9* 2 23.9 5.2 - 8.2 3.8* 3 27.7 8.6 - 9.3 3.8* Deletes: Disabled Enabled Disabled Enabled ID_run dec517e3 2bdfaff8 2bdfaff8 I09a0bd00 I09a0bd00 1 25.0 11.2 - 4.6* - 2 23.9 11.8 - 5.1* - 3 27.7 11.3 - 4.5* - Reads: Disabled Enabled Disabled Enabled ID_run dec517e3 2bdfaff8 2bdfaff8 I09a0bd00 I09a0bd00 1 228.7* 265.3 244.7 271.1 - 2 240.2* 243.4 - 247.3 - 3 223.7 275.4 - 263.3 194.1*'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-06-25 20:03:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Peter, that's what I'd expect to see on this patch (since it's only about writes)."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-06-26 02:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve This seems good to me, but given the performance numbers reported previously, we should resolve those behaviors seen. from IRC, notmyname was going to run some tests to confirm or refute the numbers to finalize this.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-06-26 03:30:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Approved Numbers from a few runs with and without this patch: john@europa:~/Documents/swift(review/samuel_merritt/write-affinity)$ PYTHONPATH=. bin/swift-bench -A http://saio:8080/auth/v1.0 -U test:tester -K testing -V 1.0 swift-bench 2013-06-25 20:16:32,117 INFO Auth version: 1.0 swift-bench 2013-06-25 20:16:32,795 INFO Auth version: 1.0 swift-bench 2013-06-25 20:16:34,839 INFO 42 PUTS [0 [{'created': '2013-06-17 19:53:46.000000000', 'message': 'Local write affinity for object PUT requests.

The proxy can now be configured to prefer local object servers for PUT
requests, where "local" is governed by the "write_affinity". The
"write_affinity_node_count" setting controls how many local object
servers to try before giving up and going on to remote ones.

I chose to simply re-order the object servers instead of filtering out
nonlocal ones so that, if all of the local ones are down, clients can
still get successful responses (just slower).

The goal is to trade availability for throughput. By writing to local
object servers across fast LAN links, clients get better throughput
than if the object servers were far away over slow WAN links. The
downside, of course, is that data availability (not durability) may
suffer when drives fail.

The default configuration has no write affinity in it, so the default
behavior is unchanged.

Change-Id: I09a0bd00524544ff627a3bccdcdc48f40720a86e

commit_message:
Local write affinity for object PUT requests.

The proxy can now be configured to prefer local object servers for PUT
requests, where "local" is governed by the "write_affinity". The
"write_affinity_node_count" setting controls how many local object
servers to try before giving up and going on to remote ones.

I chose to simply re-order the object servers instead of filtering out
nonlocal ones so that, if all of the local ones are down, clients can
still get successful responses (just slower).

The goal is to trade availability for throughput. By writing to local
object servers across fast LAN links, clients get better throughput
than if the object servers were far away over slow WAN links. The
downside, of course, is that data availability (not durability) may
suffer when drives fail.

The default configuration has no write affinity in it, so the default
behavior is unchanged.

Added some words about these settings to the admin guide.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I09a0bd00524544ff627a3bccdcdc48f40720a86e

commit_message:
Update kombu requirement

The minimum version of kombu in the requirements
list has been updated to ensure that compatible
kombu and msgpack libraries are used across all
projects. This update also requires a bump for
anyjson.

Addresses bug #1134575

Change-Id: Ic33a5bbc8d1cdf1effd41c1c2aebc7ef6988c39e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Fix pyOpenSSL on Fedora.

On fedora 18 the package pyOpenSSL is conflicting with one of the
packages needed to build the bootstack image. The problem gets sorted
if you install pyOpenSSL at the beginning of the image building process
and this is what this patch is doing.

Change-Id: I681683b81ad638dfeb690fde1bc7d08a2116aaed

[{'created': '2013-06-26 04:00:16.000000000', 'message': "Open keystone service port on Fedora.

This port allow keystone admin without logging in the bootstrap node. The
patch also rename the script making it run before the 98-boot-stack,
the 98-boot-stack will add some rules to the firewall that shouldn't be
saved in the /etc/sysconfig/iptables.

Change-Id: I2497e3ce7b20761bbc29f71f778ba349f6c21b09
"}]
commit_message:
Open keystone service port on Fedora.

This port allow keystone admin without logging in the bootstrap node. The
patch also rename the script making it run before the 98-boot-stack,
the 98-boot-stack will add some rules to the firewall that shouldn't be
saved in the /etc/sysconfig/iptables.

Change-Id: I2497e3ce7b20761bbc29f71f778ba349f6c21b09

[{'created': '2013-06-26 03:55:04.000000000', 'message': 'Tweak seed element NAT rules.

To be able to route traffic to the bootstack control plane, we need to
not mangle it when the traffic is from te kvm host. Libvirt uses
192.168.122.1 as the host IP.

Change-Id: I6ca107ddab2b7d5c3a8ca1233f2f9f2ead11db74
'}]
commit_message:
Tweak seed element NAT rules.

To be able to route traffic to the bootstack control plane, we need to
not mangle it when the traffic is from te kvm host. Libvirt uses
192.168.122.1 as the host IP.

Change-Id: I6ca107ddab2b7d5c3a8ca1233f2f9f2ead11db74

commit_message:
Set a fixed host for nova in boot-stack.

This makes the registration scripts be able to depend on the hostname,
irrespective of the static hostname in the base image used for seed
nodes.

Change-Id: I6bc1c2560d2d548ab99cb6f4129c70e572a918dc

commit_message:
correctly set iface-id in vmware driver

bug 1183452

Commit 70c659059b8fbef811ce79700aecb01c60242ebd updated the vmware
driver to use the new vif model, but was incorrect in how it tried to
grab the iface-id and set it in the vmx file spec.  This patch fixes
that issue and adds a check for this in the existing unit tests.

Change-Id: I756539871d1844a828f9a0a295fc9fa3e59610f7
(cherry picked from commit c028e54f6be75d1cd335550cf5291ddf94f973e3)

commit_message:
port agent API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ib7c489769d9b07797366be5920cc23ab2074a768

commit_message:
Adds v3 API extension discovery filtering

Adds ability for a v3 loaded extension to be visible in
/v3/extensions to be dependent on the discoverable action policy
for that extension. Note that this does not actually effect whether
or not the functionality provided by the extension is accessible

Implements blueprint nova-v3-api-filter

Change-Id: I3f6ba7ea59e7abfa9d57b79ab18aa5b675e64118

commit_message:
Adds link to block storage page from config and admin scheduler pages. Also fixes missed update to admin scheduler page from bug-1192627,

modified link text as per anne https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34048/

updated URL text to reflect latest cinder doc title

bug-1193432

Change-Id: Ie33d039a3f668215d32e18edb8b5b3bea71b9aa6

Well, as Clint correctly pointed out, the unit tests still exist, it's just that the code is no longer in one huge function but is a bit more organised. I'm not sure that testing individual parts of it is especially meaningful... the key thing is that it works in the context of Stack.update() with rollbacks &c. &c.

In any event, this particular implementation will not be around for long (see https://github.com/zaneb/heat/commit/b86f0a67c918dc74c0287afb6731c6fce4e84e3c in particular, and the branch https://github.com/zaneb/heat/commits/parallel-update in general, for where this is going), so adding finer-grained tests is probably a waste of effort at this point."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-06-21 10:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-06-25 22:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Do not merge

We discussed this in the meeting on Monday, and everyone agreed that there isn't really a need for a driver _object_. We don't need to store DB records for every instance of a running driver.

Instead, when we need the API to interact with the drivers, it should be through RPC. We don't have an immediate need for this functionality, but I'm going to put up a BP to show the intention.

I've corrected the ironic-object-model BP, removed "driver" from the Work Items list, and marked the BP as completed as there are no Work Items left.

All that being said, the code in this patch looks good. Please keep up the good work :)'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-06-25 23:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Comments added to the whiteboard here:
  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/driver-api-actions'}, {'account_id': 4919, 'date': '2013-06-26 02:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

we are not really a need for a driver _object_'}]

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-06-02 23:38:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

quick question inline"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-06-03 12:50:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This would not work as you don't implement get_environment() which is what ends up setting the env (see DnsMasqFilter for an example).

There are two issues with implementing EnvFilter as a ChainedFilter: one is that there is no way to get the environment from the EnvFilter and the rest of the command from the filter it chains to (see above). The other is that you actually lower the constraints compared to the current situation. Rather than specifically allowing a specific environment to be passed to a specific command, you also allow any *other* accepted command to be called with the specified environment.

To fix both issues I would not make EnvFilter a ChainedFilter (and specify and check the command directly in EnvFilter, like it's done in current DnsmasqFilter). It's arguably less elegant and evolutive, but it would work and be as restrictive as the current DnsMasqFilter.

Also don't forget to remove the DnsMasqFilter and DeprecatedDnsmasqFilter from filters.py and the tests... We'll get rid of the corresponding filter definitions when we merge this new version in the consuming projects."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-03 13:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-03 15:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

rework to be not a chaining filter as discussed'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-08 13:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-08 13:10:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/29636/4/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/1953 : SUCCESS in 2m 12s
'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-06-11 13:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

See minor comments inline.

My other concern was about Quantum's DnsmasqNetnsFilter... which IIUC allows it to run "A=B ip netns exec dnsmasq". My understanding is that we could have a specific EnvFilter command that would replace it, but I would like to make sure you doublechecked that ;)'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-11 16:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (3 inline comments)

> which IIUC allows it to run "A=B ip netns exec dnsmasq".

Correct. this will not work, however this command should:

"ip netns exec env A=B dnsmasq"

from what I can tell, that does the same thing.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-11 16:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-06-19 09:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

On IRC we talked about having the EnvFilter support being usable with or without "env" as the leading parameter, which makes it more reusable. Your implementation enforces "env" as the leading parameter, any reason why you changed your mind ?

If not, I'd rather have EnvFilter drop the first userargs if it happens to be env, so that it supports both use cases (Quantum currently doesn't use "env" in its dnsmasq calls)'}, {'account_id': 7369, 'date': '2013-06-19 12:42:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-19 14:07:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (4 inline comments)

Right, we talked about making leading env optional, but then you pointed out that Nova uses leading env because it wants to support also the not-using-rootwrap case. So if we want to support that I'd suggest to change the Quantum calls accordingly to also use leading env (but ignore it when using rootwrap)."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-06-19 14:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Actually I want to reduce support for "run without rootwrap" since we may introduce features (python snippets) that will require rootwrap... So I'd prefer not to introduce "env" in Quantum^WNeutron if we can avoid it. Supporting both sounds preferable to me.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-19 16:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-19 16:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Add IpFilter, IPNetnsExecFilter and EnvFilter

These filters have been implemented in Quantum before:

- IpFilter provides support for filtering ip commands
- IpNetnsExecFilter is a chaining command filter that
  verifies that the command to be executed by ip netns exec
  is covered by other established filters.

IpNetnsExecFilter has been restricted to ensure that the
filter chains have all matching filters run as the same
user.

EnvFilter is a new filter derived from CommandFilter
that allows a Command to be optionally prefixed by "env"
and a specific list of environment variables.

This is intended to replace the specific DnsmasqFilter
and DnsmasqNetnsFilter in the future when all consumers
have been updated.

Implements bp rootwrap-quantum-features

Change-Id: I0cf39967126e99a8dc53d21bee824a0fe2f63aa0

commit_message:
Enable uncompress two or more files to same directory

pass metadata_pairs_hook to json.loads, when duplicated keys found in
pairs, return pairs directly, or convert pairs list to dict.

Change-Id: Id82d701eea166361d71a284f8bf446b39bf23915
Fixes: bug #1190875

'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-20 00:59:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-20 01:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Angus Salkeld: So, in trying to implement your suggestions I realized a couple of things:

1. _validate is only called from __init__ in the superclass, so that partially excuses the setting of the member vars there
2. In order to implement your suggestion, I still need to verify the map that's passed in is still valid as json. This lead to me dumping and loading several times unnecessarily and seemed worse than before.
3. For efficiency, I still need self.parsed, since I also implement Mapping and it seemed even more inefficient to continually have to json.loads(self.user_value) every time i needed to supply an iterator.

While I agree its "bad" to create attributes in things that aren't __init__, I think the above justifies it in this case and hope you agree.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 01:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

(3 inline comments)

Some comments inline, but more importantly...

The original rationale for this was to allow us to pass the Metadata as a Pseudo-parameter (blueprint stack-metadata). Since we decided not to do that, I don't think this is required?

Keep this patch around, but I don't think we should merge it unless there's a pressing need. (The patch seems fine, but the *idea* is a hack.)"}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-06-24 00:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Zane this is still needed. There are things like tags, NovaHints, SecurityGroups, Volumes that are maps.
 try:
 git grep "'Type': 'Map'"

 Note: they are normally small maps. So I don't think this is the same kind of issue as sending the Metadata through.'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-24 17:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-24 17:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Allow JSON values for parameters

Adds a paramter type that accepts JSON objects or strings representing JSON
objects as values.

Implements: blueprint json-parameters
Change-Id: I1ad62df28832a2e07249452133fd9f14995f8e23

commit_message:
Fix the current flake8 errors

The test pip ordering was resulting in the pep8 rules not really
running so this fixes that up and the resulting errors so we can
get a clean run.

Change-Id: Icc27be05cd513c4f04135c7e768007dbf9d07b10

commit_message:
Make InstanceList filter non-column extra attributes

This is a no-op right now, but we need to avoid passing things
like fault to the instance_get_all() queries. This will be used
in changes to follow.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I66355a024b139fa6c579e04885ba52f9697381fe

commit_message:
Add Instance.security_groups

This makes Instance load the security_groups list when it
is present in the database object.

It also refactors the way info_cache is saved, so that it
can more easily apply to security_groups as well.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model
Fixes bug 1192003

Change-Id: Ifb028e17ffef7c14557e6389a650d66ce8e9b25c

subject: Add basic SecurityGroup model

There's something I don't like about the get() call in this patch.  The DB call always joins instances...so technically the implementation here is incomplete.  

And you don't really need the get() to support using this object for Instance, I don't think.

But it does feel like if you're going to create this object, we should have some sort of functioning get().  But what I'd like to see done to get() before it lands is:

make the DB call support 'extra_attrs'... and only join instances if requested.  And then make your get() here never join instances..  but allow it to be loaded via obj_attr_load() or whatever that method is.

Or it would be extremely beautiful to find out security_group['instances'] is not used anywhere and we can stop joining :)"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-20 19:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-20 19:59:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add basic SecurityGroup model

This adds a basic SecurityGroup model and query methods.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I92a18529add3e46e801a30e35cdbd4932c890a55

subject: Refresh volume connections when starting instances

[{'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2013-06-06 18:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2013-06-06 18:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2013-06-06 19:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-06 19:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-06-11 15:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-06-11 16:39:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Inline comments."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-06-11 16:55:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

agree with Nikola that we should be using the existing code. Also I'm not convinced that this should be handled by adding new manager code. Libvirt explicitly connects to volumes in _create_domain_and_network if the block device mapping is passed in. AFAIK it should be reconnecting to these during spawn/reboot/resume so if there is a case where reconnect is failing I suspect there is a bug."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-06-11 18:08:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As has already been stated, block device connections should already be re-established on reboot.  I submitted a series of patches which resolved essentially every condition where a) block device connections were not re-established, b) vifs/firewall rules were not re-created.

If that's not currently happening, we need a way to reproduce the problem because it's quite likely we have a bug in the current re-connection logic (it's definitely there and being called)."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-06-11 18:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

We just had a discussion on IRC about this.  It turns out the issue is when calling "nova start", which translates to driver.power_on().  I can confirm this code path does not re-establish block device connections.

However, my -1 stands, as the approach to resolving this issue should be consistent with what we've done elsewhere (resume(), resume_state_on_host_boot(), reboot_instance(), etc.), whereby the compute manager was updated to pass network_info and block_device_info into all the drivers for power_on(). Then, the libvirt power_on() call should simply call _hard_reboot().'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress

While the tests pass, I need to do some more ad-hoc system testing before re-opening this review.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'created': '2013-06-06 19:36:01.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patch adds a method for re-establishing configurations for attached
volumes when an instance is started or rebooted. A new method is
added to the virtualization driver interface for reconnecting volumes.
On instance startup, the stored block device mappings are iterated and
the reconnect method invoked for each one. NotImplemented exceptions
are caught as, for the time being, only the libvirt implementation is
available. When the reconnect method is called, the virtualization
driver implementation should perform whatever operations are necessary
(e.g. mount a filesystem, instantiate an iSCSI session) for the
instance to successfully start.

Fixes bug: 1188326

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153

commit_message:
Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patches adds network and block device information to the signature
of the power_on method on the virtualization driver. The relevant call
sites are also modified to provide the required information. The libvirt
implementation of power_on has been altered to re-establish network and
volume related connections.

Fixes bug: 1188326

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153

commit_message:
Port quota API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I29bb4dd7d1a8acaa3e91e5f0ec5c073d3d9756fc

commit_message:
Add new optional "data_iter" argument to SwiftBackupService.backup

Introduce new optional data_iter argument to SwiftBackupService.backup
which allows drivers to forward stream iterators to the backup services

Change-Id: Ie5cb280c058cb9cb0574db5dda912e83d638f3a7

commit_message:
Implement backup_volume for RBDDriver over Swift

Allow backing up of Ceph images over Swift. Instead of mapping or
exporting a ceph Image to a path and calling the backup from the
BackendService, a stream is created and backed up instead (no need to
dump the volume to a local temp path).

Change-Id: I27fa25a93cec70ee7b5b9c7b6b2b919803b91a46

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-25 04:09:41.000000000', 'message': 'Use os.path.join with cli_dir

Use os.path.join to create final cli path.  This allows the path to be
specified in the same way as the extant "bin_dir" provided to the
whitebox tests; this is useful to a top-level driver like devstack so
it doesn't have to worry about differences with trailing /'s

TODO: create one global config for both?

commit_message:
Use os.path.join with cli_dir

Use os.path.join to create final cli path.  This allows the path to be
specified in the same way as the extant "bin_dir" provided to the
whitebox tests; this is useful to a top-level driver like devstack so
it doesn't have to worry about differences with trailing /'s

TODO: create one global config for both?

Change-Id: Ied5a62993fa9a62fd06cc0341888c5cbc62c8a91

[{'created': '2013-06-25 14:51:43.000000000', 'message': 'Improve implementation of RBDDriver.backup_volume

Instead of mapping or exporting the the volume, it is wrapped in
a new class that implements the read and tell functionalities of a
file. This allows us to stream the content from the rbd volume
directly (better performance and less disk usage)

Change-Id: I8d59f2ad6ffdb8085584a5d07f517dfaf60fca8a
'}]
commit_message:
Improve implementation of RBDDriver.backup_volume

Instead of mapping or exporting the the volume, it is wrapped in
a new class that implements the read and tell functionalities of a
file. This allows us to stream the content from the rbd volume
directly (better performance and less disk usage)

Change-Id: I8d59f2ad6ffdb8085584a5d07f517dfaf60fca8a

commit_message:
Return Customer's Quota Usage through Admin API

Modified the used limits API for Admin to retrieve
the used limits for a customer. Changes done to the
nova client to fetch limits for a given tenant.

This is related to changes made in nova,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27468/

Change-Id: Id53576eb35d6dab7cb655f8427091e95a6f75a6d
Implements: blueprint customer-quota-through-admin-api

'}, {'created': '2013-06-25 22:27:06.000000000', 'message': 'Enable pxe_network_config option.

This option tells the nova baremetal driver to append the network

commit_message:
Enable pxe_network_config option.

This option tells the nova baremetal driver to append the network
configuration to the kernel cmdline when pxe booting the baremetal
image. Initramfs built with network support could then benefit from
this option and avoid the need of having the network configuration file
injected into the image.

Change-Id: I757dbb8224a9e0eee64da4ee71da5567b18b3892

Add "NONZEROCONF=yes" to /etc/sysconfig/network to prevent
169.254.0.0 route from being created. This route interferes

Change-Id: Iad77abfc97c0eba944680772f233389481a270ff

commit_message:
Fix cloud-init routing issue on Fedora

Add "NONZEROCONF=yes" to /etc/sysconfig/network to prevent
169.254.0.0 route from being created. This route interferes
with fedora baremetal nodes' access to the nova metadata
server at 169.254.169.254.

Change-Id: Iad77abfc97c0eba944680772f233389481a270ff

commit_message:
Fix trivial mismatch of license header

Hacking H102 checks for a literal version of the
Apache2 license header to match. Fix the trivial
mismatch. See
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/HACKING.rst
for how the license header should look like.

Change-Id: Ib5770bd447653c7b79aef084c29f09f8c32cf739

commit_message:
Register used CONF entries in cinder.api.common.py

After change: I2114d5fc45f5299c3b2011270034a3370e0ec388 we
were no longer registering defaults for cinder.api.common.py settings.

The result is that you're unable to run individual unit tests like
cinder.tests.api.test_volume_metadata.py.

Register the needed CONF options and we're all set again.

Fixes bug: 1194315

Change-Id: I6df6c5ec5687c8156a9f3794cc7f04d8d28065d9

'}, {'created': '2013-06-25 21:25:01.000000000', 'message': 'Firewall as a Service (FWaaS) Iptables Driver

blueprint quantum-fwaas-iptables-driver

This is work in progress of IPTables Driver for
"Firewall As A Service" feature.

This diff implements the basic interfaces for
L3 agent to call into the driver. The interface
with IPTables Manager needs some more changes.

At a high level, following are missing
- IPTables Manager is not aware of network namespace.
- The policy structure that is obtained from
  L3 agent may change.
- Unit test are missing and are being worked on
- file location may change

Change-Id: Ia24449318c93bfe0f6375c44cac61e85bdfc4e81
'}]
commit_message:
Firewall as a Service (FWaaS) Iptables Driver

blueprint quantum-fwaas-iptables-driver

This is work in progress of IPTables Driver for
"Firewall As A Service" feature.

This diff fixes errors reported by PEP8.

Change-Id: Ia24449318c93bfe0f6375c44cac61e85bdfc4e81

commit_message:
Replace glance_metadata check with bootable column.

This patch adds a column to indicate if a volume is bootable or not.

Cinder API V1 was using get.volume_glance_metadata to determine
if a volume was bootable for translate_view.

This is fine until you put a heavy load on the system and things
can fall apart, particularly the backref of the glance meta is no longer
available and the call blows up.  Also this results in a bit of extra
unnecessary data being passed around with every create and get call.
This is especially an issue when creating hundreds or thousands of volumes.
Even better we can now reliably create thousands of volumes.

Fixes bug: 1192390

Change-Id: Idd47a0a8069ee905b81c7aae562b82767ad91930

commit_message:
Implement reset-state (os-reset_status) action

This change implements a reset-state method in the
cinderclient which exposes the extension: os-reset_status
from the Cinder API.

Fix bug 1190731

Change-Id: I8f631f0f19ca16e0fdd1e3adcf923cc684292887

commit_message:
Refactor DiskFile instantiation in object server.

DiskFile() takes a lot of arguments whose value is the same on every
instantiation, so I pulled that stuff out into a utility method. No
functionality change is intended.

Change-Id: I259df5602bed60d6cb48e07d6d9e58e8320ee12a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-19 20:09:34.000000000', 'message': 'Allow scheduler manager NoValidHost exception to pass over RPC

Calls to scheduler.manager.select_hosts are expected to throw NoValidHost
exceptions if no hosts match such requests. For the exception to be passed
over RPC, the method must be decorated with:

@rpc_common.client_exceptions(exception.NoValidHost)

Resolves bug 1192693.

Change-Id: If9d1f15ff1239e422067893f9d837c41e5f5474d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow scheduler manager NoValidHost exception to pass over RPC

Calls to scheduler.manager.select_hosts are expected to throw NoValidHost
exceptions if no hosts match such requests. For the exception to be passed
over RPC, the method must be decorated with:

@rpc_common.client_exceptions(exception.NoValidHost)

Resolves bug 1192693.

Change-Id: If9d1f15ff1239e422067893f9d837c41e5f5474d

[{'created': '2013-06-25 20:06:07.000000000', 'message': "blueprint VPNaaS-Python-API
VPNaaS DataModel/Plugin

This is work in progress towards the first
iteration.

It is meant to provide the basic
API and DataModel for the VPN Advanced
Service Plugin

NOTE: For now the unit tests are not included.

The basic idea for providing these API's
and DataModel is to get it reviewed and also
for the team members to work on other parts
of the reference implementation

Added cidr_list function to attributes.py
Added more tests into tests_db_vpnaas
Directory structure refactored
Removed port-id from vpnservice

commit_message:
blueprint VPNaaS-Python-API
VPNaaS DataModel/Plugin

This is work in progress towards the first
iteration.

It is meant to provide the basic
API and DataModel for the VPN Advanced
Service Plugin

NOTE: For now the unit tests are not included.

The basic idea for providing these API's
and DataModel is to get it reviewed and also
for the team members to work on other parts
of the reference implementation

Added cidr_list function to attributes.py
Added more tests into tests_db_vpnaas
Directory structure refactored
Removed port-id from vpnservice
Fixed bugs based on initial review
Fixed pep8 warnings on test_vpnaas_plugin.py file

Change-Id: Ibf9fb001992baa73c9bcf616a34db619f0427bfd

commit_message:
Added helper to return IP address of given interface

Rather than relying on an ohai plugin, added `#address_for` method, which
returns the IPv4 (default) address of the given interface.

Change-Id: If42cd94d4f33b1f2cebcccfa5a982944b37cd676

commit_message:
Add sample rsyslog.conf.

Give users a sample rsyslog.conf to manage their logs easily based on
LOCAL0 swift used. In this patch I offer some choices to output logs
via commnet lines or uncomment.

Change-Id: I2fe150a6e3d164a989c3520c0b7f032897a71f18

subject: Fix swift-dispersion-report.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-21 23:52:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/34061/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/2876 : SUCCESS in 40s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/34061/1/check/gate-swift-docs/2706/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 00s
